story:
What is Grow Up to Be ( Crescer a Ser®)?

"By educating the minds of our children, we can not forget to educate their hearts. "
Dalai Lama

We live in a society that suffers with hurry, pressure, stress, anxiety, aggression, violence, concentration problems, excessive stimuli, hyperactivity, uncontrollable and emotional imbalance, attention deficit, relational conflicts, ... among others, obtaining in the Social, Family and Education contexts.

Such as school and family can help young people in their challenges? How to integrate "know" to "how to be"? How do we help the "feel", the "create" and the "express"?

Grow Up to be/Crescer a Ser ® is a complementary model of educational guidance.
Designed to support the growth of children and teens in a holistic approach, cultivating physical, mental and emotional development through meditation, mindfulness, emotional education and various other tools that foster a more conscious development of self, of others and of Life as a whole.

How It Works?

We give regular classes for children and teens where:

- They learn to know, accept and manage their emotions, promoting the ability to self-regulation and self-control, making it less reactive children.

  - They learn to live in the present moment, releasing anxiety, expectation and consequent frustration.

  - They learn to recognize the need to relax and how to relax, enjoy getting deep moments of relaxation.

  - They learn various breathing techniques with different objectives, thus regulating their state of tiredness, agitation, aggression, apathy, etc.

And We also do Workshops with parents and educators on topics related to conscious parenting.


What Do We Want to Accomplish in Lousã?

Lousã is a beautiful Portuguese town with about 17,600 inhabitants, and about 2400 students enrolled in Public Schools Group.

This paradise with plenty of natural and historical beauty is located about 30km from the district capital, Coimbra. It is a economically deprived region in the country, and the situation worsened with the European economic crisis and the end of the railway transport. . The train was connecting to Coimbra to favor some economic growth and facilitate transportation to work of the population.

Now we need, more than ever, to create value in place, and continue to strive for a new means of transport for the population.

We want to implement the project Grow Up to Be/Crescer a Ser® in Lousã, which is an affordable way for the whole population.

How will this be?

- We want to do about 18-20 hours/classes per week in public schools within the school hours, during this first school year (2015/2016) for children from 4 years and adolescents!

- We want to open our office for private lessons with ​​accessible values to the population and also with accompaniments individualized for children and families who need it!

- We wanta to conduct workshops for parents and families dealing conscious parenting, expression, meditation, self-esteem, motivation and personal entrepreneurship!

- We want to make a big festival designs for children and adults to rescue and create new forms of expression!

- And then everything is in place and going well, we also want to do classes of  Meditation, Mindfulness and Emotional Education with elderly gentlemen and  ladies!


It is A Lot of Things, isn't It? :) That's why We Need Your Help!!!

We want to improve the Life Quality of People!
Create moments of silence to calm emotions and thoughts from an early age!
Train and develop the Concentration Capacity!
Developing Sensitivity, Creativity, Self-Esteem and Motivation!
Develop Sense of Gratitude!
Helping Children and Youth to "further study" and Be Happier and Entrepreneurs Adults Tomorrow !


Help us to realize this project and will soon bring news about the effects and positive results in our children and youth!

If you do not want to use a credit card, you can help us with a bank tranfer:

IBAN: PT50 0018 0003 3551 8331020 39

Each 1 € will help us to do this in this school year! Thanks!

story:
Short Summary of 'The School Reunion'

Pencils of Promise were formed by Adam Braun 10 years ago! They have helped to build over 400 Schools across the World. And they are just getting started!

We have helped unsigned recording artists for these last 5 years in particular, to either get signed to Major management companies, or to get them on tour, or to help them to increase there income by teaching musicians some great marketing strategies.

The campaign is about helping to raise as much money and awareness as possible so that Pencils of Promise can continue to build schools across the world every year. This is very important because education is important. Yet in some countries there are millions of people that will not understand how to read, write, or do basic maths. So building schools in many communities across the world is vital so that we can continue to give underprivileged people the opportunity that we had whilst growing up!

Making a donation of any amount, regardless if you purchase one of the perks, or you want to donate a smaller sum of money, will help to make a difference. Every pound that is donated will take us a step closer to reaching our target of building another school.

Although we are in the process of raising £35,000, our actual target is £100,000 for the year. We believe that we can achieve a third of our target by way of public donations. The rest will come from CD, download, and streaming sales of the album ‘The School Reunion’. And there will be plenty of live events where we will raise more funds from ticket sales and clothing merchandise. We expect to attract a decent size crowd as we are working with some amazing talent including Scott Bugg & the Vital Few who are touring with Jake Bugg this year. We are also working with artists that are signed to record companies who will also be touring.

The money raised will not just be for building schools, but to also purchase the logistics to fill the schools with desks, chairs, laptops, textbooks, and much more, and to pay a salary to the teachers. This is why our real target is £100,000.

The perks will give a lot of people the opportunity to watch the making of the commercial at ITV Studios, and to learn about the industry and what it takes to become a success in the world of entertainment. There will also be live shows so that you can watch talented musicians perform live. We will also have comedians performing to spice up the events. Everyone will also have the opportunity to listen to the album for free as from the 22nd June, because even if you are not a paying subscriber to any of the Major Music Streaming platforms, then listening to the album will still make the charity around 50p.

If we do not reach any of our targets, then we will use our own personal money to make up the difference. That is how passionate we are in wanting to help less fortunate individuals all over the world!

story:
____________

WE TECH CARE

____________

Despite the developed IT infrastructures, yet, not everyone living in Armenia has an opportunity to become a user of those “Made in Armenia” technological novelties. Hence “New Technology Education Fund” Charitable Foundation joins “Technology and Science Dynamics” LLC and calls the world to contribute to the bright future of bright generation living close to the “darkest” borders of Armenia. All donation will be directed to provide kids living in borderline communities of the Republic of Armenia with 2 in 1 Armtab Tablet PCs.

________

The Impact

A 2 in 1 Armtab tablet will not only help children in the classroom, but open for them the endless opportunities in the boundless world of knowledge and information. This will enable them to study, design and develop new ideas and new perspectives for better and brighter future in their local communities. Education and access to information will set them free from daily boundaries and leave positive effects on future change-makers’ lives.

________

Armenia has a leading position among nations with rapidly growing information technology (IT) sector. In 2015, the world was introduced to the first Armenian tablets and smartphones developed and produced in Armenia by Technology & Science Dynamics LLC.  Today, the company remains as the first and only producer of tablets and smartphones in Armenia. The company believes in empowerment of new generation through technologies and supports projects and initiatives targeting children and youth. 

TSD Hardware Manufacturing Plant (HMP) is the first and the only facility in CIS (excluding Russian Federation), Caucasus and Middle East (excluding Israel) region with capabilities to produce various types of electronics.

The opportunity for technology to be a force for innovation, education and change in the developing world has been widely acknowledged, with digital tools now recognized for their positive effects on children's lives across the globe.

________

Why ArmTab?

ArmTab tablets are reliable, inexpensive, state-of-the-art mobile devices. 2 in 1 ArmTab tablet with detachable keyboard‏ comes with Windows 10 OS, which serves as an easy and excellent combination of two technologies in one: for those people who often use tablets as an advanced educational tool and are in quest of transformational technology solutions. Detailed specifications HERE.

________

You are the changemaker now. By investing in their future,

you invest in your safety, you invest in Armenia.

________

New Technology Education Fund firmly believes that this campaign is a small but important investment in the development of economy of Armenia. The aim of donation is to make technological innovations available for children at borderline communities making them the first users of innovations developed in Armenia

__________

NTEF  Mission

New Technology Education Fund (NTEF) is an Armenian charitable foundation. The core idea of the foundation is to boost development, interconnection of science, new technologies and education, as well as to work for the intersection of the mentioned focused areas. The foundation’s activity is aimed at the realization of innovative ideas, cooperation establishment and exchange of experience with international organizations. 

Learn more at: Ntefund.org

Facebook || Twitter || Linkedin

story:
HAVE FUN WHILE LEARNING ROBOTICS

We live in a technology enabled world. In the next 10-15 years there will be rapid advancement in robotics, artificial intelligence and machine learning which will transform jobs, our way of life, and the way we interact with technology. To get the new generation of kids ready for what is to come, we are offering VEELER - an Open Source Robot Platform.

VEELER is a robot designed to be a platform which can be reprogrammed, hacked and extended.

MODULAR APPROACH

The base board is designed in such a way as to add multiple boards layered over it which opens possibilities to add customized board for custom solutions.

BASE BOARD

Base board includes multiple sensors and modules required to interact with the robot.

  • Motor Controller: This controls the four metal geared motors attached to VEELER
  • RGB LED : Twin RGB LED's are used as indicators which can be individually controlled to showcase any one of the rainbow colors
  • Buzzer : Mute robot makes no sense. We added a buzzer to indicate any actions
  • Mode Button : Use button control to turn on/off the robot, or switch robot modes or program it for any custom actions
  • Light Sensor : VEELER knows if it is day or night. The light sensor helps VEELER control RGB LED's intensity considering the ambient light
  • Infrared Transmitter : Coordinate multiple robots using the infrared transmitter. Get a set of VEELERs and create your own SWARM robots
  • Infrared Receiver : Included Infrared Remote controller can be used to control the robot. Use it to navigate a path, control LEDs, Buzzer and modes. For SWARM robots, the receiver can be used to receive signals from other robots

    CONTROL BOARD

    This is the brain board which controls VEELER. The board has an Atmel AVR Chip which can be programmed in C/C++. The default setup comes with Arduino boot-loader and can be programmed using open source Arduino IDE.

    BLUETOOTH BOARD

    This is an add-on board which sits on top of controller board. VEELER can be controlled by an Android application via Bluetooth.

    VEELER CHASSIS

    Now keeping in mind that users will be editing, upgrading and basically pounding away on this little robot, strength and tolerance becomes very important factors. Thus we have the all aluminum chassis making it almost unbreakable. Four wheel driven VEELER with all metal gear motors gives it the ability to  maneuver freely and allows it to almost turn on a dime. Drive it over mud, rocks, grass or sand, it just keeps going.

    OLED

    VEELER has a built-in OLED that can be used to display emotions, text or direction. Open Source library makes sure you can tweak and edit it.

    POWER SOURCE

    VEELER comes with 7.4v Lithium-ion battery holder with built in Battery Management System (BMS). Just add two 18650 batteries, turn on the switch and the fun begins. Out of juice? We have included a charger so that the fun continuous.

    ROBOT MODES

    VEELER can either run on Autonomous mode or manual control.

    Autonomous Mode : Turn on Autonomous mode and the robot whizzes through any terrain while avoiding obstacles. The sonar sensor makes sure VEELER does not hit your cat.

    Manual Mode : Use your remote controller or the mobile application to control the robot. Change its speed at run-time, LED colors and the buzzer, all while driving on sand, mud or grass.

    Line Follower Mode : Attach two line following sensors and the robot surprises you by following a line. Add two tracks and challenge a race between two VEELER's.

    Since there are additional free pins, adding multiple sensors is a breeze.

    ONE ROBOT, ONE CHANGE

    Gift your loved ones a VEELER and make a difference. VEELER helps them learn programming, mechanics and logic, all while having fun. This is a new way of STEM learning.

    What do we do with the funds?

    • We are looking for funding to get this prototype into production.
    • Since the complete testing and development is complete, the funding will be used for manufacturing PCB's, Assembly, Laser cutting and anodizing of aluminum and lastly for marketing these products to every corner of the world

    A Positive Impact

    • We would love to see the world change with technology. VEELER will help people understand the changing technology around
    • Inspires kids to think creatively to use VEELER in more ways as they come across new challenges
    • Since the robot is designed to be modular, users can add additional sensors and modules

    We have spent the last year and a half working on this tiny yet powerful robot and are now ready to go from prototype to a finished product. We need your help to get this robot into production. Please help us make VEELER a reality and spread the word.

story:
Hello, how are you today? If you understood and were able to read this far then, you are more educated than 60% of the girls in Nepal. That says something. 

 
   

Some months ago I went to a butchers’ shop, and saw a little girl there, cutting meat with a sharp knife. I asked her where her father was, thinking she was just playing around but she said she is responsible to butcher the meat now. I was shocked, she was only 9 years old and she was slaughtering animals.

I asked her if she goes to school and she said no, she needs to help her parents out, she also said she doesn’t want to butcher animals and become a killer. That line really made an impact on me.

For the next few weeks I saw that this was a trend, there were girls all over the city that had to stop their education in order to help their families. In most cases parents wanted their child to have an education but it just wasn’t possible financially. If things were this bad in the city center, imagine how bad it is in rural areas.

Unfortunately, female education has been neglected in Nepal for centuries since education in Nepal isn’t free, and paying for a girl isn’t a priority. Due to this, girls suffer from being forced to grow up too fast. Instead of getting an education and having a childhood they have to work without getting paid for their parents; become a maid, wash dishes and clean houses; in some cases get abused while working. In Nepal 40% of girls are forced into child marriage before they turn 18-years old, just so the “burden’ of being a girl is given to someone else. And it only gets worse from here, due to girls not being in school the chances of them getting trafficked increase by 62% which is a massive risk, however together we can help little girls have a childhood where their only problem is homework.

This is when I thought I should do something about it, and this is where I need all your helping hands to make a difference in their lives.

This campaigns goal is to give an education to girls who cant go to school due to family circumstances. You and I both will have to join hands for this movement. For each of your contributions we will be able to give education to girls by putting them into schools, giving them uniforms, books and stationary hence giving them a chance for a successful future.

By funding this movement, you will not just be buying some books or tuition fees; but instead you will be funding the future of marginalized girls who want to become someone, who are part of our future.

After all they say :

"If you teach a man, you teach an individual but if you teach a woman, you teach the whole family,"

 

Our goal is to sponsor education for 100 girls aged between 8-16 years old.

With the fund collected we will:

It’s a simple three step strategy but it will change the lives of the girls and their family. If you are looking for a charity to fund in, then please fund this one as every penny we raise will be put to good use. Our target is to fund 100 girls for a year, however if we exceed our target we can fund more children which would be beyond amazing.

Other ways you can Help:

Even if you don’t have the budget to donate you can still be part of this cause by helping us spread the word. Share this to your friends, family, community and your social media so others can donate. Let’s change the lives of girls 100 at a time. Let’s take the first step together.

For each of your contributions we will be able to give education to girls by putting them into schools, giving them uniforms, books and stationary hence giving them a chance for a successful future.By funding this movement, you will not just be buying some books or tuition fees; but instead you will be funding the future of marginalized girls who want to become someone, who are part of our future.After all they say :"If you teach a man, you teach an individual but if you teach a woman, you teach the whole family," Our goal is to sponsor education for 100 girls aged between 8-16 years old.With the fund collected we will:It’s a simple three step strategy but it will change the lives of the girls and their family. If you are looking for a charity to fund in, then please fund this one as every penny we raise will be put to good use. Our target is to fund 100 girls for a year, however if we exceed our target we can fund more children which would be beyond amazing.Other ways you can Help:Even if you don’t have the budget to donate you can still be part of this cause by helping us spread the word. Share this to your friends, family, community and your social media so others can donate. Let’s change the lives of girls 100 at a time. Let’s take the first step together.

story:
Africa Soul Train Circus is a grassroots international circus troupe that is fundraising to build a circus school for African Youth in Cape Coast, Ghana. Currently based on Saltpring Island, BC, Africa Soul Train Circus is an international collaboration of Ghana and Canada, directed by Canadian aerialist & director Marley Skye and  Ghana born bowl spinner, acrobat, and roots-life reggae artist, Mr.Fantastik. JEFFREY WOOD,

The goal of Africa Soul Train Circus is to build and run a circus school for international talent, learning and performing arts development for orphans, street kids, and young artists that need support in Ghana. This school would provide the facilites and teachers to support youth in attaining their dreams.
Our goal is to raise at least $20,000 by March 1st, 2015, to provide enough money to bring us to Ghana and start the building of the circus school. 
Africa Soul Train Circus is also collaborating with Ghana artists, to co-produce a very large outdoor street carnival in Cape Coast on March 7th, 2015 to further promote the circus school project.
Currently, Africa Soul Train Circus is doing a West Coast Canada Fundraising Tour for the school project. They are touring 10 communities, running circus camps and evening circus/music shows for all ages. Proceeds all go to supporting this project. 
For more info, 
FB: africa soul train circus school
see www.astcsghana.org

story:
Robots in the 9th Century?

It's true. Islamic scientists were a beacon of educational light in Europe's Dark Ages, not only preserving classic works that would have been otherwise lost, but creating new ideas and fields of study.  The Banū Mūsā (sons of Mūsā) were three brothers living in 9th century Baghdad who wrote numerous books on science.  Written in 850, The Book of Ingenious Devices was one of their finest, providing examples of nearly one hundred different automata and related devices.  Sadly, it's very nearly been lost to the public.

Not only is this a scientifically important book, but it's also culturally significant.  At a time when an Islamic student can be arrested for bringing a home-made clock to school, it's important for us reflect upon the contributions that Islamic scientists have made in the past (and can make in the future).  Most importantly, this is a fun book!  We're not interested in presenting a dry, scholarly critique of The Book (although you can buy one on Amazon right now, if you have $300 to spare).  Our book will be aimed at a general reader who wants to enjoy seeing these innovative and entertaining designs (and yes, it's a suitable gift for a child interested in science).  We already have distribution secured for this book and it will be available at a reasonable retail price.

Our Goals and Our Costs

Our modest goal is to print 500 paperback copies of The Book of Ingenious Devices.  100 will be donated to libraries and 400 will be made available for consumer purchase.

The two main expenses are technical illustration and translation.   The book's original illustrations are impressive, but they are a product of their time.  We'll hire a technical illustrator who can reproduce the diagrams in a form that is more readable and pleasing to the modern eye.  We'll also translate the text into English, with an view toward presenting short, concise explanations of each device.

Additional expenses are printing the books (not a small cost by any means), shipping out the books, and a small budget ($500) for advertising.

Because we can't do anything with, for example, three illustrations or half a translation, this is an all-or-nothing funding project.  If we surpass our goals, we'll be able to print more books, donate to more libraries, and offer a premium version of the book. 

Can I Buy One For My Local School or Library?

Yes.  See the Perks section for more details.  Making a copy of this book available to a library, reading room, school or cultural organization is an excellent gift of wisdom. 

    Why Is This Important?

    Educationally, this book does double duty: it's a science book, but it also preserves a piece of scientific history.  A book about mechanical devices is certainly fun, but when that book is almost 1200 years old, it's fascinating!

    While we've been planning the launch of this campaign for some time, we decided it was time to scoot it out the door right now because it helps advance an important discussion about disparity in science education.  People of all backgrounds have made important contributions to science.  The absolutely crucial work of Islamic scientists is often neglected entirely by Western educational systems.  Given recent events, we felt that the best way we could showcase the potential contributions of present and future Islamic scientists was to showcase this amazing collection of inventions from the past. 

    We strongly believe that the science and the science history of The Book of Ingenious Devices needs to be available to regular people at a reasonable price. 

    Why Worry About Print In The Digital Age?

    There are a number of good reasons why this information should be committed to print.  Firstly, the original language of the book is Arabic, and an English translation opens the work up to an entirely new audience of readers. 

    Additionally, the internet has proven itself astoundingly inept at archiving The Book of Ingenious Devices.  Most of the online notes and diagrams about the book actually refer to the confusingly-named "Book of Knowledge of Ingenious Mechanical Devices" written three hundred years later by a scientist named Al-Jazari who had read the original book. The internet image most commonly associated with our book is an automated clock depicting a man riding an elephant.  But that's a design of Al-Jazari's from 300 years later, not one by the Banū Mūsā.  We legitimately fear that if this important piece of scientific history is not reprinted,  it will be absorbed by Al-Jazari's later book in humanity's collective memory, or forgotten altogether. 

    We also believe that a physical book serves a purpose and has a value as an instrument of learning in a classroom, a repository of knowledge in a library, or a method of conveying educational or cultural value when given to another person as a gift.  

    Can We Do It?

    Spearheading this project is Patrick Rodgers, who as the CEO of an independent record label, guided nearly 100 albums from inception to store shelf, including one by Neil Gaiman.  If this project is fully funded, you can rest assured that we'll facilitate the publication of this book in a careful and professional manner.

    Is This A Religious Book?

    No. This is strictly a science book. 

    Robots? Seriously?

    By dictionary definition standards, yes. There are mechanical devices in here that are capable of operating on their own, including a water-powered organ that stayed in use for nearly a thousand years until it was replaced by the player piano.  There is an automatic flute player that some have argued may be the world's first programmable machine.  A number of very clever clock and fountain designs are here as well.  There's no Wall-E or Rosie the Robot to be found in this text, but the devices invented by the Musa brothers are far more advanced than what most people imagine existed in the 9th century. 

    Listen to three minutes (8:23-11:35) of Fraunhofer Institute of Technology scholar Michael Wolf's lecture on The Book of Ingenious Devices:


    Wolf wrote, "I had the privilege to be involved in a few museum and exhibition projects around the history of Science and Technology in the Middle East and it was then when I learned about the Banu Musa brothers, who authored the "Book of ingenious devices", which comprises of designs and plans for the most wondrous automata like this perpetual flute. This device tilts from one side to the other and plays three tones on a whistle when water is filled into the funnel at the top.   Sometimes referred to as trick devices, these machines, some of which were based on translations of Greek manuscripts, used - at the time - sophisticated technologies such as siphons, leavers, pistons, floats and clock mechanisms to astound their followers with magic, or more precise, trick them with technology. In order not to raise suspicion in the audience, the technology in these devices was hidden behind a facade, invisible to the user. All the audience did was pour water, pull a leaver or push a button and the machine did 'the magic'. They created a black box and a user interface."

    You can also read a little more about the book on Wikipedia

      If You Can't Contribute...

      Please help spread the word about our campaign.  If you watch or read any blogs or shows about science, books, or history, please send them a link to our campaign.  And of course, Indiegogo Share Tools are wonderful as well.

story:
With 10 years experience in the swimming industry we are passionate about swimming and water safety. Founder, Anna spent 6 months in The Gambia training swimming teachers on a voluntary basis through the Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme. On return, she was determined to set up something larger scale training swimming teachers and setting up swim schools in developing countries.  

A sustainable route to raise finances was required and so Shoreward was born.  A stylish, fashionable and fun range of water related products that give everyone an enjoyment of the water, spread the water safety message and raise funds to support training internationally.  

We require start up capital for the following:

- Buy the first to buy the first batch of stock

 - Do some marketing online

- Attend 3 key water sports events over the summer introduce the new brand to the general public.  

We are starting with Ducks and plan to expand to towels, bath products, swimwear, waterbottles and other water related products. 

Ducks are just the start!

We have suppliers lined up so the only risk to supply is a longer lead time than quoted by the suppliers.  If this happens we will contact backers to explain the delay.  

20% of profits will be spent training swimming teachers and setting up swim schools in developing countries in partnership with key organisations including the RLSS.

story:
The Campaign

We are three engineers who came to Bangladesh to work on garment sector for a European Brand and have been here since 2012,2014 and 2015.

People in this country are very friendly and we like to be here a lot but due to tough living conditions they are having lots of difficulties which make us feel sad. It is even dangerous for kids and not providing a future for them.

Due to our work, we are going many parts of the country to check the factories. This is how we found out an orphanage in a rural side of Dhaka, called Kishoreganj. 192 boys without a mother or father are living in this place and sleeping on the ground even without a pillow. In the same buildings, these 192 boys and also more 158 boys from the same village are getting education. They don't even have anything to write or read, just listening the teachers in the classes.

The buildings are not safe as they are very old with structural problems, full of rust and has humidity issue. The kitchen and toilets are a mess. Kids are cleaning their self in the dirty lake in front of the orphanage.

We have been trying to help them after we found out this place but what we can is limited so not solving their major problems. This is why we need your support.

 

The Plan

Above is the plan of whole place. There are fours rooms where kids are sleeping and a classroom but the classroom is in a terrible condition, it may collapse anytime, this is why they use regular rooms as a classroom also. We want to fix those rooms and maintain the classroom, also build a single layer dormitory behind those buildings as there is a garden which belongs to orphanage but they don't use. This building and three small rooms will be used as dorms. Big room and classroom will be used as classroom because current classroom is not enough for 350 kids even we maintain it.

Also kitchen and toilets are in terrible condition. We can not even consider the kitchen as a kitchen which is actually more like a storage without any equipments except some rusty and dirty pots. There is no water in kitchen and toilets. Kids use the manual pump to get water and also clean their self in the dirty lake so we want to rebuild those and bring water to kitchen and toilets by using a water tank. Kids will also be able to have a shower with clean water.

We found constructors to discuss all of these to get a price by using our local contacts and they are asking 80.000USD to do all below:

  • Maintaining four rooms.
  • Building a dormitory behind the existing building.
  • Rebuilding the kitchen and toilet, adding showers.
  • Providing 100 bunk beds for the kids who are sleeping in the orphanage.
  • Providing cupboards, mattresses, pillow and quilts.

If we can collect more than this amount, we will provide materials to kids for better education. Build wall around the lake and extend the current garden which is small for 350 kids.

ROOM #1

 

ROOM #2

 

ROOM #3

 

ROOM #4

 

ROOMS - OUTSIDE VIEW

 

CLASSROOM - OUTSIDE VIEW

 

CLASSROOM - They are not able to use as it can collapse anytime

 

GARDEN VIEW

 

LAKE

 

This is how kids clean theirself in the dirty lake

 

TOILET

 

KITCHEN - OUTSIDE VIEW

 

KITCHEN

 

How they get water

 

The Impact on Kids' Life

The most important impact will be putting a big smile to kids' face. That's more valuable than anything as these kids have started life with a big minus already and we believe to see other people's support will show them that they are not alone and give them a positive feeling about the possibility to achieve their dreams.

Besides these, they can live in a safe place, more hygienic, healthier, comfortable and with materials to get a better education.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can of course help us from other ways if you can not support financially. Pls share our campaign on Twitter, Facebook or any other social media platform and of course with your friends. This will help us a lot to reach more people. We are also open to your ideas regarding campaign or our plan to make it more efficient. You can send your comments to harosak@gmail.com

     

    Thank you

story: The Graduating Class has traditionally received sweaters capturing our graduating year and school colors as a parting gift to commemorate the end of one of our most exciting life chapters. Unfortunately, as many as 250+ seniors at Pepperdine have expressed an unfulfilled desire for such a gift this year. After posting an inquiry, I unexpectedly received a staggering amount of requests for class sweaters for seniors and decided that something should be done. The Pepperdine Student Government Association provided me with the design and manufacturer of the sweaters that were made in the Fall, but is unwilling to provide funds for the rest of the senior class. The purpose of this fundraiser is to celebrate Pepperdine's graduating Class of 2016 and provide them a kind memento of their time in college.

story:
Hey there!

 

This is us, Abdullah, Asad, Ahmed and Ayesha. We are siblings, and we are home-schooled, except Ahmed. He is our cousin that goes to a school. Rather feeling sorry for each-other, we work together.

And as we all three were home-schooled (never been through any formal education), our learning experience is different than others. We have learned by teaching and learning from each other. We want to give this opportunity to students, as they should be the ones asking, experimenting and even teaching to learn. That is why we are building a peer to peer learning portal for young learners like us (Technology and Design Enthusiasts).

 

To get a better understanding of the leadership and learning environment (context Asia), we want to attend the ELLTA Conference 2017 (Exploring Leadership and Learning Theories in Asia; at Asian Institute of Technology Bangkok). We are thrilled to attend the conference, because it will help us invest in our knowledge portfolio. Not only that,  we are excited to immerse ourself around people who are working in the exciting field of leadership/ learning. It will give us great insight in our respected field.

 

However, we need your help! We want to attend ELLTA Conference 2017 (at AIT Bangkok) on the basis of the services that we can offer. We can help you with designing, we can run a social media campaigns, or even make a website.


The ELLTA conference is a wonderful opportunity and it can help us mature as an entrepreneur. We will hate to miss it because of a plane ticket.

 

Breakdown of Costs.

We need you to give us work equivalent for the money we are asking for. The breakdown of the cost is:

Conference Fee: $75/Person (it has been reduced 50%)              $300 Total
Airfare: $500/Person (Est. Airfare from KHI-BKK)                          $2000 Total
Accommodation: $50/day (*2 Rooms * 5 days)                               $500 Total
Other:  500$ (Visa, Food, etc.)                                                                 $500 Total

The total also includes 5% of Indiegogo's fee. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word out. If you think you don't have any work for us...help us out by letting others know what we wish to achieve. 

 

Our Projects

TEDDict is an online peer learning portal for young students that makes learning more interesting by keeping it diverse and personalised. TEDDict allows students to learn their own way – connect with each other, share a diverse portfolio of concepts and learn with each other’s help in a more gamified environment. The aim is to encourage entrepreneurial skills in students, as it is an e-learning solution that gives the student an active role to learn what they decide.

 

TEDDict has gathered the audience of 900+ students through peer learning activities. TEDDict has covered 12 workshops and 9 sessions on Visual Programming, Brain Sciences, and Homeschooling in schools and other educational institutes.

 

 

One of the social-innovation projects (under TEDDict) was 'Design your own world' drawing book for children. The main purpose was to provide moral education to kids through the activity they enjoy the most - drawing & coloring. We have already distributed tens of thousands of these books through our project partner Vital Group of Companies and we're currently working on the second edition (Ramzan Special). Which is coming very soon... very very soon! 

 

 

Yet, our favorite project is LavaDew. Launched in late 2014, we officially started providing marketing and branding services to different companies in Pakistan. We enjoy this project the most because we have the opportunity to work with some great people; we truly learned a lot. Our clients included one of the fastest growing tea-brands of Pakistan (Vital Tea) and international academic networks including AFTeL and E-LLSA. To learn more about LavaDew, check out our website. http://lavadew.com/

 

One of our innovative projects was a diary-styled book. Dad Logics is a book written by Asad Ullah . In this book Asad tried to illustrate the trend in which 'things that dad says' do not make sense. Throughout the story, Asad tries making sense out of his unpredictable dad. Sticking to one set of rule contradicts with the other set of a rule imposed by his dad. Making it funny; for others. Ayesha is the co-story teller for this book. You can access the book at Amazon.

Above is a word~cloud of our skills, as we wish to earn the trip in exchange for our skills.. feel free to give us any work that is within our scope. For any customised proposal, please reach us at: yeshbabur@gmail.com. :)
story_txt:
Hey there!
 
This is us, Abdullah, Asad, Ahmed and Ayesha. We are siblings, and we are home-schooled, except Ahmed. He is our cousin that goes to a school. Rather feeling sorry for each-other, we work together.
And as we all three were home-schooled (never been through any formal education), our learning experience is different than others. We have learned by teaching and learning from each other. We want to give this opportunity to students, as they should be the ones asking, experimenting and even teaching to learn. That is why we are building a peer to peer learning portal for young learners like us (Technology and Design Enthusiasts). To get a better understanding of the leadership and learning environment (context Asia), we want to attend the ELLTA Conference 2017 (Exploring Leadership and Learning Theories in Asia; at Asian Institute of Technology Bangkok). We are thrilled to attend the conference, because it will help us invest in our knowledge portfolio. Not only that,  we are excited to immerse ourself around people who are working in the exciting field of leadership/ learning. It will give us great insight in our respected field. However, we need your help! We want to attend ELLTA Conference 2017 (at AIT Bangkok) on the basis of the services that we can offer. We can help you with designing, we can run a social media campaigns, or even make a website.
The ELLTA conference is a wonderful opportunity and it can help us mature as an entrepreneur. We will hate to miss it because of a plane ticket.
 

Breakdown of Costs.
We need you to give us work equivalent for the money we are asking for. The breakdown of the cost is:
Conference Fee: $75/Person (it has been reduced 50%)              $300 TotalAirfare: $500/Person (Est. Airfare from KHI-BKK)                          $2000 TotalAccommodation: $50/day (*2 Rooms * 5 days)                               $500 TotalOther:  500$ (Visa, Food, etc.)                                                                 $500 TotalThe total also includes 5% of Indiegogo's fee. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Help spread the word out. If you think you don't have any work for us...help us out by letting others know what we wish to achieve. 
 Our ProjectsTEDDict is an online peer learning portal for young students that makes learning more interesting by keeping it diverse and personalised. TEDDict allows students to learn their own way – connect with each other, share a diverse portfolio of concepts and learn with each other’s help in a more gamified environment. The aim is to encourage entrepreneurial skills in students, as it is an e-learning solution that gives the student an active role to learn what they decide. TEDDict has gathered the audience of 900+ students through peer learning activities. TEDDict has covered 12 workshops and 9 sessions on Visual Programming, Brain Sciences, and Homeschooling in schools and other educational institutes.  One of the social-innovation projects (under TEDDict) was 'Design your own world' drawing book for children. The main purpose was to provide moral education to kids through the activity they enjoy the most - drawing & coloring. We have already distributed tens of thousands of these books through our project partner Vital Group of Companies and we're currently working on the second edition (Ramzan Special). Which is coming very soon... very very soon!   Yet, our favorite project is LavaDew. Launched in late 2014, we officially started providing marketing and branding services to different companies in Pakistan. We enjoy this project the most because we have the opportunity to work with some great people; we truly learned a lot. Our clients included one of the fastest growing tea-brands of Pakistan (Vital Tea) and international academic networks including AFTeL and E-LLSA. To learn more about LavaDew, check out our website. http://lavadew.com/ One of our innovative projects was a diary-styled book. Dad Logics is a book written by Asad Ullah . In this book Asad tried to illustrate the trend in which 'things that dad says' do not make sense. Throughout the story, Asad tries making sense out of his unpredictable dad. Sticking to one set of rule contradicts with the other set of a rule imposed by his dad. Making it funny; for others. Ayesha is the co-story teller for this book. You can access the book at Amazon.Above is a word~cloud of our skills, as we wish to earn the trip in exchange for our skills.. feel free to give us any work that is within our scope. For any customised proposal, please reach us at: yeshbabur@gmail.com. :)

story:
Nuestra historia

Hechos Criollos nace el primero de noviembre del año 2014 como una página de Facebook, formado por un grupo de jóvenes que buscaban difundir las frases, anécdotas y curiosidades de la historia venezolana. Aquella curiosidad se fue transformando en una de las redes sociales con mayor interacción del país, de contenido educativo. 

Actualmente, Hechos Criollos se encuentra en Instagram, Twitter y Facebook. Cuenta con una página web dedicada a la difusión de artículos históricos y está en la búsqueda de ampliar su alcance. 

Our History

Hechos Criollos was born on November 1st, 2014, as a Facebook page which is formed by a group of young people who wanted to spread phrases, anecdotes and facts about Venezuelan history. That curiosity was transformed into an educational space on social networks, that with the passing of time, became one of the most followed fanpages about History in our country. Currently, Hechos Criollos is on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook. It also has a website dedicated to the dissemination of historical articles and is looking to expand its reach.

Apoya a Hechos Criollos

Hechos Criollos es un medio educativo virtual que utiliza todas sus plataformas para difundir todo sobre la historia de Venezuela, sus personajes, anécdotas, logros y fracasos, así como sacar a la luz hechos olvidados u obviados que tienen efecto en nuestro presente.

Con su donación, nos ayuda a ampliar nuestro alcance y poder mantener nuestro sitio web, realizar eventos, charlas, edición de material literario, y a llegar a  más personas. Ayúdanos a mantener viva nuestra memoria nacional. 

Hechos Criollos is a virtual educational medium that uses all its platforms to spread everything about the history of Venezuela, its characters, anecdotes, achievements and failures, as well as presenting forgotten facts that have an effect on our present.

With your donation, you help us to expand our reach and be able to maintain our website, organize events, readings, editing literary material, and attain more people. Help us to keep our national memory alive.

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Actualmente la crisis en Venezuela limita cualquier emprendimiento, sobre todo aquellos que tienen como fin el área cultural. Nosotros necesitamos un impulso inicial de $3000 para poder afianzarnos durante el 2018 y lograr realizar actividades que nos permitan llegar a más espacios.

Con esto podemos organizar un evento que incluya ponencias, representación de personajes históricos, espacios para que marcas nacionales puedan darse a conocer. Necesitamos cubrir los gastos de dominio y hosting, así como de los investigadores que constantemente están generando contenido en nuestras redes sociales y página web.

Necesitamos cubrir los gastos legales para poder editar material literario y así poder difundir más el conocimiento y la obra de los venezolanos que por la gran escasez de papel en el país no pueden darse a conocer. Esto a través de una plataforma virtual.

En general, necesitamos tu apoyo para poder ampliar nuestro alcance y evitar que el uso de la propaganda política siga distorsionando nuestra historia con fines personales. Con esta ayuda podremos mejorar el contenido y la forma en que lo difundimos. 

Currently the crisis in Venezuela limits any undertaking, especially those that have as a goal to spread the cultural knowledge. We need an initial boost of $ 3000 to be able to strengthen our work during 2018 and make activities that allow us to reach more spaces.

What we need and what you get

With this we can organize an event that includes presentations, representation of historical figures, spaces for national brands to make themselves known. We need to cover domain and hosting expenses, as well as a financial contribution to researchers who are constantly generating content on our social networks and website.

 

We need to cover the legal expenses to have the means for editing literary material and thus disseminate the knowledge and the work of Venezuelans who, due to the great scarcity of paper in the country, can not make themselves known. This through our virtual platform.

In general, we need your support to be able to expand our reach and prevent that the political propaganda can continue distorting our history for personal purposes. With this contribution we can improve our content and the way we spread it.

¿En qué invertiremos los aportes?

  • Mantenimiento de página web.
  • Gastos en personal dedicado a la investigación.
  • Un evento anual dedicado a la cultura venezolana.
  • Creación de material audiovisual que refuerce nuestra labor educativa. 
  • Gastos en procesos legales para poder editar y publicar material literario.

How will we invest the contributions?

Maintenance of web page.
Financial contribution to personnel dedicated to research.
An annual event dedicated to Venezuelan culture.
Creation of audiovisual material to reinforce our educational work.
Expenses in legal processes to be able to edit and publish literary material.

El impacto

Nuestro proyecto ha logrado una gran aceptación entre los venezolanos y buscamos poder seguir brindando innovación en la difusión de nuestro contenido. Con esto, abrimos la oportunidad de crear interés en todo lo relacionado con la cultura venezolana y contrarrestar la desinformación o la manipulación con fines personales. 

Impact

Our project has achieved great acceptance among Venezuelans and we seek to continue innovating in the dissemination of our content. With this, we open the opportunity to create interest in everything related to Venezuelan culture and counteract misinformation or manipulation for political purposes.

Riesgos y desafíos

Es indiscutible la terrible situación que vive el país, lo que hace que nuestro proyecto esté limitado por la falta de recursos y tiempo, que interfieren con nuestra labor. 

Sin embargo, nuestra voluntad será seguir adelante para alcanzar nuestros objetivos e impedir que un espacio tan valioso se estanque o se pierda. Vamos a hacer historia y lograr unir a los venezolanos, tan divididos y afectados, en torno a un elemento en común: su nación. 

Risks and challenges

The terrible situation of our country is undeniable, which means that our project is limited by the lack of resources and time that interfere with our work.

However, our will is to continue achieving our goals and prevent that such a valuable space could be halted or even lost. We are going to make history and achieve the union of Venezuelans, nowadays so divided and affected, around a common element: their nation.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

También puedes aportar haciéndonos llegar material audiovisual, fotografías, documentos, entre otros artículos, que contengan parte de nuestra historia o acervo cultural.  

No olvides difundir nuestra campaña a través de tus redes sociales y personas cercanas.

Other ways you can help

You can also contribute by sending us audiovisual material, photographs, documents, among other articles, that contain part of our history or cultural heritage.

story:
Introduction

IOT can reach its full potential only when professionals from all industries can apply their innovative minds directly to this technology. It should be easy to learn IOT. 

Today devices like the Arduino, Raspberry pi, etc.,  are available which has made it possible for more and more people to get into this field. However  when you go out and try to start learning IOT, you would still be expected to know the basics of electronics, know how to install and configure linux systems or understand how to write code in C.

And for beginners, there is always a fear when it comes to handling electronics. 

  • Should I connect the wire to this pin or that one?
  • What if I do something and spoil some components or the entire board itself?
  • What if I make a mistake and there is a smoke or fire hazard?

These are apprehensions that are quite natural for anybody who is new to Electronics

The WiNoT™ Trainer kit comes preassembled with all components and so even somebody without any electronics background can start learning IOT. You are not expected to know anything about electronics, or have experience in software languages. As long as you know how to install applications on your computer, you can get started. Of course if you already know about programming or basics of electronics, it will make it much more easier.

What's in the kit

The kit mainly contains two components:

  1. A board with popular sensors and output devices mounted on to it
  2. Complimented with a well structured tutorial

The WiNoT™ trainer board which has the ESP8266 as the controller with 5 sensors, one LED, one buzzer and one relay assembled on the board. Once you open the standard trainer kit from the box, you can start using it right away - there is no need for any assembly, soldering or even wiring. The video below gives a detailed overview of the board

 

One of the highlights of this kit is the accompanying tutorial. The tutorial is a detailed course in itself. The tutorial is a collection of different types of learning material like books, videos, quizzes and other e-learning content. The tutorial has been structured in such a way that it assumes no prior knowledge of electronics or programming. Using a step-by-step style, the tutorial will guide you on IOT. By the time you have completed the course, you will be able to create simple IOT solutions using Python. 

    Intuitive Approach

    When it comes to the coding part of WiNoT™, we have completely simplified the process. 
    First of all, we built the firmware in such a way that it takes cares of most of the heavy-lifting. This is complemented with a python library which is installed on the computer. This combination makes it possible to write IOT code that is very intuitive and easy to understand. If it is easy to understand, then it becomes easy to learn 

    The following videos show a few examples of using the WiNoT™ trainer. After seeing this video, you will be able to appreciate the fact that it is really very simple to develop IOT solutions using WiNoT™ 

    In the first demo, we will start off with controlling the onboard LED and Buzzer.

    In the following demo, we will see how to detect motion, how to measure distance and how to check the light intensity

     

    In the last demo, we will see how to build integrated IOT solutions by combining one or more sensors and output devices.

    As a side note the WiNoT™ trainer is an educational product and its sole purpose is to assist in IOT Learning. We do not recommend building complete IOT solutions using the trainer. To build IOT solutions, we have an upcoming product, WiNoT™ developer board. 

    Please check the FAQ to see what is the WiNoT™ developer board and why your support to this campaign is critical for us to bring the developer board to market. 

      Why did we create the trainer?

      We ran into practical difficulties when we wanted to automate our new office. Here's what Raghu Venkataramana, the founder of Qantom and the architect of WiNoT™ has to say:

      Around six months ago, when I set out to create an IOT centre of competence, I had several IOT related ideas. I first started off with a requirement to make my office building into a simple connected solution. Since I wanted Qantom to be focussed on IOT, I only thought that it was right to build our own solution. I had a very tight budget for this project as it was for internal consumption. Also it had no inherent commercial value. Thanks to these constraints I hired a few interns and got started by beginning to train them. 
      During the course of the journey, I experienced the challenge and       difficulty of training  people who had no knowledge of electronics and/or developing using embedded C. And hence I shifted the first priority from automating our office building to building a training kit for IOT.  And here we are today!.

      Where We are and What We Need 

      The WiNoT™ trainer is currently in an advance prototyping stage. Functionally, it is a fully working prototype. In terms of the hardware, everything has been implemented and tested. The firmware has been written although there are some enhancements pending.  We have done basic testing but comprehensive testing has still note been done on the firmware. The book is currently work in progress and has still not been printed. 

      We need the funds to fabricate and assemble the PCB in larger quantities and to publish the book. And most of all, if we can reach our target for this campaign, it will give us a boost to spend our time and money on the dev-kit. See the FAQ for more on this. 

      In the previous section,  all the demo videos and the configuration / setup videos have been created an actual working product but in a studio setup. A gallery of a few other photos in our office and workshop:

           

         

         

      A bit more on the perks...

      Depending on your needs and expertise level, you can choose your reward options. We hope that the below table will assist you in making the right choice.

      The Impact

      In the years to come, IOT skills will become a part of every other technology and will not be a skill in itself. The WiNoT Trainer is a step forward in making IOT accessible to a wider audience and helping everybody to be a part of this growing revolution. 

      Risks and Challenges

      Hardware :
      Any product that involves hardware has inherent risks –
      a) Fabricating a working PCB and
      b) supply/availability of required components in sufficient numbers.
      Since we have already created a fully working prototype, this risk is almost negligible. 
      From the current prototype we only plan to make aesthetic changes to product - like repositioning a couple of sensors. 
      In terms of availability of components and sensors, this risk is largely mitigated as we have carefully selected only those sensors & devices which are readily available from multiple sources

      Shipping & Logistics
      When it comes to international processing and shipping, there are risks of delay that are attached to it. However these are usually just a few days and hence doesn't impact that the project delivery in a very significant way.

      We will report to our supporters about any setback if they occur and make every effort to solve them.

      Ways in which You Can Help

      Your support can take this campaign in more than one ways. 

      • By pledging for any of the perks 
      • Spread the word among your friends and relatives
      • Share our campaign on facebook, whatsapp and other social media
      • Like us on social media

And hence I shifted the first priority from automating our office building to building a training kit for IOT.  And here we are today!.
Where We are and What We Need 
The WiNoT™ trainer is currently in an advance prototyping stage. Functionally, it is a fully working prototype. In terms of the hardware, everything has been implemented and tested. The firmware has been written although there are some enhancements pending.  We have done basic testing but comprehensive testing has still note been done on the firmware. The book is currently work in progress and has still not been printed. 
We need the funds to fabricate and assemble the PCB in larger quantities and to publish the book. And most of all, if we can reach our target for this campaign, it will give us a boost to spend our time and money on the dev-kit. See the FAQ for more on this. 
In the previous section,  all the demo videos and the configuration / setup videos have been created an actual working product but in a studio setup. A gallery of a few other photos in our office and workshop:
     
   
   
A bit more on the perks...
Depending on your needs and expertise level, you can choose your reward options. We hope that the below table will assist you in making the right choice.


The Impact
In the years to come, IOT skills will become a part of every other technology and will not be a skill in itself. The WiNoT Trainer is a step forward in making IOT accessible to a wider audience and helping everybody to be a part of this growing revolution. 
Risks and Challenges

Hardware :Any product that involves hardware has inherent risks –a) Fabricating a working PCB andb) supply/availability of required components in sufficient numbers.Since we have already created a fully working prototype, this risk is almost negligible. From the current prototype we only plan to make aesthetic changes to product - like repositioning a couple of sensors. In terms of availability of components and sensors, this risk is largely mitigated as we have carefully selected only those sensors & devices which are readily available from multiple sources
Shipping & LogisticsWhen it comes to international processing and shipping, there are risks of delay that are attached to it. However these are usually just a few days and hence doesn't impact that the project delivery in a very significant way.
We will report to our supporters about any setback if they occur and make every effort to solve them.

Ways in which You Can Help
Your support can take this campaign in more than one ways. 

By pledging for any of the perks 
Spread the word among your friends and relatives
Share our campaign on facebook, whatsapp and other social media
Like us on social media

story:
December 2017 Update: Follow us on our facebook page as we spend December hitchhiking 3000 km through Europe! We will update this campaign daily.

 

Our dream is that the billions of language learners across the globe will share their languages and cultures as they learn from one another.

More importantly, we hope that the Swap Language Community will inspire more people to take up language learning in an effort to help tear down language and cultural barriers in an increasingly divided world.

As a promise to this cause, our language exchange service will forever be free.

 

WHAT WILL THE DONATIONS BE SPENT ON?

NONE of the donations will be spent on our travel expenses or salaries to the Swap Language-team.

 

A crowdfunding goal of $4 000 will make it possible for us to keep doing what we are doing and let the community grow organically. It will cover our company's expenses for the coming 6 months, allowing us to focus on breaking down language barriers! Those expenses are usually server- and domain expenses, programming costs when developing new functionality, meeting materials such as signs and nametags, AB-testing and last but not least... lots of tea for late nights at the office.

We will be able to expand to another 5 cities and grow the community with an additional 5 000 language swappers. We can add cool functionality to the current web-based platform. 

The money would specifically go to AB-tested marketing and examining new markets and opportunities for expansion. 

 

 

We can commence developing an application to make it easy for users to use Swap Language on a wider range of devices. We could expand the community to 10 cities and an additional  30 000 language swappers.
The money would specifically go to AB-tested marketing on a grander scale and examining new markets and opportunities for expansion as well as focusing on partnerships with educational institutions. 

 

 

 

 

 

MAKE THE DREAM COME TRUE - SIGN UP NOW!

Do you know someone who is learning a language you speak? Offer to practice with them or invite them to events typical of your culture.

Do you know someone who is learning a language you don't speak? Tell them to sign up and be a part of building language exchange communities locally.

Sign up today and share not only your language, but learn one in return. 

We are still very new and there might not be a community near you yet. Fear not! This is what our ambassadors are for. They play a crucial role in spreading Swap Language to other cities. Contact us on info@swaplanguage.com, and we will guide you on how to get a community started where you live.

Here is a video from our Aarhus, Denmark community:



HITCHHIKING 3000 KM THROUGH EUROPE

While this campaign is running, we aren't going to rest on our laurels. We are visiting our volunteers in 5 cities, and the absolute best way to do so is packing up our office and hitting the European road.

Each stop, we will meet a person with a different language, culture and life story. We love this journey and we feel that it is a great way to shape Swap Language's identity. 

You can follow us on our trip through our social media pages, where you can experience all the crazy situations, awkward moments and the extraordinary people we will meet along the way!

 

WHO ARE OUR MEMBERS?

They gotta all be students, right? Actually, no! The majority of our users are working and using Swap Language to improve their language skills for both professional and personal reasons.

Joachim, for instance, is an engineer and an ambassador. He uses Swap Language to develop his English skills and often speaks in front of large crowds. Watch Joachim talk about some of the challenges he meets while practicing languages.

 

 

 

WHO ARE WE?

We are Nichlas and Allan from Denmark; two close friends who have a passion for learning new languages and cultures - but not in the classroom. We both learned Spanish with the help of language partners on our travels as the main tool for becoming fluent: in an informal surrounding, with a native speaker who had an interest in getting to know us and our culture. That's why we founded Swap Language.

We already collaborate with 2 universities and a language institution, Lærdansk, for new comers in Denmark. They have seen what Swap Language can do and that's why we want to bring it to the rest of the world.

 

WHY SWAP LANGUAGE DIFFERENTIATES ITSELF FROM OTHER WEBSITES AND SERVICES?

Without culture, you don't speak the language. The fastest way to learn is by throwing yourself into situations where you are forced to speak with native speakers who have been raised within the language and culture.

Being in a classroom with 30 other people, learning from a non-native speaker, isn't going to cut it and apps rarely teach you exactly what you need to know. But native speakers do! Classroom learning and apps aren't all bad though. Using apps and classroom learning before learning from a native speaker can be a great complementary service!

At the age of 40, a person will have spent 8 years on average practicing both verbal- as well as non-verbal communication in their own language. That wealth of knowledge is key for language learners to master their target language.

There are also many classes to learn languages - and Swap Language is a great complement to try all the grammar you have learned in your class with native speakers.

Our users are pretty clear - without talking with locals, the language isn't gonna stick. Here are 5 benefits:

  • Learning with a native speaker 
  • Face-to-face meetings in the city you are in makes learning cozy and fun.
  • Meet anywhere, anytime - exactly when it suits you.
  • For every meeting you have you get a reference from your language partner.
  • When you move to a new city - you simply change your city on the website and you are good to go!

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP OUT

Other ways you can help the Swap Language:

  1. Sign up if you want to find a language partner
  2. Spread the word and share Swap Language with your friends and family who have an interest in languages, cultures and meeting native speakers face-to-face.
  3. Become a Swap Language ambassador in your area and start a Swap Language community by hosting language meetings. Learn more about it on our website.
  4. Do you know a university or a language institution we should contact? Or a specific person who would be of help for us to meet?
  5. Know someone who wants to pick us up on their way through Europe? Let us know :D

story:
Why Camp Golden Gate is Important?

My name is Jose Lomeli, a former Peace Corps Volunteer in Bulgaria. This grass-root experience inspired me to dedicate my life to empower students and promote social inclusion, essential tools for fair economic development.

While living in Bulgaria I asked myself this question: What do you do when a society faces challenges such as: 40% students at 15 are functionally illiterate, i.e. they are unable to apply in practice in daily life what they have learned at school, 22% of Bulgarian youth aged 18-24 are NEET (not in education, employment or training), and 21% of Bulgarian students fail to finish their secondary education.

You do something about it! You commit to your beliefs, you quit your corporate job , sell all your stuff, move to Bulgaria and establish a project that will have a meaningful impact not only on the youth, but also to the communities they belong to. You give every possible child the best opportunity to reach its full potential. You provide them with long-term resources such as - American Teachers, who will share their knowledge, positive energy, vision for a better world, and passion to thrive in life. They will inspire the children to embrace challenges as a natural process of success. They will show them how to apply their skills to real life situations. Education should not be just about theories, but more about how knowledge is applicable and used in real life situations.

    

 

Quality Learning should not be a privilege but a RIGHT. And the American teachers coming this summer to donate their time and skills believe so too! Our groups of teachers are: former Peace Corp teachers, artists, senior citizens, and activists.

Camp Golden Gate – Fostering Diversity, Innovation and Friendship

Camp Golden Gate is the first International American Summer Camp at the Black Sea for teenagers ages 14-18. It pledges to inspire teenagers to create together, to collaborate, to think outside the box, and to learn from each other, placing a great value on respect within a multicultural environment. Camp Golden Gate sets the tone by promoting a fun learning environment that does not believe that social, cultural, and economic factors should determine the quality of education a student receives. Everyone benefits from a society that is more tolerant and well rounded.

Why a Fundraising Campaign?

More than 60% of our participants will participate on our camp for free. By sponsoring kids, Camp Golden Gate will become more inclusive and a more fruitful experience for all. Hence, most of the cost to run the camp will be covered by the founders of the camp. One of the biggest cost, which is necessary to make this camp successful, is to bring American Teachers, who will make the experience unique and cross cultural. The total cost for flights, lodging and transportation is around $15,000. The founders are hoping to raise at least $10,000 to cover a part of the total cost for the teachers.

Our Impact:

The impact of an International American Summer Camp begins at individual level and it transfer s to the community level. At the individual level, the students will: gain practical and life-long skills, learn to work in a international setting with people that have many different points of view, create a future network of partnerships, become more confident, embrace cultural and social differences, value education as a means to change the world they live in, and set realistic goals and objectives for their professional journey. At the community level, the students will transfer fundamental skills and principals such as: the value of diversity, the benefits of working together and helping each other, inspire others to believe in the power of education as a tool for success, sharing personal experiences and views of people from other places, and the value of empowerment at the individual and community level.

story: I am raising money to finance my flight school courses, both theory and practice. I want to obtain the license and become both a commercial and private line pilot . Then I want to join the community of volunteer pilots, to involve into charity flights, medical transport for the sick people, take action in distress situations like earthquakes, flood, forest fires , hurricanes, storms etc. I just want to give a hand in situations where my help is needed. I don't want to be a hero, I want people to know there is someone they can count on when disaster strikes. The courses will take place at a private airfield and will last between 6 and 8 months , starting from the next spring . I will keep you updated back then, with photos and videos . Your help will be very much appreciated, a small contribution would be even better. If there is no possibility for you to back me up, sharing my campaign and spreading the word to as many as you can would be a brilliant idea.
