story:
Short Summary

My name is Susan Walsh and I have over 20 years’ experience in publishing and media. I hold expertise in content creation and the digital distribution of content for multiple industries, including education. I have designed and built K-12 experiential content, which has been supported by international educational channels, as well as built an international network of educators who anxiously await the release of our first complete series of experiential content.

As parents who are passionate about supporting the needs of children in the educational  space, my team shares a collective desire to revolutionize the delivery of  teaching materials by providing experiential content “free” to everyone, everywhere.

Our mission is a global initiative that will engage and support children, parents and educators everywhere by providing them with modern day learning tools and access to a networked community of experts committed to helping our children achieve success. We are providing the building blocks for a brighter future for everyone.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise an initial $300,000. This money will go directly to the production of our first series of content. Our immediate team will not be accepting any of this money personally, as it will go 100% to travel, filming, editing, as well as to support our digital distribution infrastructure. 

Super Heroes ($5000+): Contributors at this level will be entered into a lottery to win a video production experience. If you are an educator, this is your chance to introduce your class to the art of conceptualizing, scripting, filming, and editing a professional video for the RSEM experiential video library. Work with us to create something special that students can benefit from all over the world. All those who wish to be acknowledged for their efforts (respective school, educators, students, parents) will be recognized in the closing credits of this video. *Note: should a parent win this opportunity, they will have the benefit of directing this initiative to the K-12 school of their choice.

Advocates ($1000 - $4999): Have you ever wanted to be in the movies? Top level donors will be awarded the opportunity to appear in one of our educational videos produced by some of the most talented people in the business.

Supporters ($500 - $999): Earn the opportunity to visit our production studio and watch how movies are made and produced.

Friends ($50 - $499): Earn a flash drive with outtakes, pictures, music and a video script! Are you a teacher? Earn free PD with our education, technology and innovation consultant.

All donors will receive a digital badge recognizing their contribution to our mission.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, the money we raise will be spent building as much educational content as we can. By leveraging the content we’ve created, we will continue on our mission to raise the necessary funds to finish developing our first series in our efforts to transform the educational experience.

 

The Impact

Your contribution is the difference between recognizing a brighter future for generations to come, or not. Achieving our goal guarantees a future of corporate commitment to our model. Corporate commitment will ensure that we are able to deliver the content necessary, while also further supporting modern learners with new technologies, access to guest speakers, field trips, and more.

The power of experiential learning is being more widely embraced given the needs of our ever-changing world. Core Benefits - Students learn faster and retain more information; Students embrace their mistakes as opportunities for learning in a supportive environment; Practicum experience allows students to learn about new careers and network with employers; Students develop job ready skills and global competencies; Students graduate with the skills they need to be successful in today’s job market.

In simple terms, this campaign is about equipping students of today and tomorrow with the skills to be successful in a world that requires our ability to consistently adapt.

To demonstrate our approach to this learning model and to pilot our vision, we built a video focused on math & science concepts featuring a celebrity athlete. In coordination with Canadian Sports Institute Ontario (CSIO), our team worked with Canada’s national swim team using Olympic Champion Penny Oleksiak as our video subject. Discovery Education asked to license this video for their K-12 library, but RSEM opted to maintain the rights to the work.

This project speaks to building a better educational experience for students by addressing traditional teaching methods that are proving increasingly unsuccessful. Experiential learning needs to be at the heart of every educational program. There is no existing model or team that exists who are committed to creating this new and unique style of educational experience. Our collective passion is hard to find and quite frankly, we are in this for a greater social good. We demand quality for our children and for yours, and we will make a positive impact within the educational space.

Risks & Challenges

Our business model demands authenticity and high quality, which makes it much more time consuming and costly. However, this is also what makes our content meaningful and engaging. Our advantage is our team. Collectively we have decades of experience in all areas of the business. We are all veterans and know our respective fields inside and out. We’ve learned many hard lessons over the years and we will not make rookie mistakes. We have an extensive international network connecting us to the people, places, and things that might otherwise prove challenging or inaccessible to most.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In a digitally connected world, we all have the ability to share ideas and information that we feel is meaningful. By sharing our campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues, you are not only helping us reach a larger audience who may in turn help us reach our goal, but you are moving us one step closer to making a difference for kids everywhere.
story_txt: Short SummaryMy name is Susan Walsh and I have over 20 years’ experience in publishing and media. I hold expertise in content creation and the digital distribution of content for multiple industries, including education. I have designed and built K-12 experiential content, which has been supported by international educational channels, as well as built an international network of educators who anxiously await the release of our first complete series of experiential content.As parents who are passionate about supporting the needs of children in the educational  space, my team shares a collective desire to revolutionize the delivery of  teaching materials by providing experiential content “free” to everyone, everywhere.Our mission is a global initiative that will engage and support children, parents and educators everywhere by providing them with modern day learning tools and access to a networked community of experts committed to helping our children achieve success. We are providing the building blocks for a brighter future for everyone. What We Need & What You GetWe are looking to raise an initial $300,000. This money will go directly to the production of our first series of content. Our immediate team will not be accepting any of this money personally, as it will go 100% to travel, filming, editing, as well as to support our digital distribution infrastructure. Super Heroes ($5000+): Contributors at this level will be entered into a lottery to win a video production experience. If you are an educator, this is your chance to introduce your class to the art of conceptualizing, scripting, filming, and editing a professional video for the RSEM experiential video library. Work with us to create something special that students can benefit from all over the world. All those who wish to be acknowledged for their efforts (respective school, educators, students, parents) will be recognized in the closing credits of this video. *Note: should a parent win this opportunity, they will have the benefit of directing this initiative to the K-12 school of their choice.Advocates ($1000 - $4999): Have you ever wanted to be in the movies? Top level donors will be awarded the opportunity to appear in one of our educational videos produced by some of the most talented people in the business.Supporters ($500 - $999): Earn the opportunity to visit our production studio and watch how movies are made and produced.Friends ($50 - $499): Earn a flash drive with outtakes, pictures, music and a video script! Are you a teacher? Earn free PD with our education, technology and innovation consultant.All donors will receive a digital badge recognizing their contribution to our mission.If we don’t reach our entire goal, the money we raise will be spent building as much educational content as we can. By leveraging the content we’ve created, we will continue on our mission to raise the necessary funds to finish developing our first series in our efforts to transform the educational experience. The ImpactYour contribution is the difference between recognizing a brighter future for generations to come, or not. story:
Do you have an idea you'd like to pursue or a problem you'd like to solve but don't know where to start or who to start with? 

 

What makes this a Space Startup Weekend?

During the weekend the teams will work on ideas related to space problems. For example (but by far not limited to), spacecraft launching and landing, software solutions, human survival in Mars or deep space, communications, prospecting, satellites and their applications on earth, education, etc. What would make it really special is the group of mentors we will have to help teams figure out the different aspects of a space business. 

Please read our FAQs below or send us an email to swboulderspace@gmail.comwith ANY question you might have. We acknowledge this event might bring up a lot of questions and maybe even feel a little intimidating if you don't have a tech background or a space idea, so we want to make sure we address any question or hesitation that comes up. 

It is going to be a great opportunity for you to learn about the local and global space industries and to meet really awesome and interesting people.

Event page: http://communities.techstars.com/usa/boulder/startup-weekend/12391

 

How does Startup Weekend Work?

 

On Friday night, you'll pitch your own idea or listen to others (see the FAQs below), then vote on the most interesting ideas and form teams with diverse skill sets.  You can come with friends, but you’ll get the full experience if you participate in separate teams. Remember, it’s all about the team.


Then, over the course of the weekend, you'll be challenged to create a prototype of your MVP, or minimum viable product, that fits the needs of your target customer. You'll get feedback, iterate, and likely pivot your approach entirely!

 

Startup Weekend - Trailer from Eighteen Eighty on Vimeo.

story:
Who am I?

Hi I'm Caitlin Argyle and I'm a 17 year old school student living on the Gold Coast. I'm raising money by offering work and holiday accommodation so I can raise the deposit to buy an investment property.  One of my favourite things to do is to do things for other people so best part of my project is that for every 10 weeks of holiday accommodation you book, I will give a family with a sick child a weeks accommodation for FREE! Also if you don't want to come to the Gold Coast but still want to support my quest, you can purchase a weeks accommodation and donate it back to me and I will allocate that week to a charity to use within their organisation. I am so excited!

I'm not seeking charity (although all donations are appreciated!). Because my house will be located on the Gold Coast I am offering holiday accommodation in it for up to 70 weeks to help raise the money for the deposit plus I'm ready and willing to do other jobs to make my dream a reality.Once the holiday accommodations have been completed the house will be rented out to someone who needs a place. If you're interested in booking a weeks holiday (or longer) on the Gold Coast then let me help!

So why do I want a house?

I've been reading for some time that a house is a good investment, and decided that investing in one is what I need to do, but I also kept hearing that its getting hard for young people to invest and get ahead. If I wait until I save the money up from working it will take me many years to raise a deposit.The longer I take the more expensive houses will become and the longer it will take me to raise the money...in fact after expenses, taxes and increasing prices it might take me 20 years to buy one!

 I talked to Mum and Dad and after lots of discussion they set me a challenge..."you come up with the deposit and we will guarantee the other 90%"...so there it was..my challenge. I just had to come up with a way to find the rest.

I didnt want to give up on my dream...so I came up with the idea...why not offer holiday accommodation in my new house to raise the money for the deposit I had to find... then buy the house with the proceeds advanced by people staying? When I was told about crowdfunding I knew it was the way to do it!

What I Need & What You Get

I have 90% of the fund secured as a loan but I need to raise $48000 to cover the deposit and make my wish come true. I have already saved just over $4000 of my deposit from different jobs I have done

Mum and Dad have helped me do my sums. I can afford to buy a 3 bedroom house that sells for around $400000. Allowing for stamp duty, property costs, legal fees  Indiegogo costs, and furniture and cutlery for the house (so you have something to sleep on and eat with!) I will need an extra $23000. I can borrow around $375000 so that leaves me about $48000 to raise.

I've come up with a series of rewards that I hope you will like  :-)

  • One weeks accommodation in the house once I've bought it so you can enjoy a holiday on the Gold Coast (rates will vary depending on when you book it)
  • Upgrade your weeks stay with a guided tour of the Gold Coast where I will show you the sights!
  • I will come and work for you for an hour, several hours or a day (packing, cleaning, helping you in your business or around the house)
  • If you're visiting the Gold Coast but dont want to stay for a week how about a homestay? You can book a nights accommodation in my family home and I'll even cook you dinner as well!
Check out my full list of rewards on the right hand side and you can Like my Facebook page at One Girls House

The Impact

So why do I want a house? I want to give myself the best start in life and I know that saving money is important to my future. My house will be an investment but it's also more than that...

I also want to give a family fighting illness a chance to have a holiday on the Gold Coast so for every 10 weeks that I rent out as holiday accommodation Im giving one week in the house to a family with a child suffering illness so they can have a break and enjoy themselves.There is also a shortage of rental accommodation on the Gold Coast so once I've honoured all the holiday stays I will be able to provide someone with a home to live in.

Risks & Challenges

I have made this an all or nothing campaign. That means if I dont raise the full amount then no one pays any money.Although I am also looking to work I know that most of the money will come from people booking the holiday weeks and if I dont raise enough for the deposit then I wont have somewhere for people to stay. If you book one of my rewards you will only need to hand the money over if I reach my goal that way you dont have to worry that you wont receive your reward. 

Some people say I'm too young to own a house but I say you're only as young as you want to be. I hope that achieving my goal will inspire young people like myself to believe that they can achieve theirs. I know that achieving this goal will help build my confidence and prepare me for the real world that I will have to face when I leave school. 

I dont have a job for next year although I am completing my Certificate III in hospitality and hope to work in a cafe (and one day I'd like to own one!). If I can complete my goal I will be able to show propective employees that I have initiative and that I'm willing to work hard and this will help me get a job. I know my future is in my hands - I'm going to give it all I've got!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign with as many people as you can, not just so they might give but so it might inspire others to do what I am doing. Pass it on to your friends on social media and use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. If you have friends who need somewhere to stay on the Gold Coast or who live here and need some work done please let them know about me!

Thank you so much for your support in reading this   :-)

If you're wanting to pre-book accommodation simply follow these steps:

1.  Check out the link below to see what dates are available for the house  Check out my available dates here . It will take you to my Google calendar.

2.  Scroll forward to December 2015 onwards and you will see what dates are available. Dates are available from December 2015 until April 2017. School holidays/Peak times are indicated. If no name is booked on the calendar, those dates are available. (NOTE: you cannot physically book on the calendar you must email me at onegirlshouse@gmail.com to request your dates.) Dates are to be booked Sunday - Sunday ONLY. You are welcome to book more than one week :)

3.  Once you decide what dates you would like email me at onegirlshouse at gmail.com

4.  We will pencil in the date for you and you have 24 hours to pre purchase your accommodation by clicking on the perk you wish. ($945 low season or $1260 high season).  First in first served basis.

5.  Remember my campaign will only go ahead if I raise my target of $48,000  I receive none of the money until then.  If the campaign doesn’t go ahead no money changes hands so it’s nice and safe for everyone!

Best wishes

Caitlin


Check Out My Available Dates Here

story:
Hello, dear friends! I would like to present a project that a group of good people is working on. But before I start, I want to tell you something. We are living in the 21 century with a lot of communication and information technologies around us. We can’t imagine our lives without computers, I-phones, all those gadgets and devices. But people remain people, they believe, they love, they hope, and most important – they have their faith, and each in their own God. And this is great news! Because without faith, in a minute of loneliness and despair, very often, there is no one you can appeal to.
We, common people, are not frequent visitors of churches, temples, or mosques. We don’t have spare time for that. Or, there are people with limited abilities among us, it may be hard for them to go to church. It’s exactly for these people, for all of us, that this project of Online Church is being created. Anyone, at any place of the world, would be able to visit this church if he or she has an access to internet.
That’s how it’s going to work: at the premises, there will be video cameras installed which provide live streaming. Also, there will be candle holders installed, and if someone wants, sending a request, a candle will be lit. A request can be sent through a website. There won’t be any payment for this service, but anyone who wants to donate, can donate whatever he or she considers acceptable.
At the moment, it is required that 10 000 US dollars are to be collected which will be used for the long-term lease of the premises, and for the website development. Also, for the purchase of the server, of 5 cameras, candles and candle holders, and for the remuneration of the person who will be attending to the candles. If the amount of funds collected will exceed these 10 000, then the PURCHASE of premises for Online Church will be considered, which can reduce monthly expenses.
But what would the people, who donate more than one dollar, can get for their endeavor? It is hard to think about any benefits possibly received in a project like this one. A candle can be put and lit by any person from anywhere in the world, and free of charge. So, it has been decided, that every dollar donated to this project, would be spent on more candles. In the future, it could be possible, if there’s enough financial support for this project, that the online confession to the priest will be available.
This project is not about making money. The team of people working on it, do believe in God, and they hope that this idea and their efforts to fulfil this project will bring benefits to all the people who need faith and the presence of God in their lives.
At the same time, the team wants to express their respect to all religious beliefs and to state that they are not trying to convince people to stop attending real churches. They also apologize if the description of this Online Church project would seem offensive to some people.

story:
Hello dear Reader,

I am Ettora Hesseling, I am single mother and I own a webshop. I graduated as a photographer and have been allowed to do some journalistic assignments for the news and newspaper. For years I have done projects on my own initiative in the North of Africa and the Netherlands for sick children, the less fortunate and orphans. This experience has taught me how important education is. We don't all get the same opportunities depending on where you are born. That is why I think it is important that education is possible for every child. So that every child can develop, what will have a major impact on an entire community.

Self-confidence, dreambuilding, self-motivation and empowerment. We must not forget these forces and the younger these facets are taught the more benefits the entire world will have in the long term. How many adults do not struggle with self-confidence. Going to a job where they are unhappy, trapped in bad friendships and relationships, unhappy because they have chosen a safe path out of fear. That is why these confidence cards are so important that at a young age more self-awareness is created and confidence to be happy with who you are. To appreciate yourself and thereby create a valuable life. It is an investment for society. The cards will also be offered at schools.

What you get

• The deck consists of 31 cards and a box.

• A professional writer will have to write 31 texts, assignments and motivations.

• 40 drawings will be made for the cards, instructions & box in which they are sold.

• In total 64 drawings, 31 for the special edition book with motivational stories for kids.

• Languages ​​English and Dutch. (With great success in more languages).

• A website and marketing.

I have made several contacts to realize this beautiful Confidence Cards for Kids. The total costs will amount to €25.000 euros. The challenge is that not the entire amount will be achieved. In that case the remaining amount will go to the Aflatoun charity, which is committed to education for children in third world countries.

If you do not have the opportunity to make a donation and you still want to help, please share this project. Thank you for taking the time. I hope it will be a great success.

That is why I think it is important that education is possible for every child. So that every child can develop, what will have a major impact on an entire community.Self-confidence, dreambuilding, self-motivation and empowerment. We must not forget these forces and the younger these facets are taught the more benefits the entire world will have in the long term. How many adults do not struggle with self-confidence. Going to a job where they are unhappy, trapped in bad friendships and relationships, unhappy because they have chosen a safe path out of fear. That is why these confidence cards are so important that at a young age more self-awareness is created and confidence to be happy with who you are. To appreciate yourself and thereby create a valuable life. It is an investment for society. The cards will also be offered at schools.What you get• The deck consists of 31 cards and a box.• A professional writer will have to write 31 texts, assignments and motivations.• 40 drawings will be made for the cards, instructions & box in which they are sold.• In total 64 drawings, 31 for the special edition book with motivational stories for kids.• Languages ​​English and Dutch. (With great success in more languages).• A website and marketing.I have made several contacts to realize this beautiful Confidence Cards for Kids. The total costs will amount to €25.000 euros. The challenge is that not the entire amount will be achieved. In that case the remaining amount will go to the Aflatoun charity, which is committed to education for children in third world countries.If you do not have the opportunity to make a donation and you still want to help, please share this project. Thank you for taking the time. I hope it will be a great success.

story:
I (Adesina Kehinde Olumuyiwa) am a passionate teacher and an Author with a vision to touch the future by impacting at least one child in every community of Nigeria through teaching and/or creative writing and publishing of Educational books. As a graduate of Biology Education from a reputable university in Nigeria. I have developed great passion for quality Education at all levels. I believe the right to quality education can not be taken away from children. It is what all child have no matter his/her gender, race, colour, religion, social status or financial level of parents.

Have'n been a Teacher in Secondary School for 10years now, I have found out ; I have that the gap between the education of the poor and the elites is extremely wide. This education inequality will not foster Faster National development, peace and unity. In a system where the Educational system and its cost favours the privileged few neglecting many who are poor, National unity cannot be achieved. The quality of education provided for children in the rural area and in the slum where we have the Low income earners especially at the Nursery and Primary level is extremely poor and cannot foster all-round development of a child.  

My ideology
Fact has revealed that 1 out of every 5 primary school dropouts in the world is a Nigerian. When a child miss out of pre-primary education, they are less likely to read, less likely to count and less likely to finish secondary school. The impact of dropping out of school is thus long lasting.  Pre-primary and primary education of every child should thus be put into serious consideration if we must have the future leaders we dream to leave behind at the end of our days. This is why I advocate for quality Basic Education for all irrespective of Race, Social status, financial capability, Background or Religion.
In my volunteering experiences ranging from LEAP Africa/Cities iLEAD project, LEAP Africa/British Council Fast forward project, LEAP Africa Lead the way project and others, where I have been involved in effecting change projects in the schools and communities around the schools where I was posted, has further exposed me to the poor educational system of most rural areas and has increase my passion for provision of quality education at all levels. 

  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.

This campaign is one that I am passionate about. Its stem from the manance of Educational inequalities brought about by a system of Educational funding which favours the privileged few at the expense of many who are poor or less privileged. Children of the rural areas and slums ate subjected to poor classrooms, poor learning infrastructures and low educational funding. In a place where quality basic education is available, the children of low income earners can not be afford such opportunity because of the high cost of the schools. It is therefore my desire to provide quality Montessori education at discounted prices and scholarship packages at rural areas and slums starting with my local Community. This is very important to me as it will gradually propel me towards achieving my vision of impacting at least one child in every community of Nigeria.

This campaign if adequately supported will not only bridge the gap of Educational inequalities and provide quality education at rural areas but will also assist the government in the provision of well equipped Basic education schools in the rural areas and slums. If blue print this project is followed sequentially and funding is made available, there will be a time when no child in the country will be without at least Basic education.

In order to start this project funding is needed to acquired an already identified property which is suitable for the preparatory, Nursery and primary school in the community of Eleidi Atala in Ota Ogun state. A total of 1.3 million naira is needed which will cater for the following as analysed below:

Property rantage - 350,000

White boards for classes (10psc) - 80,00 

Tables and chairs for classes- 200,000

Montessori teaching items - 80,000

Text books - 50,000

Desktop computer (5psc) - 150,000

Office printer- 25,000

Cabinets and bookshelf- 75,000

Training of teachers - 50,000

Video player and Flat screen TV (2ps)- 80,000

Painting Decoration of school walls and classes - 100,000

Generator - 50,000

Ceiling fans for office and classrooms - 50,000

Other teaching aids - 30,000

Notebooks and markers- 50,000

Miscellaneous - 80,000

Total- 1,500,00

This school will be unique in that it provides quality Montessori education which is not available at public schools and even most private schools who can not afford to run a Montessori school. It will provide this service at a discounted price to people and use the school to accommodate children of the less privileged who could be on full or partial scholarship. This project will also assist children who have dropped out of school due to financial challenges of their parents or due to loss of one of their parents.

However, if the target fund needed for this project is not achieved, the funs raised will be used to assist nearby schools to improve their teaching and learning infrastructure e.g donation of computer systems, renovation of classrooms, provision of Library stationaries e.t.c.

This project will be of huge impact as it will reduce the number of school dropout at the primary level and make quality education available to the rural children and the less privileged. It will assist the government to provide quality education at the grass root level.

I am so optimistic about this project because of my past achievement and involvement with various NGO's who focus on assisting to develope quality education in public and private schools. A notable example was the achievement of Fast forward project of LEAP Africa/Cities bank in which I was instrumental to providing internship placement for secondary school students in two different local government of Nigeria. Worthy of note also is the LEAP Africa/British Council iLEAD project in which I was instrumental to effecting different change projects in two different public secondary schools in Lagos Nigeria.

Path lighters  Educational  Foundation  faces  some  competition,  as  would  be expected  in  this  attractive  market. -  

Local  School  Authority  is  the  main  competitor.  It  has  some  strengths,  but  its  critical weakness  is  its  Large  Student  to  teacher  ratio,  poor  infrastructure,  congested classrooms  and  low  dedication  to  work.  This  will  restrict  its  capacity  to  compete.-

 The  Dynamic  School  also  has  a weakness  that  diminishes  its  effectiveness  in  the market.  In  this  case  the  weakness  is  its  High  fees,  accessibility  to  the  rural  area  and conventional  way  of  instruction  delivery..-  

D  ivy  International  School  is  also  a  potential  competitor,  but  again  it  has  an exploitable  weakness.  In  this  case  the  weakness  is  its  High  fee,  Tedious  admission process,  preference  given  to  the  children  of  the  elites.. Path  lighters  Educational  Foundation  will  be  able  to  exploit  the  weaknesses  of  its competitors  to  gain  market  position. In  summary,  the  high  demand  for  the  Path  lighters  Educational  Foundation  offers and  the  weaknesses  identified  in  its  main  competitors  provide  an  attractive  market opportunity. 

There will also be the challenge of identifying genuine less privileged children as people may be tempted to pose as a less privileged in order to benefit from the scholarship packages. However, we have mapped out strategies to identify children from families who are less privileged as guidelines and checks will be put in place to confirm their genuineness.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am aware that Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: if you are in this category you can be of help to this campaign a d project in the following ways:

  • Get the word of this project out and make some noise about this campaign on social media, to your friends and families, coworkers, Boss at work and notable educational activist that can assist the course by funding it.
  • Please Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools in sharing this campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I am Daniel. I worked for more than 20 years for the United Nations as Systems Architect and always had a great passion for software development and coding. I retired early not long ago and could now relax without having to work. Before I started working for the UN I developed a management system for a private school and since then it has been on my mind to do it again but this time with a much larger scope.

I am planning to build a software that is able to manage all aspects around the management of educational institutions - from primary schools to universities.

This software will be comprehensive in it’s functions and will contain modules for student management, finance, health, communication, attendance, library and more.

Further, to make this product stand out from similar products that are currently available on the market, there will be:
- an integration of school management, learning platform and web conferencing
- aggregation of data, which makes it interesting for groups of schools or for ministries of education of a city or state.

Your gain: 7% of future yearly net profit will be distributed among donors. 

Timeline: At the end of the fundraising campaign (September 2021) start of development. September 2022 initial roll-out of 50% of targeted functions and begin of marketing campaign. September 2023 deployment of finalized product.


 

Details

Background

My two daughters are in private school and the system their school is using is a patchwork of different applications and systems. There is no proper billing system in place and the invoices are sent manually by an admin staff. Communications are usually sent twice with the same content – there is no concept of “family grouping” in their system. Absences are never notified – ideally they should be instantly. And I have reasons to doubt that the system is compliant with European GDPR regulations.

At the same time there are many applications that are available on the market and that are able to do certain things well, but are not comprehensive. Some are comprehensive but not intuitive, and others again are not designed for large amount of traffic. And most were not built e.g. with the visually impaired in mind.

These are just a few reasons that convince me that a newly designed and structured system has great potential.


 

Education.zone system

The system will be build with functions that cover most aspects needed to manage a private or public school successfully. These include modules such as:

- Student administration (registration, enrollment, attendance, assignments, assessments, grading, class/timetable scheduling)
- Finance
- Health Records
- Library
- Housing
- Reports and Analytics
- Communication
- Human Resources

The system will be offered as an online service and will be built for high traffic demands. Each module will be developed as a standalone service to be ready for future scalability and high availability.

 

Potential and what is in it for you

The market is decisively big for such a product. There are competitors in this field but most software solutions in this area work for individual learning institutions. While Education.zone can also be used for single institutions, the aim is to offer this product as a solution for city, state or even national administrations as well as large school groups. As far as I know the only country who has successfully undertaken such a project as an e-government solution is Saudi Arabia (Noor software).

As an example a single region in India has approx. 900,000 primary and secondary schools, 8000 high-schools and colleges and 700 university. Imagine if the ministry of such a region would be able to detect where the schools with most student absences are, they could address the problem more efficiently. Or if they were able to see, based on crowd assessments, where the most talented children in the region are, then they could target these children with special education programs. Or if they at a glance would be able to see how the vaccination programs are being developed among children.

The plan is to roll-out the software during the first year in China, Russia, Ghana and Nepal, because of personal connections I have in these countries. There is also the possibility of collaboration with some of the United Nations agencies (e.g. school feeding project of WFP).

The goal is to have 1,000,000 registered children by the end of September 2024.


 

How your funds will be used

The funding goal is 625,000 CHF plus fees (5% indiegogo, 2.9% bank transfer fees). This will cover the first 3 years and will be split into these parts:

200,000 CHF (Sept 2021-Sept 2024)
This amount is divided in:
- 120,000 CHF for myself (3,300/month). Even though I have a pension and do not need to work, the reason for this is that we live on a farm and if I dedicate my time on this project, I will need to hire workers to do the farming job.
- 80,000 CHF for external developers, designers and quality/usability testers

400,000 CHF (Sept 2022 – Sept 2024)
Marketing. Besides having a strong web-presence, the goal is to initially start the campaign in 4 selected countries. 

25,000 CHF (Sept 2012 – Sept 2024)
Legal fees

 

The funding is fixed – the project will only start if funding is secured. The share for Marketing and Legal if requested, could be held on escrow account for 1 year until the marketing campaign starts.


Timeline

The development will start at the end of the fundraising campaign.

Sept 2021 – Sept 2022
Development of 50% of targeted modules.

Sept 2022 – Sept 2023
Development of rest of targeted modules.
Start of marketing campaign in selected countries.

Sept 2023 – Sept 2024
System improvements and bug fixing.
Continue with marketing campaign.

Sept 2024 ->
Either more external funds will be needed for marketing, or the project will be able to sustain itself at that point.


 

Risks

It’s a product and there is always the risks that it cannot be sold. A lot will depend on a good marketing strategy. For the product itself, I do guarantee that the system will be user friendly, stable and fast. I have over 25 years of experience in software development and on request, I’ll be glad to provide references.

The biggest risk is, if something would happen to me before the product is released. For this case I would sign an agreement to make sure that my wife would return all unused funds to the donors (in proportion to the donated amount).


/* end */

story:
~ REIMAGINING & REVOLUTIONIZING EDUCATIONAL DELIVERY ~

With the Information Age hurriedly falling away behind us, we experience more and more areas where Artificial Intelligence (AI) has replaced and obsoleted concepts, careers, educational and service provision across all sectors of the globe. The need to know has been satisfied and the knowledge market is oversaturated due to the influx of knowledge at our fingertips through the internet and smart technologies. The unique need which has emerged from this, is acquiring the ability to harness useful knowledge and put it to work for us. What is the use of knowledge, if it does not propel one to reaching their highest potential, achieving success in both worlds, and strengthening ones spiritual, mental, and physical aptitude? Knowledge is beneficial when it leads to productive actions, as it is a means to achieving ones’ goal, not the goal itself. 

Traditional educational institutes require students to acquire large percentages of useless knowledge that they often never revisit again beyond the classroom. This colossal waste of time is actually a money minting scheme. LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP has reimagined and revolutionized acquisition and delivery of education by rethinking on the effectiveness of its current delivery vs a more practical based educational delivery platform which benefits students by allowing them to acquire relevant knowledge which augments their lives both physically and spiritually. 

The foundational mainstay of the LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP’S Philosophy and ideology is  to deliver useful knowledge which affects productive actions leading to the achievement of goals which are beneficial resulting in individuals living their lives to the fullest, with the most dynamic and healthiest approach. 

LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP offers a unique and trailblazing approach to acquiring knowledge by combining three means of knowledge acquisition in a dynamic amalgamation, setting it apart from educational institutions as we know them. Our visionary founders have moved forward into the future from the Information Age to the Connected Age by creating a dynamic educational delivery platform in which useful information can be harnessed and leveraged using smart and technologically advanced networks. LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP ensures that students will spend equal amounts of time in self-study, studying with a professor and a direct acquisition through experience and involvement. This will be delivered through vast national and international networking as part of each of our educational programs. National and international study tours, virtual tours and tutoring, professional shadowing, appointed cybernetic academic advisors and professional mentors globally based, hands on training and deliberate networking are the strategies which will be implemented to provide students with a direct acquisition of knowledge and sets us apart. 

 

 

And the Rest is History...

Lighthouse Academia Group, Inc., successfully purchased an historical building in Charlotte Court House, VA, the prior J. Murray Jeffress Elementary School, built in 1952 for African Americans during segregation. As an African American, female-owned business, the purchase of the Jeffress school building provides Lighthouse Academia Group the ability to preserve a piece of African American heritage in the area while giving back quality education inclusive of all, in a diverse and welcome school environment. The once “Coloured” school, as is mentioned on the original blueprint, will now be renovated to deliver useful knowledge in an inclusive environment. Renovation of the Jeffress School building into a new center of learning, provides continuity of history for a community dedicated to educating the 21st century-ready student. 

The Impact

You can be instrumental in securing your place on the right side of history in the making by contributing to this cause and spreading the word. Funding will be spent on building smart, inclusive educational institutions which cater to the unique needs of diverse students, in a revolutionary and reimaged way. We are creating a dynamic educational delivery platform in which useful information can be harnessed and leveraged using smart and technologically advanced networks. Every dollar collected will go towards this project; it is up to you to determine how quickly we achieve the goal. 

 

Real Challenges

According to the US Federal Reserve’s Report to the Congress on the Availability of Credit to Small Businesses, more than 53% of African-American owned businesses are denied bank financing, a rate more than twice as high as white counterparts. When African Americans do receive approval for bank funding they are denied the full amount requested. Additionally, the state of affairs has so negatively impacted the African American entrepreneur that credit is only sought 25% of the time even when needed to sustain a business. 

Systemic racism historically affects the ability of Black-owned businesses to secure large loan amounts even when fully qualified. If you are reading this, you can change the outcomes with your support for this endeavor. 

Additionally, gender discrimination of female business owners continues to permeate throughout all industries. We intend to overcome these challenges by reaching out to the silent majority, who believe in equality and justice for all, and support innovative and progressive change.
story_txt:
~ REIMAGINING & REVOLUTIONIZING EDUCATIONAL DELIVERY ~

With the Information Age hurriedly falling away behind us, we experience more and more areas where Artificial Intelligence (AI) has replaced and obsoleted concepts, careers, educational and service provision across all sectors of the globe. The need to know has been satisfied and the knowledge market is oversaturated due to the influx of knowledge at our fingertips through the internet and smart technologies. The unique need which has emerged from this, is acquiring the ability to harness useful knowledge and put it to work for us. What is the use of knowledge, if it does not propel one to reaching their highest potential, achieving success in both worlds, and strengthening ones spiritual, mental, and physical aptitude? Knowledge is beneficial when it leads to productive actions, as it is a means to achieving ones’ goal, not the goal itself. 
Traditional educational institutes require students to acquire large percentages of useless knowledge that they often never revisit again beyond the classroom. This colossal waste of time is actually a money minting scheme. LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP has reimagined and revolutionized acquisition and delivery of education by rethinking on the effectiveness of its current delivery vs a more practical based educational delivery platform which benefits students by allowing them to acquire relevant knowledge which augments their lives both physically and spiritually. 
The foundational mainstay of the LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP’S Philosophy and ideology is  to deliver useful knowledge which affects productive actions leading to the achievement of goals which are beneficial resulting in individuals living their lives to the fullest, with the most dynamic and healthiest approach. 
LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP offers a unique and trailblazing approach to acquiring knowledge by combining three means of knowledge acquisition in a dynamic amalgamation, setting it apart from educational institutions as we know them. Our visionary founders have moved forward into the future from the Information Age to the Connected Age by creating a dynamic educational delivery platform in which useful information can be harnessed and leveraged using smart and technologically advanced networks. LIGHTHOUSE ACADEMIA GROUP ensures that students will spend equal amounts of time in self-study, studying with a professor and a direct acquisition through experience and involvement. This will be delivered through vast national and international networking as part of each of our educational programs. National and international study tours, virtual tours and tutoring, professional shadowing, appointed cybernetic academic advisors and professional mentors globally based, hands on training and deliberate networking are the strategies which will be implemented to provide students with a direct acquisition of knowledge and sets us apart. 
 
 

And the Rest is History...

story:
Radio King Academy

RKO Academy is our community arts school.  It was set up to provide opportunities for individuals within local communities who share the immense passion for the art of music and broadcast media (radio production) as we do here at RKO. What we believe we are doing in effect is bridging the growing gap between the entertainment industry and the people. We designed a course that is flexible and designed to meet the needs of people of various ages and radio interest levels. Our courses are integral in helping build up participants with their confidence in recognising their passions and progressively pursuing careers in their chosen fields.

Reaching our crowd funder target means we can offer up to 10 schools our services by the end of 2018;  positively affecting the lives of up to 250 young people. 

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise £10000 for Radio King Academy, this will go towards tutor costs, digital broadcast equipment and administrative materials such as memory sticks, Whiteboards and notepads that can be used in our practical and theory based sessions. 

We have exciting Unique perks on offer for all contributing financially. ​

The Impact

As a contributor to Radio King Academy, you not only get to witness the progression of our project but will be directly responsible for positively changing the lives of young people who may be on the periphery of being at risk. Your kind contributions mean Radio King Academy can make a significant contribution to addressing a number of the pressing issues faced by our young people.

We've had the opportunity to work with youth centres and schools all across London. We are fortunate to work with exclusion schools using our skills to boost students confidence preparing them to return to mainstream schools with a better understanding and awareness of being responsible and positively creative. Below is a live example of our courses in action and the Radio documentary that was created from the project.

A Day with Vital Youth (Westminster) https://vimeo.com/108993944

Master The Word Radio Documentary:  https://soundcloud.com/create-3/sets/master-the-word-radio

Risks & Challenges

1) There is a major lack of diversity in the tech and broadcast media industries. London is made up of more than 270 nationalities with more than 300 languages now spoken in the capital’s schools, so what does it really mean to be British? Mayor of London, Saadiq Khan recently published an ambitious strategy for City Hall. As a call to individuals and organisations that can help the GLA group to make London a more inclusive city.

2) The Internet is a fantastic place for children to learn, create and have fun, but they may occasionally have to deal with a variety of sometimes challenging issues. These might include cyberbullying, a pressure to take part in sexting, encouragement to self-harm, viewing pornography, along with various others. according to Cyberbullying statistics from the i-SAFE foundation Over half of adolescents and teens have been bullied online, and about the same number have engaged in cyberbullying.More than 1 in 3 young people have experienced cyber threats online. Over 25 percent of adolescents and teens have been bullied repeatedly through their cell phones or the Internet. Well over half of the young people do not tell their parents when cyberbullying occurs.

Our solution

Radio King Academy combines tech and broadcast production in a practical-digestible course that promotes online safety and uniquely encourages the importance of diversity. This is done through the use of radio production and a specifically devised curriculum constructed expertly to teach Internet safety. Radio King provides guidance in sourcing work experience within tech and broadcast media through practical involvement. One of our participants; Ishtia May, was recently granted work experience at BBC Radio 1. Radio King Academy combines tech and broadcast production in a practical-digestible course that promotes online safety and uniquely encourages the importance of diversity. This is done through the use of radio production and a specifically devised curriculum constructed expertly to teach Internet safety. Radio King provides guidance in sourcing work experience within tech and broadcast media through practical involvement.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. Here are other ways you can help :

Word of mouth; Spread the word amongst your networks, friends and family.

Share our Indiegogo page on your social media networks whether Twitter, Instagram, SnapChat, FaceBook or any other Social media platform with an audience.

Thank You for your time and support :)

Radio King Academy

story:
Short Summary

Being locked down during COVID made me realize how much kids have shifted their attention to social media and games. This shift is reducing the ability to focus and be patient, which I observed in my kids. 

As a project to actively bring back thinking and reasoning among kids, we embarked on the journey of creating Beyond Math led by my daughter Jasmine Uboma, a statistics undergraduate, class of 2025. Jasmine enjoys math and her passion is to bring the love of math and reasoning to other kids. Jasmine is the founder and CEO of Beyond Math. She is 17 years old and believes she can connect with kids through learning, having volunteered in many community outlets such as The E2 Young Engineers and Hockey games. She loves to organize activities for elementary kids which include hosting birthday parties, leadership and entrepreneurship conferences. She has a great connection working with school kids and they simply just love her. Beyond Math will be a platform where she will actively engage and share her passion and charisma with kids while learning analytical reasoning.

Beyond Math is co-authored by Jasmine Uboma, Jamike Uboma and Nnenna Uboma. 

Beyond Math aims to teach kids the analytical reasoning technique to problem solve.

Practicing the exercises in this workbook will help a child develop 

----math solving techniques 

----analytical and critical thinking

----creativity and resilience

----strategic and active learning 

----complex problem solving and reasoning 

skills required to thrive in the ever-changing complex society we live in. 

Analytical thinking is rated the #1 skill for future jobs. One gap that exists today is that the math taught in schools is based on repetitive formulas carried over the years, eliminating the adaptation to the advancement in digital occurrences more aligned to us today.

What We Need & What You Get

Beyond Math aims to go above the math formulas and bridge the gap of reasoning and out-of-the-box thinking as the value add required in today's workplace.

Beyond Math uses basic mathematical rules: multiplication, division, addition and subtraction to build links and roots between numbers.

Unraveling the hidden gaps has become an essential skill as we move more into the digitally automated black box machines. Beyond Math teaches the unravelling of hidden links between random sets of numbers through observation and reasoning  skills for complex problem solving.

Jasmine's strategic plan for Beyond Math is to develop an entrepreneurial no-fee franchise for her peers targeting undergraduate students enabling early entrepreneurship and community engagement. My role is simply being a mother, helping Jasmine to  win. I'm Nnenna Uboma, a mother of three and an analytics professional.

Please support Jasmine by making her an entrepreneur at 17 years old through backing her project of $5000. It is either she meets the target or loose all. With these funds, Jasmine is able to enrich her peers through entrepreneurial franchising as well as nurturing a generation of problem solvers and innovators.

Risks & Challenges

The risk associated with this project is low as the publishing and printing costs are available. The funds are required to create marketing campaigns and build the Learning Management System for the tutoring series and franchising. The funds will make it possible for Jasmine to have the ability to enable Beyond Math reach many school aged kids so that together we can build a generation of Innovators and problem solvers

www.beyondmath.ca

contact@beyondmath.ca

story:
What's Up With all the Apps?

I build a new app every week for the react native community. My thinking behind this is to create a mobile dev community that dominates the world.

What's Up With The Money?

Here's exactly what the money is going to be used for.

Side Note: I promise to have a video out for this soon. Adobe Premiere still intimidates me a little.

  • Iphone 7 plus (~$900) : I need the plus for better videos, better app testing and because I have huge ass hands
  • 2016 Macbook pro (~ $1500):  My current System is ridiculously old (2012) and pretty embarrassing.
  • Part-time UI/UX Director ~$2000: As I mentioned here, art direction is crucial.
  • My Time As A Tech Lead $0: ~1 (month) * ( Lead Developer annual salary in Austin / 12 months) * 0 for being awesome.
  • Boosted Board ~$1000: Transportation.... right?
  • Baller Website ~$800: To make life easier for you guys while consuming my courses
  •  Indigogo's cut ~$325

When's The Course Coming?

20- 35 days post this campaign

What will you be covering?

  • How To build beautiful apps quickly (in React Native of course)
  • How I & most agencies that use RN structure Quality Assurance(bug fixes)
  • How to manage state at scale.

Who is this not for?

  • Absolute beginners

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word to peeps in your incubator or workspace
  • Share this campaign with someone you would personally like to work with in the next year.

story:
INTRODUCTION

We represent a Village in Southern Ukraine, only 70 kilometers from occupied Crimea, Kozachi Laheri. The Kozachi Varta, a volounteer organisation here, has helped the local community, families and others in conflict zones of Ukraine for over a year now.  www.kozachi.com.

We lived in this village, and my wife is from this village, we moved from the village last year as we wanted to help Ukrainian society from within Europe. We feel humble and privileged to be able to help this way.

The communities in Southern Ukraine and in Eastern Ukraine is in need of your help to support children been displaced and temporarily located in less conflict filled areas of Kherson region at the moment. 10s of thousands of children have fled with their families into Kherson region, and are now living there in hopes of being either able to move back to where they came from, or to settle down in their new environment.

Unfortunately the public systems cannot help much, and most is possible with volounteer activities with housing, clothes, food, medical and school material etc.

There is no lack of people willing to help, but there is a problem to fund activities paying for simple things needed for the children and for their families. 

 Why this is important for us, starting this campaign. 

Fall is approaching and temperatures will begin to fall, and winter will come soon with a dramatic increase in need for help to especially the children.

We hope people will donate what they think they can afford, the amount does not matter, it is the thought that is important. To show you care about these children, some being left alone with strangers now, some need medical attention with simple illnesses till injuries inflicted during the conflict.

We ask for you to care about the children of Ukraine, it is the future of the country, and Ukraine rely on its future to prosper.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We aim for 100,000 USD. This money will go to assist directly to families been affected by the war, where children are involved. We assist bringing help directly to the families, and provide help with food, housing and medical help where needed. 
  • Kozachka Varta has helped the society with projects  form cleaning village to food programs and clothes to army. Latest project was to repair roads leading into the village. A project which was shown on national TV channels.
  • Kozachka Varta consists of people engaged for a long period of time, with encouragement through their willpower to help others despite their own problems due to the conflict.
  • If we do not reach our final goal with the funding, the amount will go to Kozachka Varta regardless, as we are of the opinion that any amount will help them.
  • We will announce all contributors on our website (kozachi.com) and also plans to make a contributors list in the village where the organisation has its head quarters.

The Impact

About your campaign and how the difference their contribution will make:

  • We want to help Ukrainian children where they are, it is most cost effective and also the most effective in order to avoid cultural challenges.
  • Thousands of children are in need for food, clothes, medical help, school assistance and housing in Kherson region alone. Your contribution will matter and be felt almost immediately.
  • Kozachka Varta has in several projects collected money for food, clothes and infrastructure projects, and all projects have been successful. More about these projects can bee seen on the web site www.kozahi.com
  • Projects based on this money will be announced on our web site www.kozachi.com as well as sought press attention in national media to ensure knowledge about the money spent according to our intentions.

Risks & Challenges

We will openly tell how much money has been spent on various projects helping Ukrainian children displaced in Ukraine, and their families. We will openly tell it in news media, on our web site, and press releases to be made by the organisation.

Our people has and will have contact with other organisations working on voluntarily basis to ensure funds are used as efficient as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you want to help, but can't contribute financially, does not mean YOU can't help us:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We hope for your help to help the displaced children of Ukraine, and want to make a reference made by UNICEF

“We are very concerned that children are paying the highest price in this growing crisis in Ukraine," Elsby said. "Damaged infrastructure, water shortages and hampered access to medical facilities in the areas of ongoing fighting are putting children’s lives at risk. ...
"Children are also at risk of communicable diseases due to the lack of hygiene supplies, medicines and vaccines in conflict-affected areas. ... Exposure to the violent fighting and shelling is affecting their psychological well-being.”
New data show that with 147 schools closed because of the fighting, some 50,000 children in parts of Donetsk have not been going to classes since September. UNICEF said some schools are in ruins and others have been shut because of safety concerns. 
Elsby said the situation is also bleak in government-controlled areas, where 187 educational institutions have been damaged or destroyed.
“There are limited opportunities for displaced children to be integrated into the education system in host communities elsewhere in Ukraine," she said. Some parents, she added, are not registering their children in schools "as they expect further displacement or intend to return home.”
UNICEF said it is critical for children to go to school, especially in the midst of a crisis. It said school provides children with stability and structure, which helps alleviate the trauma of living in conflict zones.

Use the Indiegogo share tools! "Damaged infrastructure, water shortages and hampered access to medical facilities in the areas of ongoing fighting are putting children’s lives at risk. ..."Children are also at risk of communicable diseases due to the lack of hygiene supplies, medicines and vaccines in conflict-affected areas. ... Exposure to the violent fighting and shelling is affecting their psychological well-being.”New data show that with 147 schools closed because of the fighting, some 50,000 children in parts of Donetsk have not been going to classes since September. UNICEF said some schools are in ruins and others have been shut because of safety concerns. Elsby said the situation is also bleak in government-controlled areas, where 187 educational institutions have been damaged or destroyed.“There are limited opportunities for displaced children to be integrated into the education system in host communities elsewhere in Ukraine," she said. Some parents, she added, are not registering their children in schools "as they expect further displacement or intend to return home.”UNICEF said it is critical for children to go to school, especially in the midst of a crisis. It said school provides children with stability and structure, which helps alleviate the trauma of living in conflict zones.

story:
Operation: #LegalAid Beyond Borders™

Sponsor a Sudanese Refugee Family in Syria to start a new life in Canada. 

"Nexus Advocacy Legal Foundation is the most effective NGO that you've never head of. "

We are based in Washington State, USA and Metro-Vancouver, Canada and operate as a cross-border non-profit legal advocacy center.


Founded in 2001 and Incorporated in 2014, Nexus Advocacy operates in Canada, the USA, Ireland and South Sudan.  Dedicated to expanding Access to Justice and Economic Opportunity around the globe, Nexus uses both Social Enterprise and Non-Profit advocacy to make a difference in our clients' lives. 

  • Our Advocacy Team members shared a common personal experience of conflict from Belfast to Darfur;
  • Now based in Vancouver & Seattle, we work together to advocate for "expat workers and exiles" both at home in North America and abroad.
  • We help people start new lives in a new country through legal immigration programs, micro-finance, and post-conflict therapy. 

Syria's Forgotten Refugees.

Most people don't know that there are African Christian minorities trapped in the middle of a sectarian civil war in Syria. 

Our Sudanese Refugee Families fled Darfur & South Sudan to escape persecution and ethnic cleansing at the hands of the Janjaweed.  They fled to Damascus for safety only to find themselves in the middle of the Syrian civil war.  They are trapped in a war zone but you can help us to rescue them and bring them to Canada. 

We Need Your Help to Sponsor Our First Family.

Canadian law allows for Community Groups and "Groups of Five" Private Citizens to sponsor UN-approved Refugees to come start a new life in Canada with Permanent Residency.   We plan to bring 20 families to Canada over Fiscal Year 2015-2016.

  • We need your help to launch our #LegalAid Beyond Borders™ project so that we can manage the operation from Damascus to Vancouver ourselves and maintain program integrity.
  • We are selecting the first African family in Syria to be sponsored by a Vancouver "Group of Five" patrons.
  • Our #LegalAid Beyond Borders™ project will advocate for the family to ensure that they receive UN-certification and legal status in Syria during the process.
  • We will handle the legal caseworking for Canadian immigration sponsorship in-house and pro-bono in order to keep the costs down.
  • Once the first family arrives in Vancouver, we will fund their housing & health insurance for one year in order to help them get established.
  • Our philosophy of Ethical Migration means that we will fund the family privately so that they do not need to take public benefits from the Canadian authorities.
  • Every dollar/pound/euro helps us get closer to bringing the first family to Canada so whether we reach our goal or not, we are proceeding with the sponsorship by faith. 

Rescue a Family.

If you are in Metro Vancouver, think about whether you want to join an existing Group of Five Private Sponsors for our African-Syrian families.  If you are elsewhere in Canada, ask us about forming a new Group of Five in your community.  If you are in the United States (or the rest of the world), please tell your friends, donate, and come join us in a movement that rescues people around the world. 

  • We can't wait for government action, we have the legal tools to rescue people, one family at a time. 
  • We have successfully won work permits, Permanent Residency, and national ID cards for our pro-bono clients since 2001.
  • Our Senior Immigration Counsel is licensed federally in Canada to practice immigration, citizenship, and refugee law.  

Risks & Challenges

The situation is becoming urgent.  Our families can't go back to Sudan.  And they are increasingly vulnerable in Syria.  We want to bring them legally to Canada so that we don't see any photos of children drowning on Mediterranean beaches.

  • We have successfully litigated Canadian immigration & refugee cases for nearly 15 years and have the legal skills to win these Sponsorship Applications.
  • Our plan is to select the first family with the best chances of getting approval by Citizenship & Immigration Canada (CIC).

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray for our Families.  Tell your friends and colleagues about our #LegalAid Beyond Borders™ project.  Contact us about sending clothing & housewares once the first families arrive.  Keep in touch with us.  

  • Please share this important practical project on social media!
  • Contact us about becoming an Nexus Advocate in your community anywhere in the world!

Remember our motto and live by it when faced with trouble:

#Forward is the only way.™

story:
Short Summary

Designed to celebrate the innovative ideas of youth business leaders, the i.Invest National Youth Entrepreneur Business Competition is a web-based program for teens 13 to 19 years old with demonstrable products and services in three categories - general, technology and socially-conscious (i.e. non-profit and clean/green). Youth entrepreneurs will participate in up to three rounds of scoring, receive feedback on their business concept and pitching capabilities from top industry leaders and position themselves to win cash, in-kind prizes, and equity or non-equity investments.

The primary goal of the competition is to connect at least 100 youth entrepreneurs from across the country to top industry mentors and coaches. These leaders will assist youth virtually in improving their business model and pitching skills. Youth will also be equipped and inspired to compete in the real-world marketplace. 

In addition, i.Invest will showcase the entrepreneurial spirit of the nation’s brightest young business leaders; educate youth about business development and product presentation and position them for future investments and mentorship.

It is free to compete. Application submission opened March 1st and will end on May 1st. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise at least $5,000. The funds will be used to create cash prizes for our top winners and "community investments" for select youth businesses. Our community investment initiative will provide non-equity investments for high- growth potential youth businesses regardless of their scores. Prizes will be awarded during the finale event in November 2016. Winners will be selected based on their innovative concepts, business models and pitching capabilities. 

Donors will play a key role in helping us reward the hard work and commitment of youth entrepreneurs from across the country. For your contribution, you will be listed on the award certificate, provided discounted admissions to all i.Invest events and free promotional items.

There is no better way to nurture the next generation of business leaders than to make a financial contribution to help youth further develop their business ideas and make their dreams come true. 

The Impact

i.Invest will help nurture the next generation of business leaders by positioning young entrepreneurs to create new businesses that will provide economic fortitude for communities across the country. Research shows that more net new jobs are created by small businesses. By encouraging entrepreneurial growth early, connecting youth business leaders to mentors and providing seed funding, we can ensure the sustainability of business growth, job creation and innovation. 

Risks & Challenges

i.Invest is a "grassroots" effort to create a viable competition platform for youth across the country regardless of their affiliation with existing entrepreneurship programs or their geographical location. From Maine to Arizona, youth with a serious interest in learning business development can compete for prizes and recognition. 

Without your support this program can not take flight.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We encourage everyone to give; but, if making a financial contribution isn't feasible, please consider offering an in-kind award to select participants. To do so, complete the sponsorship form: HERE. Also, we encourage you to help us spread the word to youth entrepreneurs everywhere.

story:
Short Summary

The common unity coloring book was created as a result to address the pain and suffering of children who have been abused or neglected.Giving children an opportuniy to work in a creative enviornment to allow themselves to focus on a creative outlet rather than the pain of their situation. These coloring books will be distributed to police departments, juvenile centers, and children shelters at no charge. Each day hundreds of children are forced to exist in a situation that they did not create. If we can put a smile on these children's faces maybe hope can spring forward. The funds raised will be used to complete the production of these coloring books. My past projects have involved supplying books and school supplies to children who were devastated by typhoons impacting the Philippine Islands.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised will be used to complete production of theses children's coloring books. The more funds that are raised the larger our distribution will be.

The Impact

Each day abused and neglected children are removed from homes that have hurt them both physically and emotionally. Giving these children a creative outlet often helps to ease the pain and inspire hope.

Risks & Challenges

I have worked as a law enforcement officer and provider of social services for decades. When you look into the eyes of an abused or neglected child it inspires you to help any way you can.
