story:
Short Summary

My name is Bruno Poggi, I am a University professor.

I teach Political Communication in a small private University of Rome, the UNINT (International University of Rome).

I have written two books of political essaies.

Last year I founded, with others colleagues, the Pareto University.

This is without any doubt the most important and fascinating project of my life.

It's a real chance to change the world and to offer the opportunity to have a better future to thousands of young Africans .

All over the world and especially in Africa there still are many barriers for young Africans to access higher education.

There are economic barriers: the average cost to enroll in one African country is the equivalent of 50.000 USD for an American citizen.

There are geographical barriers: large distances and limited mobility makes it hard to attend university for those who don't live in the city.

Women face cultural, economic and social barriers ( usually in African families, if there is a chance to access higher education for just one member, it is given to a boy rather than a girl).

The level of education often isn’t high: inferior quality of education is a social scandal and can also be a personal tragedy.

With the initiative of the Pareto University, through e-learning, all these barriers collapse:

  1.       it’s affordable (the annual fee varies from 170 to 399 USD for year, that is on average 90% less that a normal university);
  2.       it’s accessible (the student has a smartphone or a tablet);
  3.       it’s high quality because the are international teachers who come from all the world.

It’s a University without borders, without limits of space and time, it’s opened 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

The Pareto University is a stable reality: it offers four courses (Economics, Journalism, Tourism and Computer Engineering) and one master in Tourism. There are 20 teachers, over 200 lessons available (Subtitled in English or French),  and one library with more 1000 books.

We have the necessity to grow and to reach many young Africans and we need your help.

Make a donation and become a Supportive partner of the Pareto University.

With 100 USD you can help us to buy a tablet to donate to our students who can't afford one, and help them to study.

Furthermore you can also donate for a scholarship (or to have one of the building of our virtual Campus composed by 14 buildings) named after you.

Because if many give even a little, we can do a lot.

If you agree with our way of thinking:

“We are reasonable, we want just the impossible. We change the world”.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of the campaign is to reach 50.000 dollars.

This sum could be use to enroll many African students, to purchase tablets that the students can use to follow the courses and to take exams, to ensure access to the  Internet, to set up study rooms in the Pareto Points.

The Pareto Points are spaces with Internet connection, set by Private, Public or Religious institutions, where students can socialize, study, attend classes and take exams through E-learning.

As a thanksgiving for your help:

  •       5 dollars: letter of thanksgiving by the CEO of the Pareto University.

  •       10 dollars: letter of thanksgiving by the CEO and the Rector of the Pareto University.

  •       20 dollars: letter of thanksgiving by the CEO, the Rector and the Teachers of the Pareto University.

 

  •       25 dollars: a Supporting Partner Diploma.

  •       50  dollars: Honorary Diploma.

  •       100 dollars: have your name on a tablet donation (this tablet is donated by...) and a letter of thanksgiving with student photo with the tablet donated with dedication.

  •         200 dollars: scholarship dedicated to a special person ( for example in memory of...) to a student from: Benin, Burkina Faso, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Liberia,  Mali, Niger, Sierra Leone or Somalia. The donors will have a photo portrait, of themselves or a special person, in the Hall of Fame of the Virtual  Campus and a letter of thanksgiving by the beneficiary student.

  •       400 dollars: a scholarship dedicated to a special person (in memory of…),  to a student from Cameroon, Cape Verde, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Nigeria, Senegal or Togo. Otherwise, two scholarships for two students  of  Benin, Burkina Faso, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Sierra Leone or Somalia. The contributors are going to have a photo portrait, of themselves or a special person, in the Hall of Fame of the Virtual  Campus and a letter of thanksgiving by the beneficiary/ies student/students.

The Campus of the Pareto University is composed by 14 Virtual buildings.

Each building has an economic value.

The first donor, based on the sum associated at Virtual building, can choose to dedicate the building to a special person for one year and can also have a permanent photo portrait in the Hall of Fame and a certificate, valid for one year, attesting the title of the building.

Below, the buildings of the virtual campus and the corresponding economic value:

  •       Market Store: 500 dollars;
  •       Sport Center: 600 dollars;
  •       Student’s Pub: 700 dollars;
  •       Reception Office: 800 dollars;
  •       Cinema/Theater: 900 dollars;
  •       Student’s Association: 1.000 dollars;
  •       Library:  1.200 dollars;
  •       Hall of Fame: 1.500 dollars;
  •       Museum: 1.750 dollars;
  •       Great Hall: 2.000 dollars;
  •       Teacher’s Office: 2.250 dollars;
  •       Congress Center: 2.500 dollars;
  •       Class Room: 2.750 dollars;
  •       Rectorate: 3.000 dollars.

 

 

If we don't achieve the goal of 50.000 dollars, the amount raised will still be used to increase the number of young Africans enrolled at the Pareto University, through scholarship awards and, as far as the amount will let it, the purchase of tablets for the most needy students.

 

The Impact

This project is very important for you and for the whole world.

It’s very important for you, because you will be the main actor of a historical revolution for the African education system: The first real online University, fully accredited and acknowledged, economical, affordable, of high quality and with international teachers.

Important to the world, because finally all the barriers that will prevent university access to young Africans will be torn down.

With Pareto University, economic, territorial, social, cultural and gender barriers will fall.

Pareto is an online university that is affordable for young Africans in poor countries.

It’s economically accessible, the title of study is already recognized in eighteen African countries, that is  about 440 million people, almost the European population, net of the Great Britain and with the decisive factor being that half the potential basin is under 18 years old.

Degrees, as well as masters, have the same quality system of European titles study, the European Qualifications Framework.

For residents of many African countries, enrolling at a University can be very difficult and extremely expensive: It’s a figure close to about thirty months of an average salary.

To understand the economic weight, just think what it would mean for an European to pay a fee of fifty thousand euros a year.

 Consequence: In Africa, only one percent of the population is graduated.

Help Africa in Africa. Increasing the level of preparation of African boys and girls means giving them career opportunities and therefore having fewer people forced to flee from their home, fewer men and women willing to put themselves into the hands of criminals in the hope of a better life.

To act on causes not effects.  The goal of the Pareto University is to bring in Africa a European level of education, affordable to all with teachers who come from four continents.

The ruling class currently is composed by a privileged class, privileged sons, that graduated abroad.

We believe that besides being a right for every human being, education is the factor that determines the destinies of a young man or a young woman and therefore of a whole country.

The difference. What are the factors that makes Pareto University different from the other Universities?

First of all, it is economically affordable: One year costs from 170 to 399 dollars -  equal to three months of average income and not thirty, as it has always been – and can be attended from all,  at any time of day and night, 365 days a year, just by connecting to the University site. Furthermore, free application allows you to follow the lessons with a smartphone: being the lessons recorded, even working students can attend classes.

For the women. The most discriminated in access to education are women, for both religious and cultural reasons. If you have five children, families are going to let the males study, there are no exceptions to this. Thanks to this project many women will have access to university education, even in secret.

Prospects for foreign companies. Increasing the level of education also means creating new markets for foreign companies.

The regularity of the exams. Unlike traditional online universities, where examinations take place physically, Pareto University only allows online exams. This is possible thanks to a software similar to the airports software, that recognizes the student identity through a webcam, along with other control systems. This is another feature that makes the Pareto system unique.

Recognized titles. Currently there are on-line courses in economics, journalism, engineering and computer science, with recognized degree in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameron, Cape Verde, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Cote d'Ivoire, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia and Togo. Other courses in preparation are: psychology, tourism and interpreting. The headquarter is in Malta, a member country of the EU. Consequently, degrees and masters are evaluated according European Qualifications Framework, the quality system of European degrees.

Solidarity scholarship. An interesting topic for companies, but also for private individuals: anyone, investing around  200 dollars and believing in the project of a real and concrete education, can donate a scholarship and dedicate it to the memory of one's own dear person or a cause that he or she deems important. In order to help and give hope for better education to those who dream of studying, the university guarantees the lenders by sending them the contacts and the generalities of the students who will receive of the scholarship.

This initiative has already attracted the attention of some Italian media as demonstrated by the following links:

http://www.repubblica.it/solidarieta/cooperazione/2017/03/15/news/africa-160624669/

http://www.faccecaso.com/2017/03/17/universita-online-africa-studenti/ 

http://www.tag24.it/175437-lafrica-e-online-grazie-alla-pareto-university/

Thanks to this project many young Africans can realize their dream of getting a degree and thus start working in the world with greater security and awareness of their abilities.

Through the teaching method implemented by Pareto University, thanks to internationally trained teachers, many young graduates, with equated and accredited qualifications, will be able to develop their professional skills directly in Africa, thus helping it to grow.

For example, they will be able to start their business, to provide their professional skills to other companies interested in investing in Africa, or simply to look for a high skilled job.

 

Risks & Challenges

The obstacles and the solutions that the project may encounter are listed below:

Problem: Don’t have the political support of African governments.

Solution: Pareto University has already reached agreements with 18 African States, it is a consolidated reality.

Problem: The scholarships of Africans may not be recognized out of the continent.

Solution: Pareto University is headquartered in Malta, a member of the European Union, so the Degrees and the Master are evaluated according to the European Qualifications Framework.

Problem: Contributors may not have confidence in how their money will be used.

Solution: Pareto University guarantees the contributors by sending them the general information and contact details of the scholarship and the student who will benefit from it.

Problem: Exams may not be regular.

Solution: Pareto University controls online exams through a software that recognizes students' identity through a webcam, together with other control systems.

Problem: Some families may deny access to online university education to women.

Solution: Thanks to scholarships, 365 days a year access to Online University and thanks to Pareto Point, they can study, even in secret.

Problem: Young people are working and they can’t attend lessons.

Solution: A free application from Pareto University allows you to follow lessons with your smartphone as well. The University is open 365 days a year, 24 hours a day, and lessons are registered, giving the opportunity to attend the Degree courses also for working students.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may also contribute by sharing the campaign on all social media or in the way you feel most appropriate.

Contact CEO:

poggi@paretouniversity.com

Contact Press Office:

ufficiostampa@comciso.com

Thank you all!

It’s a University without borders, without limits of space and time, it’s opened 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
The Pareto University is a stable reality: it offers four courses (Economics, Journalism, Tourism and Computer Engineering) and one master in Tourism. There are 20 teachers, over 200 lessons available (Subtitled in English or French),  and one library with more 1000 books.
We have the necessity to grow and to reach many young Africans and we need your help.
Make a donation and become a Supportive partner of the Pareto University.
With 100 USD you can help us to buy a tablet to donate to our students who can't afford one, and help them to study.

Furthermore you can also donate for a scholarship (or to have one of the building of our virtual Campus composed by 14 buildings) named after you.
Because if many give even a little, we can do a lot.
If you agree with our way of thinking:
“We are reasonable, we want just the impossible. We change the world”.

 
What We Need & What You Get
The goal of the campaign is to reach 50.000 dollars.
This sum could be use to enroll many African students, to purchase tablets that the students can use to follow the courses and to take exams, to ensure access to the  Internet, to set up study rooms in the Pareto Points.
The Pareto Points are spaces with Internet connection, set by Private, Public or Religious institutions, where students can socialize, study, attend classes and take exams through E-learning.
As a thanksgiving for your help:
      5 dollars: letter of thanksgiving by the CEO of the Pareto University.

      10 dollars: letter of thanksgiving by the CEO and the Rector of the Pareto University.

      20 dollars: letter of thanksgiving by the CEO, the Rector and the Teachers of the Pareto University.
 

      25 dollars: a Supporting Partner Diploma.

      50  dollars: Honorary Diploma.

      100 dollars: have your name on a tablet donation (this tablet is donated by...) and a letter of thanksgiving with student photo with the tablet donated with dedication.

        200 dollars: scholarship dedicated to a special person ( for example in memory of...) to a student from: Benin, Burkina Faso, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Liberia,  Mali, Niger, Sierra Leone or Somalia. The donors will have a photo portrait, of themselves or a special person, in the Hall of Fame of the Virtual  Campus and a letter of thanksgiving by the beneficiary student.

      400 dollars: a scholarship dedicated to a special person (in memory of…),  to a student from Cameroon, Cape Verde, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Nigeria, Senegal or Togo. Otherwise, two scholarships for two students  of  Benin, Burkina Faso, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Sierra Leone or Somalia. The contributors are going to have a photo portrait, of themselves or a special person, in the Hall of Fame of the Virtual  Campus and a letter of thanksgiving by the beneficiary/ies student/students.

The Campus of the Pareto University is composed by 14 Virtual buildings.
Each building has an economic value.
The first donor, based on the sum associated at Virtual building, can choose to dedicate the building to a special person for one year and can also have a permanent photo portrait in the Hall of Fame and a certificate, valid for one year, attesting the title of the building.

Below, the buildings of the virtual campus and the corresponding economic value:

      Market Store: 500 dollars;
      Sport Center: 600 dollars;
      Student’s Pub: 700 dollars;
      Reception Office: 800 dollars;
      Cinema/Theater: 900 dollars;
      Student’s Association: 1.000 dollars;
      Library:  1.200 dollars;
      Hall of Fame: 1.500 dollars;
      Museum: 1.750 dollars;
      Great Hall: 2.000 dollars;
      Teacher’s Office: 2.250 dollars;
      Congress Center: 2.500 dollars;
      Class Room: 2.750 dollars;
      Rectorate: 3.000 dollars.

 

 
If we don't achieve the goal of 50.000 dollars, the amount raised will still be used to increase the number of young Africans enrolled at the Pareto University, through scholarship awards and, as far as the amount will let it, the purchase of tablets for the most needy students.


 
The Impact
This project is very important for you and for the whole world.
It’s very important for you, because you will be the main actor of a historical revolution for the African education system: The first real online University, fully accredited and acknowledged, economical, affordable, of high quality and with international teachers.
Important to the world, because finally all the barriers that will prevent university access to young Africans will be torn down.

With Pareto University, economic, territorial, social, cultural and gender barriers will fall.
Pareto is an online university that is affordable for young Africans in poor countries.

It’s economically accessible, the title of study is already recognized in eighteen African countries, that is  about 440 million people, almost the European population, net of the Great Britain and with the decisive factor being that half the potential basin is under 18 years old.
Degrees, as well as masters, have the same quality system of European titles study, the European Qualifications Framework.
For residents of many African countries, enrolling at a University can be very difficult and extremely expensive: It’s a figure close to about thirty months of an average salary.

To understand the economic weight, just think what it would mean for an European to pay a fee of fifty thousand euros a year.
 Consequence: In Africa, only one percent of the population is graduated.
Help Africa in Africa. Increasing the level of preparation of African boys and girls means giving them career opportunities and therefore having fewer people forced to flee from their home, fewer men and women willing to put themselves into the hands of criminals in the hope of a better life.

To act on causes not effects.  The goal of the Pareto University is to bring in Africa a European level of education, affordable to all with teachers who come from four continents.
The ruling class currently is composed by a privileged class, privileged sons, that graduated abroad.
We believe that besides being a right for every human being, education is the factor that determines the destinies of a young man or a young woman and therefore of a whole country.

The difference. What are the factors that makes Pareto University different from the other Universities?
First of all, it is economically affordable: One year costs from 170 to 399 dollars -  equal to three months of average income and not thirty, as it has always been – and can be attended from all,  at any time of day and night, 365 days a year, just by connecting to the University site. Furthermore, free application allows you to follow the lessons with a smartphone: being the lessons recorded, even working students can attend classes.

For the women. The most discriminated in access to education are women, for both religious and cultural reasons. If you have five children, families are going to let the males study, there are no exceptions to this. Thanks to this project many women will have access to university education, even in secret.

Prospects for foreign companies. Increasing the level of education also means creating new markets for foreign companies.

The regularity of the exams. Unlike traditional online universities, where examinations take place physically, Pareto University only allows online exams. This is possible thanks to a software similar to the airports software, that recognizes the student identity through a webcam, along with other control systems. This is another feature that makes the Pareto system unique.

Recognized titles. Currently there are on-line courses in economics, journalism, engineering and computer science, with recognized degree in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameron, Cape Verde, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Cote d'Ivoire, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia and Togo. Other courses in preparation are: psychology, tourism and interpreting. The headquarter is in Malta, a member country of the EU. Consequently, degrees and masters are evaluated according European Qualifications Framework, the quality system of European degrees.

Solidarity scholarship. An interesting topic for companies, but also for private individuals: anyone, investing around  200 dollars and believing in the project of a real and concrete education, can donate a scholarship and dedicate it to the memory of one's own dear person or a cause that he or she deems important. In order to help and give hope for better education to those who dream of studying, the university guarantees the lenders by sending them the contacts and the generalities of the students who will receive of the scholarship.

This initiative has already attracted the attention of some Italian media as demonstrated by the following links:
http://www.repubblica.it/solidarieta/cooperazione/2017/03/15/news/africa-160624669/
http://www.faccecaso.com/2017/03/17/universita-online-africa-studenti/ 
http://www.tag24.it/175437-lafrica-e-online-grazie-alla-pareto-university/
Thanks to this project many young Africans can realize their dream of getting a degree and thus start working in the world with greater security and awareness of their abilities.
Through the teaching method implemented by Pareto University, thanks to internationally trained teachers, many young graduates, with equated and accredited qualifications, will be able to develop their professional skills directly in Africa, thus helping it to grow.

For example, they will be able to start their business, to provide their professional skills to other companies interested in investing in Africa, or simply to look for a high skilled job.

 
Risks & Challenges
The obstacles and the solutions that the project may encounter are listed below:
Problem: Don’t have the political support of African governments.
Solution: Pareto University has already reached agreements with 18 African States, it is a consolidated reality.



Problem: The scholarships of Africans may not be recognized out of the continent.
Solution: Pareto University is headquartered in Malta, a member of the European Union, so the Degrees and the Master are evaluated according to the European Qualifications Framework.

Problem: Contributors may not have confidence in how their money will be used.
Solution: Pareto University guarantees the contributors by sending them the general information and contact details of the scholarship and the student who will benefit from it.

Problem: Exams may not be regular.
Solution: Pareto University controls online exams through a software that recognizes students' identity through a webcam, together with other control systems.

Problem: Some families may deny access to online university education to women.
Solution: Thanks to scholarships, 365 days a year access to Online University and thanks to Pareto Point, they can study, even in secret.

Problem: Young people are working and they can’t attend lessons.
Solution: A free application from Pareto University allows you to follow lessons with your smartphone as well. The University is open 365 days a year, 24 hours a day, and lessons are registered, giving the opportunity to attend the Degree courses also for working students.


 
Other Ways You Can Help
You may also contribute by sharing the campaign on all social media or in the way you feel most appropriate.

Contact CEO:
poggi@paretouniversity.com
Contact Press Office:
ufficiostampa@comciso.com
Thank you all!

story:
Can you live forever with perfect mind and body?

The causes of ageing are slowly being identified by scientists across the world. The underlying biological processes such as DNA damage, telomere shortening, stem cell exhaustion and cellular senescence are being studied and understood. With the exponential growth in technology this knowledge is rapidly turning into therapies to slow, stop and eventually reverse ageing.

NOT INTERESTED? I'd love to hear your thoughts on the idea or the campaign. Please do leave a comment - many thanks.

Radical life extension is about turning back the clock. To having the body and mind you had in your 20s. We’re seeing the last generation of frail centenarians – they will soon be transformed allowing them to enjoy more time with their family and learn and experience more about the world. And that world, in return, will benefit from their decades of knowledge and skill that no longer needs to be lost back to dust.

Don't just take my word for it

Longevity and radical life extension is a growing industry – and more and more people are putting (a lot!) of money where their mouths are:

  • 5 billionaires who want to live forever – Fortune Magazine
  • Understanding Calico: Larry Page, Google Ventures, and the quest for immortality – The Verge
  • Oracle founder Larry Ellison has proclaimed his wish to live forever and donated more than $430 million to anti-aging research. – Washington Post

What is the Live Forever Manual?

I want to live forever so I'm investigating every possible approach to stretching out my lifespan  so that I’m still here when technology makes immortality possible. New technologies that companies such as Google are already investing hundreds of millions of dollars into and serious scientists, such as Ray Kurzweil, are predicting will be a real possibility around 2035.

Unfortunately your chance of dying doubles every 8 years, so it's a critical race against time to make sure you’re on the right side of advances in medical technology. Therefore it’s crucial to take measures today to improve your life expectancy and make preparations to maximise your chances of living forever.

So what sort of things can you be doing? I've been blogging about advances in healthcare and increases in life expectancy for a few years, but now I want to focus on how you really can try to beat death. So I intend to dedicate the next 6 months of my life to finding out. And then I'm going to summarise it all into an easy to read book that you can dip into at any time. It will include 101 practical tips in an easy to read format.

Tip Topics

Here are some of the subjects I'll be researching - and the list will grow as I find out more. Of course, if you've got a particular subject you want investigated why not go for the "choose a topic" perk?

Rejuvenation

  • stem cell therapy
  • senescent cells
  • gene therapy
  • young blood
  • radiation hormesis

Supplements

  • Metformin
  • senolytics
  • vitamins
  • probiotics
  • resveratrol

Quantified Self

  • blood pressure
  • weight
  • activity
  • happiness
  • blood tests

Augmentation

  • exoskeletons
  • artificial organs
  • brain interface

Home

  • air pollution
  • sleep
  • light

Mental Health

  • meditation
  • work stress
  • social life

Lifestyle

  • exercise
  • diet
  • sun exposure

Accidents

  • defibrillator
  • health records
  • car & travel safety

Survival

  • pandemics
  • natural disasters
  • preppers

Dictionary corner: aging or ageing?

Aging is the British spelling however the US spelling is commonly used in science (wth the esteemed University of Oxford having an Institute Of Population Ageing) so even though I’m based in the UK I’ve decided to use ageing.

story:
SolveitNOW at a Glance

SolveitNOW-- a peer-to-peer problem-solving app for Math education.

What problem we are solving? 
—————————————— 
For kids in K6 to K12 when they get stuck on a difficult Maths problem, there is No effective, reliable way to get Insights and get better at solving difficult Maths & Science problems.

What solution we’re building? 
—————————————— 
We are empowering students with an AI-powered Peer-to-Peer Learning Network oƒ Students & Experts. Students use SolveitNOW to participate in the problem-solving discussions with friends and expert solvers to get better at solving difficult problems in Maths & Science♥

There is a SECRET offer for you:: Click to get it NOW @ https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/2537430/x/22...

Who we are?

 

What We Need & What You Get

SolveitNOW is on the arduous journey to solve this problem using technology and we're going to take part in the 3 months rapid accelerator program in USA run my NYU edTech Accelerator. We need your support and urge you to rally with us to make this vision a reality much sooner than expected.

  • We need your support of 30K USD to attend this accelerator program and build this business on a global scale.
  • It can be either crown funded with annual gift subscriptions for equity participation.
  • 15K USD is the accelerator fee and we aim to use another 15K to build and run around to test the app in US markets.

The Impact

SolveitNOW is on the mission to build a peer-learning community with an AI SolveitBUDDY. So that every student can have a personalized, high-quality AI tutor, who tell them what to try next if they get STUCK, to give them HINTS on what to try, how to learn best. To map a personal learning pack for every student across the globe, NO amount of teacher can do this! This is the need of the hour!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This app has been Alpha-tested in India with more than 11K users and we aggressively planning to launch in the United States schools, and soon expand the horizons for "Quality Education for All"  This requires your Insights and meaningful funding to make-it-happen! 

  • We're going slow and tinkering to find the right path to go ahead.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this app in your community. you may invite me to your neighbourhood school so that we can demo SolveitNOW:

 
  • And please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools and be a SolveitBUDDY to us!

And that's all there is to it. Thank You!

story:
Hello. I will tell you about the talent of my daughter Catherine. She is 13 years old. She has been singing since early childhood, but she recently started working with a professional vocal teacher . We have few professional vocal teachers in our city and their services are paid and expensive. Therefore, we can not always pay for classes because of the financial crisis in the family. You promised your help, and that's why I'm here. Charity event #Donate1$+. which I organized in support of my daughter's talent in LinkedIn, did not bring much money, some of which was spent on a teacher.Of course, we are grateful to the people who participated in the campaign , but this is a few people who transferred 1-2$.If you have a desire and a real financial opportunity to help us, we will be very grateful for it. Perhaps in the near future , thanks to your investment, my daughter will become a very bright famous artist and her dream will come true. If you need more detailed information, I am ready to provide it .1 year of classes costs 12000$ with respect Konstantin Kirpun #Donate1$: PayPal : Razbogatejsnami@gmail.com
#DonateToTalent : WebMoney : Z524906493827

story:
Short description

Have you ever dreamt about feature rich, fast webpages and high performance web applications which also can fully work offline? Or have you ever programed a software you would now like to see on other platforms or devices?
Developed simply by writing some text in a text editor, the same way as html?
Creating virtual 3D homepages like virtual supermarkets or your own virtual castle as 'walkable' homepage, where the user can virtually explore your home. Developing apps/games that run out-of-the box on Playstation, Raspberry PI, Smartphones, Tablets and Desktops.
Then this is just the top of this 'iceberg'/project. The possibilities are endless.

This project offers you the possibilities to:

  • build Apps that run out-of-the-box on nearly any operating system


  • build applications that run mostly the same way on all devices.


  • build performance Apps with full hardware accelerated graphics


  • build Apps with incredibly easy distribution(just copy your package to your server)
  • write your apps in not more than xml
  • build AAA 3D or 2D games started by any browser or with a desktop shortcut
  • use physics -> build 2D 3D UIs with physics, like bouncing buttons...,
  • write your embedded system UI and logic in XML and use it on cheap/free OSes
  • use all underlying hardware like sensors, special input or output devices(e.g. VR headsets Vive, Rift, Morpheus or GearVR)...
  • build games that let mobile phone users play against desktop or playstation users.
  • all binaries will be free of charge(as well as all used file formats). 

This is the next generation in developing applications and you can be a part of it!!


What this is not:

It cannot (and should not) replace html. Html(or current web) is great in showing documents and sharing knowledge in a well-structured layout. 
It is not designed to run perfectly on systems which do not support at least Open GL(ES).

 

About the creator

I’m a senior software developer. But programming is not only my profession it’s also my hobby. So you could also call me nerd or crack. :-) 

Anyway I studied economical IT in Deggendorf what I finished in 2004. I already wrote my diploma about 3D graphics programming, which was my passion since I got my first programming lessons. Though I already started writing first programs much earlier in Basic for the C64 home computer and during grammar school I wrote Pascal programs.

After my studies I was hired by PIXEL GmbH to build the first (real) 3D navigation system for a famous german car company. Followed by 3D medical software and another navigation system software. In my 10 years of development I was involved in projects for the following companies: SiemensVDO, BMW, Continental, Siemens MED, IBC Solar, Pixel GmbH, E.Solutions GmbH, Audi, VW, Porsche, ...

In my spare time I wrote the german book Direct3D Realtime Rendering für Computerspiele. As I was not married at that time I wrote the book with my maiden name Theuerjahr(I was born Ulrich Theuerjahr). When I married I took over my wife’s lastname(Beckert). We have 3 kids now. You can see them in the video and image gallery.

The book was sold out fast with mixed reviews: http://www.amazon.de/Direct3D-Realtime-Renderin... 


It included at that time(2007) just upcoming rendering techniques like deferred shading, HDR Lighting, volumetric fog (with the help of volumetric textures introduced with DirectX9), relief mapping or depth-of-field. I’m highly skilled in shader programming in Assembler and HLSL.

As I started at low level hardware at that time, I know what the current mobile systems are capable of, as the hardware is comparable. Making it easy for me to scale the solutions to all kinds of GPUs.


Why you can trust me and my campaign:

There are frequent updates posted on facebook, the project homepage, twitter and my development site. If you contribute in buying the perk 'alpha and beta' or higher.
You will be invited to my development site. Where even more updates and more 'internal' updates will be posted. Like all finalized concepts, my detailed milestone plan. Including completion rate of milestone etc. There will always be visible progress!

 

What you give and what you get


Your contribution runs completely into the development process. Mainly paying the developers daily bread. As I have a wife and 3 kids it’s not so easy.  :-)

The calculation goes like this: 3500 Euros gross per month for me as the main developer. This is really the lower limit for a senior developer in Germany!
I also need some money to pay other people for helping me with design, modeling, sound(for the games). Or to at least buy models and soundpacks or to license music tracks. I need also some extra money for hardware and software licenses. That means I need approx. 50000 Euros per year. 

To be able to deliver this software I plan to need about 2 years of development time. Which is a real optimistic guess.

That’s a total of 100000 Euros net. Now I have to add the german VAT my company has to pay for the indiegogo money. That’s another 19% leading to 119000 Euros. And about 10% Indiegogo and Payment fees, leading to a result of 130900 Euros. (Actually this calculation is wrong because I need to pay taxes and the fees for the total of 131072 Euros. So besides the fees there will only 94371 euros remain.)

As I’m a bit a nerd, I rounded it to the next power of 2. That’s the 131072 Euros



Of course It’s needless to say that more would help me lowering the risks(see risks section below). That’s why I also take part in the Indiegogo InDemand program, if I am able to reach the main goal!

Even if I do not collect the desired amount, I will continue with this project as long as I can, because I think it is essential for anyone in the world, mainly the developers, to have real platform independence. Being independent of Google, Microsoft and Apple. Seeing great applications on any device.


What you get

is the next evolutionary web technology before everyone else. It's a completely new way of developing applications. This is as innovative as C was when it came up after assembler. Reserve yourself a place in history books, by supporting this project(If you like, your name will be mentioned on the projects Wikipedia page). You can regard yourself as a pioneer, making a new technology useable for everyone.
Get independent of all the big companies like Microsoft, Google or Apple who control the current web.
I don’t want to control anything. I like to see innovative software which can be developed fast and easy. And which can be accessed by everyone. I don’t want to have one webpage/application for desktop users and another one(reduced) for smart phone users. The user experience should be the same on all devices.

My package gives developers an easy to use package to make great applications and easily distribute it to everyone by simply putting the package on a webserver. The developer has control whether it also works completely offline or not. For internal use, simply put it on your intranet server. 


Internationalization will be included out-of-the box. E.g. you are not allowed to write text in any xml tags. Text is added via a text tag with an ID. Then there must be a language xml file(it is recommended to name the file after the ISO 639-2 Codes) containing the texts matching this ID. You can then simply add another language by adding the filename to your xml languages array.

  • Depending on the perks you pay you can also be a part of the development process!
  • Discuss features with me in the development blog.
  • Get also any release including alpha and beta versions from the beginning.
  • Get detailed info about the development progress.

Here is a small overview of the different technologies:

 

How it works

I will give you the SDK package containing binaries/executable for all the operating systems and platforms as well as a tool to distribute it. 


You add your(or edit the available)  resources including the main xml’s called universe(2d and 3d) as well as images/textures, 3d models, sound files etc. 

Here is an example of a universe 2d file. This is just a preliminary concept file:

Then start the distribution tool. It compiles your resources (to compressed binary files for performance reasons) and uploads the package to a server of your choice.


In your website you simply add one line/tag with the path to that package. That’s all.

When now a user opens your homepage he will be offered to download/run your native web application. If he clicks OK, the binaries fitting to the users OS will be downloaded(if not done earlier) as well as the application content and the resources the developer has added directly to the start package. More content can then be streamed from somewhere else. This is completely under the developer’s control!

He can for example pack the first level and the main UI components into the start package and during the user playing level one download the resources for level 2. That guarantees low waiting times for the user to start with the application. Everything that is downloaded can then also be run offline.

If you prefer looking at images to understand it, here it is:


An example: How to write a simple 2d navigation app

First, developers write the code like this universe2d xml(right-click and 'save content as'): http://nativeweb.roulio.com/navi.xml
Or here is a screenshot of it(open it in new tab for good quality): 

This is all you need to program!!! for a basic navigation app that shows a 2d map, allows free scrolling when activating the toggle button and which sets a destination on doubleclick and calculates the route. It also displays the time to destination. For details please look at the comments. Just 50 lines of code!!!
The universe2d file is part of the resources, so all you have to do for distribution is:
- start my compiler/uploader tool.
- Enter the ftp path of your server and your credentials.
- click 'compile'. 
- When compilation went fine, click 'upload'.
That is all!!!
When a user now browses to your server folder, no matter with which device or operating system(!), he/she will be offered to download your Native Web App.
He/She will get the binaries fitting to his OS(if not done earlier) and your compiled resources.
He/She then starts it like a normal app. 
This navigation app then runs on Windows PCs(GPS needed), Playstation 4(if there would be GPS?), Smartphones and Tablets out-of-the-box!! Without adapting input or screen resolution!

What is already done/available

 

The Software Architecture is already really far, at least for the graphics part. A first version exists(Windows DirectX 9) where a first cube is shown using already the completely new pipeline. The new model format, the universe approach and the rendertree with vertex and pixel shaders.
As well as a lot of base classes like special containers and 2d and 3d math classes. Including unit tests.

You can run that first application at http://nativeweb.roulio.com/?page_id=16

Here a screenshot;

 



To keep good code quality I try to follow the clean code rules and try to work with interface abstraction as much as possible. I also use lots of design patterns. If you have looked at the xml image above. You may have seen a prototype section. This is named after the prototype pattern. And in code it exactly follows that.

As mentioned this architecture works already the desired way! 

As version control system I use subversion(hosted externally).

I also plan to add a Jenkins server for continuous integration when I'm ready to compile for some platforms. See the milestones below.

For the higher perk contributors, I also made a team site, where you can get the latest project infos. It also contains a project calendar, wiki, issue tracker, discussion board and a newsfeed. 
When I get your mailadress after paying your perk(perk "Alpha and Beta access" and higher), you will be invited to this site. 


 

What needs to be done

Of course there is still a lot to do:

  • Implementation of the Graphics Interfaces with OpenGL and OpenGL ES and later DirectX 11/12(DX9 already done) and Vulkan.
  • Implementation of the OS Interfaces for Linux/Unix Systems including MacOS iOS and Android at first. Followed by SailfishOS, FreeBSD(PS4 OS is based on this one), QNX, WindowsPhone...
  • Implementation of Input and Sound Interfaces. Will be done via SDL library.
  • Implementation of Physics Interfaces. Will be done with bullet.
  • Implementation of UI controls.
  • Implementation of a Text Engine.
  • Implementation of Hardware access. Using libusb and others(StreamInput)
  • Implementation of resource streaming and resource uploader with libcurl.
  • Implementation of Resource Compiler and compressor(lzop).


 

Here is an overview of the currently planned Milestones:

 


Risks & Challenges


As of any project, there are a lot of risks here, too.

First and probably the worst case is, I could die. For that case, I will have a second person who is capable of either continuing development(with the rest of the money) or at least release the sources as open source to the public. So that anyone else could finalize this project.

Second I could get sick or something similar what can delay the project. In this case I cannot fullfill the timeline. A delay also means that in the end I could run out of money. Therefore it would be essential to reach and if possible exceed the main goal.

Another risk is, that the targets I try to support change. E.g. that Google drops OpenGL ES support from Android or Microsoft drops DirectX and switches to the Mantle API. Though the probability for this cases to happen is extremely low.

Then it can happen that I forgot some issues which are hard to solve, or e.g. to get a hard- to-find deadlock when using some library. These things could also lead to greater delays.

Libraries I use could drop support for future platforms. When E.g. SDL would not support android 5. I then need to implement it on my own leading also to an unplanned delay.

Another risk is security. Some people could offer a package where they add malicous code to one of the dlls. To counter this, I plan to add a checksum on each binary package which the launcher checks before execution. And I plan to make the executables hosted centrally on my server. That way it's easier to maintain and upgrade. And Developers don't have to upload or publish the binaries. They only need to set the version they developed on. But this can be added automatically by our compiler.


Challenges


Developing for different input scenarios and screen resolutions is one big challenge.

Developing/Compiling for different operating systems is not that easy,too.
Heavy tasks:
Getting or setting up a toolchain including devices with the different OSes. 
Setting up a build server.

And last but not least making a safe xml reading of user code is really a heavy task.
There needs to be a kind of whitelist for tags. there could be problems with case-sensitivity, with text encoding, internationalization...

There are still a few questions/ideas open.

But I personally love challenges, I think that is what makes life great.

 

Other ways to help


If you are not able to contribute to this project in a monetary way, you can also help in another way, by simply telling your friends and relatives about it!

You can use the Indiegogo tool to easily share this project.
Please have a look at https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/527376-How-to-Share-A-Campaign-With-Others

So help me and all the people out there to climb Web 4.0, the Native Web!


FAQ

Why XML?

Here are the reasons:

  • Html is also XML. And people/developers know this already. 
  • I needed a way to script cross-platform. 
  • Any simple text editor can be used. 
  • Tools(to output XML) can be written easily by everyone.
  •  XML is the de-facto standard description/interchange language.

Differences between the native web technology and a game engine? 

  • Though the engines can deploy to a lot of platforms it is up to the developer what will be supported. With Native Web(NW) it will definitely run on all supported platforms out of the box! Though sometimes some adaption needs to be done by the developer for the best experience.
  • NW has easier distribution. Time from buying to play is really short.
  • NW uses easy out of the box licensing.
  • NW is not only used for games. It can also be used for any other purpose.

 

Finally I'd like to ask you a nerdy riddle.

The first who sponsors this campaign and solves this puzzle gets a cool secret thing when the campaign reaches the main goal!

Hint: You should be a programmer to be able to solve this puzzle.

Here the puzzle:

We are looking for a word. Add the 5 missing numbers in between. But this is not the solution. Find another hidden number and subtract it. Now and unsigned short -3.

What is the result?

Hint. Any sentence counts!

As help I recommend to use the windows calculator in programmer mode.


-16384
story_txt:
Short description
Have you ever dreamt about feature rich, fast webpages and high performance web applications which also can fully work offline? Or have you ever programed a software you would now like to see on other platforms or devices?
Developed simply by writing some text in a text editor, the same way as html?Creating virtual 3D homepages like virtual supermarkets or your own virtual castle as 'walkable' homepage, where the user can virtually explore your home. Developing apps/games that run out-of-the box on Playstation, Raspberry PI, Smartphones, Tablets and Desktops.
Then this is just the top of this 'iceberg'/project. The possibilities are endless.
This project offers you the possibilities to:

build Apps that run out-of-the-box on nearly any operating system


build applications that run mostly the same way on all devices.



build performance Apps with full hardware accelerated graphics


build Apps with incredibly easy distribution(just copy your package to your server)
write your apps in not more than xml
build AAA 3D or 2D games started by any browser or with a desktop shortcut
use physics -> build 2D 3D UIs with physics, like bouncing buttons...,

write your embedded system UI and logic in XML and use it on cheap/free OSes
use all underlying hardware like sensors, special input or output devices(e.g. VR headsets Vive, Rift, Morpheus or GearVR)...
build games that let mobile phone users play against desktop or playstation users.
all binaries will be free of charge(as well as all used file formats). 

This is the next generation in developing applications and you can be a part of it!!

What this is not:
It cannot (and should not) replace html. Html(or current web) is great in showing documents and sharing knowledge in a well-structured layout. 
It is not designed to run perfectly on systems which do not support at least Open GL(ES).
 
About the creator
I’m a senior software developer. But programming is not only my profession it’s also my hobby. So you could also call me nerd or crack. :-) Anyway I studied economical IT in Deggendorf what I finished in 2004. I already wrote my diploma about 3D graphics programming, which was my passion since I got my first programming lessons. Though I already started writing first programs much earlier in Basic for the C64 home computer and during grammar school I wrote Pascal programs.
After my studies I was hired by PIXEL GmbH to build the first (real) 3D navigation system for a famous german car company. Followed by 3D medical software and another navigation system software. In my 10 years of development I was involved in projects for the following companies: SiemensVDO, BMW, Continental, Siemens MED, IBC Solar, Pixel GmbH, E.Solutions GmbH, Audi, VW, Porsche, ...In my spare time I wrote the german book Direct3D Realtime Rendering für Computerspiele. As I was not married at that time I wrote the book with my maiden name Theuerjahr(I was born Ulrich Theuerjahr). When I married I took over my wife’s lastname(Beckert). We have 3 kids now. You can see them in the video and image gallery.
The book was sold out fast with mixed reviews: http://www.amazon.de/Direct3D-Realtime-Renderin... It included at that time(2007) just upcoming rendering techniques like deferred shading, HDR Lighting, volumetric fog (with the help of volumetric textures introduced with DirectX9), relief mapping or depth-of-field. I’m highly skilled in shader programming in Assembler and HLSL.
As I started at low level hardware at that time, I know what the current mobile systems are capable of, as the hardware is comparable. Making it easy for me to scale the solutions to all kinds of GPUs.Why you can trust me and my campaign:There are frequent updates posted on facebook, the project homepage, twitter and my development site. If you contribute in buying the perk 'alpha and beta' or higher.You will be invited to my development site. Where even more updates and more 'internal' updates will be posted. Like all finalized concepts, my detailed milestone plan. Including completion rate of milestone etc. There will always be visible progress!
 
What you give and what you get

Your contribution runs completely into the development process. Mainly paying the developers daily bread. As I have a wife and 3 kids it’s not so easy.  :-)
The calculation goes like this: 3500 Euros gross per month for me as the main developer. This is really the lower limit for a senior developer in Germany! I also need some money to pay other people for helping me with design, modeling, sound(for the games). Or to at least buy models and soundpacks or to license music tracks. I need also some extra money for hardware and software licenses. That means I need approx. 50000 Euros per year. 
To be able to deliver this software I plan to need about 2 years of development time. Which is a real optimistic guess.
That’s a total of 100000 Euros net. Now I have to add the german VAT my company has to pay for the indiegogo money. That’s another 19% leading to 119000 Euros. And about 10% Indiegogo and Payment fees, leading to a result of 130900 Euros. (Actually this calculation is wrong because I need to pay taxes and the fees for the total of 131072 Euros. So besides the fees there will only 94371 euros remain.)
As I’m a bit a nerd, I rounded it to the next power of 2. That’s the 131072 Euros
Of course It’s needless to say that more would help me lowering the risks(see risks section below). That’s why I also take part in the Indiegogo InDemand program, if I am able to reach the main goal!
Even if I do not collect the desired amount, I will continue with this project as long as I can, because I think it is essential for anyone in the world, mainly the developers, to have real platform independence. Being independent of Google, Microsoft and Apple. Seeing great applications on any device.

What you get is the next evolutionary web technology before everyone else. It's a completely new way of developing applications. This is as innovative as C was when it came up after assembler. Reserve yourself a place in history books, by supporting this project(If you like, your name will be mentioned on the projects Wikipedia page). You can regard yourself as a pioneer, making a new technology useable for everyone. Get independent of all the big companies like Microsoft, Google or Apple who control the current web.I don’t want to control anything. I like to see innovative software which can be developed fast and easy. And which can be accessed by everyone. I don’t want to have one webpage/application for desktop users and another one(reduced) for smart phone users. The user experience should be the same on all devices.

My package gives developers an easy to use package to make great applications and easily distribute it to everyone by simply putting the package on a webserver. The developer has control whether it also works completely offline or not. For internal use, simply put it on your intranet server. 
Internationalization will be included out-of-the box. E.g. you are not allowed to write text in any xml tags. Text is added via a text tag with an ID. Then there must be a language xml file(it is recommended to name the file after the ISO 639-2 Codes) containing the texts matching this ID. You can then simply add another language by adding the filename to your xml languages array.

Depending on the perks you pay you can also be a part of the development process!
Discuss features with me in the development blog.
Get also any release including alpha and beta versions from the beginning.
Get detailed info about the development progress.

story:
Thank you for your interest in developing world computing.


My name is Prasanna Kumar Pete and I live in Hubli, India. This campaign seeks to benefit the Sevabharathi Primary School students, Especially girl child.

This school is typical of many rural schools in India.The students here are far behind their urban peers in skills which will help them to cope up with the further education to live in this highly competitive world.

Most of the students have to walk more than 3 miles in order to complete their education. With all these difficulties(Time, Money, and they have to walk back to the home before sunset) students especially a Girl child cannot afford to join institute to learn skills required for them to make a living in this world. 

To Make their life better we are intending to set-up a computer LAB facility within the school so that the children can gain the skills required in the liesure time of the school(Everyday) and get prepared to leave the fine footprints on this world, They have this right.

Student Details

Total Number of Students : 380
Boys : 206
Girls : 176
156 Students from 40+ different villeges (Most of them have to reach school by walking)

Why a computer lab?

Establishing a computer lab will help to address the inequality of students are faced with on global and national levels. With the computer students can learn, typing tutorial and word processing programs, and can even expose children to programming – an increasingly valuable skill in our increasingly digital world. The lab will also be used to provide the students with offline versions of Wikipedia for research, eBooks on various topics, etc...


How will funding be used?

In order to establish a computer lab equipped with 10 computers and spare parts the lab will need $7,000. 

What is the value of this campaign?

This project is valuable because it will help to bridge the global digital divide in a very sustainable way. For less than the cost of a couple MacBooks an entire school of 380 underprivileged students can be provided with a functioning computer lab. The lab will have access to an ecosystem of free and open source software thanks to Linux based computing and I will personally train my replacement to set up, utilize, and maintain the computer lab.

100% of funding, whether above or below the fundraising goal, will go towards this campaign. Receipts and invoices will be provided under the updates tab.


if the entire goal is not met the computer lab will have to reduce its total number of computers. If the goal is exceeded additional computers will be purchased.

What's in it for me?

Perks for supporters vary according to contribution. In order to use funds for only the essentials and to provide a learning opportunity for the students and trainee computer teachers, all perks will be digital and digitally delivered.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways to help than just supporting this campaign financially. Spread the word to your friends, colleagues, communities, and families to help ensure this campaign is a success. Social media and Indiegogo share tools are both valuable tools to help get the word out!

Thank you again for your support, on behalf of the students and faculty of Sevabharathi Primary School: India Thirthahalli (We thank you, we thank you very much).

Got a question, suggestion, or concern? Please email me 

prasanna.pete@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

 

MASK
 MOTHERS AGAINST SHOOTING AND KILLINGS
WHO ARE WE? 
MOTHER'S WHO ARE FED UP WITH THE SHOOTING IN OUR COMMUNITIES AND IN THE WORLD BY OUR OWN PEOPLE AND BY POLICE.
HOW CAN WE SOLVE THIS PROBLEM?
EDUCATION AND RE-INTRODUCING THE LAWS AND COMMANDMENTS OF GOD….

THOU SHALL NOT KILL…. APPLIES TO ALL RACES; ESPECIALLY BLACK AND WHITE; 
BUT TYPICALLY WE ARE JUST GOING TO DEAL WITH THESE TWO IN THE USA.

WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO FIRST;

WE ARE GOING DOOR TO DOOR;PASSING OUR FLIERS AND TALKING TO THE PEOPLE IN THE COMMUNITIES;WE WILL POST NEON SIGN'S THAT GLOW IN THE DARK AS REMINDERS; THAT LIFE IS PRECIOUS; AND YOU WILL DIE BY THE SWORD IF YOU USE A SWORD AGAINST YOUR FELLOW BROTHER OR SISTER.

WE NEED A BUILDING IN OUR COMMUNITY

WE NEED A BUILDING; WHERE THE PEOPLE CAN COME TO WEEKLY AND LEARN ABOUT WAYS TO;

HANDLE STRESS, STRIFE,  AND PROBLEMS WITH  DEPRESSION IN THEIR LIVES…WE WILL HAVE HANDS ON TEACHERS TO TEACH THE MEN AS WELL AS THE WOMEN; WE WILL GO TO THE STREETS AND COMPEL INDIVIDUALS TO COME TO OUR CLASSES. WE WILL TEACH YOU HOW TO TEACH YOUR CHILDREN.

24 HOUR HOTLINE...SOME OF YOU DON'T SLEEP YOU STAY UP AT NIGHT TO DO EVIL

WE WILL HAVE A 24 HOUR HOT LINE...WHERE INDIVIDUALS CAN TALK TO A MOTHER OR  FATHER, A GRANDMOTHER OR GRANDFATHER IF THEY FEEL THEY CAN'T HANDLE A SITUATION ON THEIR OWN.

SOMETIMES A CALM VOICE CAN TAME A WILD BEAST...AND CHANGE THE MINDSET OF SOMEONE WHO IS ANGRY AND OUT OF CONTROL.

BAD HABITS

WE REALIZE A LOT OF OUR PEOPLE ARE HOOK ON DRUGS/ALCOHOL/AND CIGARETTES.

WE WILL INTRODUCE WAYS TO QUIT AND OFFER UP SPECIAL DIETS/HERBAL PRODUCTS THAT WORK TO CURB THEIR DESIRE/AND EXERCISE….

 IDLE WE HAVE WORK FOR YOU

WE ARE GOING TO PUT IDLE PEOPLE TO WORK; ON CLEANING UP OUR NEIGHBORHOODS FROM TRASH AND DEBRIS; GARBAGE CANS WILL BE PLACED ON CURB SIDES TO LESSON TRASH BEING DROPPED OR THROWN ON THE STREETS...WITH OUR EMBLEM MASK ON THE SIDES OF THEM AS REMINDERS.

TRAINING FOR  YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN

WE ALSO WILL OFFER UP TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR THE YOUNG MEN AS WELL AS THE WOMEN;

FOR MEN WE WILL OFFER MANDATORY HANDS ON CARPENTRY AND PLUMBING AND ELECTRICAL SKILLS...TAUGHT BY SKILLED MEN….WE NEED TO PAY THE TEACHERS FOR TEACHING AS MOST ARE NOT VOLUNTEERS.

ALSO AS AN INCENTIVE WE WILL PAY OUR STUDENTS AND PROVIDE HEALTHY MEALS  IN OUR CLASS SETTING....THIS WILL HELP ENCOURAGE THEM TO ATTEND.

ACCEPTING AGES 15-45 YEARS OF AGE..CLASSES ARE 4-6 HOURS LONG 20 STUDENTS PER CLASS WITH 2 TEACHERS PER CLASS; STARTING AT 3 DAYS PER WEEK.

FOR WOMEN; WE WILL BE TEACHING HOW TO CARE FOR YOUR HUSBAND'S AND CHILDREN

AND SKILLS OF SEWING;

 

 

COOKING

 

ARTS AND CRAFTS;

AND JEWELRY MAKING; ONCE A WEEK FOR FREE….

WE ALSO WILL PROVIDE HEALTHY MEALS IN OUR CLASS ROOM SETTING ALONG WITH  MOTHERS TO MONITOR THE CHILDREN WHILE YOU LEARN.

LEARNING HOW TO DRESS.

WE FEEL THERE IS A NEED TO TEACH OUR WOMEN HOW TO RE-DRESS YOURSELVES AS MODEST WOMEN;

UNDERSTANDING THAT YOU ARE DIAMONDS

SO PRECIOUS; AND THAT DRESSING MODEST MATTERS.

 

WE PREFER FOR YOU NOT TO DRESS AS WHORES

AND NOT TO FOLLOW WOMEN WHO DO; NO MATTER HOW POPULAR THEY SEEM TO BE; THEY ARE WHORES

AND YOU ARE A PRINCESS, AND NOT A WHORE; SO DON'T ACT LIKE ONE.

MARRIAGES FOR THE SINGLE WOMEN WITH CHILDREN

WE WILL ALSO ENCOURAGE MARRIAGES-AS WE WILL HAVE MATCH MAKING MOMMAS TO HELP YOU IN CHOOSING THE RIGHT MATE FOR YOURSELVES, SO AS YOUR CHILDREN WILL

HAVE FATHERS IN THE HOME AND YOU NOT HAVING TO RAISE THE CHILDREN ON YOUR OWN.

COMMUNICATION

WE WILL TEACH YOU HOW TO COMMUNICATE WITH EACH OTHER AND NOT ABUSE ONE

ANOTHER; MEN WILL BE TAUGHT WAYS ON HOW TO DEAL WITH FRUSTRATION AND NOT TAKE YOUR ANGER OUT ON THE WOMEN….THIS IS A SERIOUS NO-NO.

BLACK LIVES MATTER

WE KNOW THAT ALL LIVES MATTER; BUT IN THIS CURRENT DAY AND AGE OUR BLACK LIVES ARE BEING DESTROYED; NOT JUST BY POLICE BUT BY THE WOMEN AS WELL.

THIS IS WHY IT IS NECESSARY FOR THE WOMEN TO UNDERSTAND THAT YOU ARE NOTORIOUS FOR BEING THE GREATEST MURDERERS IN HISTORY; YOU ARE ABORTING 1 MILLION BABIES PER YEAR.

THIS IS WHY IT IS NECESSARY FOR YOU TO STOP WHORING; KEEP YOUR LEGS CLOSED; UNTIL YOU HAVE GOTTEN SOME REAL KNOWLEDGE; WE WILL HELP YOU TO GET MARRIED STAY MARRIED AND HAVE YOUR CHILDREN; THIS IS MURDER IN THE EYES OF GOD AND YES HE WILL PUNISH YOU FOR BEING PROMISCUOUS; THEREFORE IT IS BETTER TO MARRY THAN TO BURN IN YOUR LUST;

THEN GET PREGNANT AND ABORT YOUR BABY; THIS IS WRONG SISTER; AND THIS IS MURDER IN GOD'S EYES.

WE HAVE MANY OTHER TOPICS TO COVER; BUT THESE WILL HELP CHANGE OUR COMMUNITIES FOR THE BETTER. GOD HELP US.

What We Need & What YouR $ CAN HELP ACHIEVE 

WE NEED A BUILDING TO TEACH; WE NEED MATERIALS; TOOLS; PAINT WASTE CANS; SHOVELS; RAKES AND PEOPLE TO HELP MAKE A DIFFERENCE.

The Impact

YOU WILL BE HELPING TO CHANGE A LIFE FOR THE BETTERMENT OF ALL

Risks & Challenges

FEAR IS NOT IN OUR VOCAB....IT IS FALSE EVIDENCE APPEARING REAL.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH FAMILY FRIENDS AND LOVE ONES; WE ALL CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE TOGETHER; ONE LIFE AT A TIME; EACH ONE REACH ONE AND TEACH ONE; WHOM BETTER TO TEACH US; THAN US.

And that's all there is to it.

MASK MOTHERS AGAINST SHOOTING AND KILLINGSWHO ARE WE? MOTHER'S WHO ARE FED UP WITH THE SHOOTING IN OUR COMMUNITIES AND IN THE WORLD BY OUR OWN PEOPLE AND BY POLICE.HOW CAN WE SOLVE THIS PROBLEM?EDUCATION AND RE-INTRODUCING THE LAWS AND COMMANDMENTS OF GOD….

THOU SHALL NOT KILL…. APPLIES TO ALL RACES; ESPECIALLY BLACK AND WHITE; BUT TYPICALLY WE ARE JUST GOING TO DEAL WITH THESE TWO IN THE USA.

WE ARE GOING DOOR TO DOOR;PASSING OUR FLIERS AND TALKING TO THE PEOPLE IN THE COMMUNITIES;WE WILL POST NEON SIGN'S THAT GLOW IN THE DARK AS REMINDERS; THAT LIFE IS PRECIOUS; AND YOU WILL DIE BY THE SWORD IF YOU USE A SWORD AGAINST YOUR FELLOW BROTHER OR SISTER.

story:
Hi, my name is Dee Hean.
I am the Editor of Game On Magazine.

Who is Game On Magazine and why do we care?

Game On Magazine  (www.gameonmagazine.co.za) was created to support and nurture our love of Sport in South Africa, starting in our early school years and culminating in professional sport.  We don't just talk about the people who are currently stars, we aim to share inspiring stories of how the "stars" got to be stars, and to start to tell the stories of the emerging stars of tomorrow and inspire the as yet to be stars to believe and become all they choose to be in the sport they are most passionate about.

Our magazine is constantly hearing how extremely talented and passionate young sports stars cannot participate in national and international competitions, or afford basic kit and uniforms for the National Teams, and whose big dreams are not realised because sports that are not considered a high priority, just do not receive the government or public funding they so desperately need to allow top athletes/sports girls/boys/men/women to represent their regions or country at high profile events.   This is just wrong....... dream killing is wrong!

Many of these youngsters come from very low income families, and without sponsors, cannot participate at all. 

Game On is choosing to make a difference.........  We want to change the face of sport funding in South Africa and we need your help to do it. 

We want to create an independent sports wealth fund that is not controlled by parastatals or organisations (that have their own agenda as to how to manage these funds).  To do this (and show everyone IT CAN BE DONE), we are opening the floor to EVERYONE WHO LOVES SPORT to ask you to contribute whatever you can and feel inspired to, so that we can begin to make a difference in these amazing young people's lives.

If a million people just contribute $1, we can move mountains for so many talented young people. 

               So, do you have $1/R12 to spare?

Who will you be helping?

An example, Tasneem Cozyn, currently the U/18 Karate World Champion (and one of 5 children) does not have the funding to represent her country in 2 International competitions and attend 4 National competitions (she needs R 110 000 -R120 000 a year = $10 000). She is one of many we constantly hear about in our interviews that we profile.  She is featured in our July issue: http://issuu.com/game-on-mag/docs/gom_july_15__issue_18

Another example is our SA U/18 Baseball Team has qualified to play in the IBAF 2015 World Cup but they have been told there is no funding for them to go and they have to self fund it or they cannot attend.  This is TRAGIC!  (Featured in Game On Magazine : http://issuu.com/game-on-mag/docs/gom_april__15_issue_15)

Amazing Grace Legote, Africa's top rhythmic gymnast has no sponsor to help her compete internationally and get the competitive experience she needs to qualify to go to the 2015 Olympics.  (Featured in Game On Magazine : http://issuu.com/game-on-mag/docs/gom_february__15_issue)

These are just 3 examples, there are so many more........

The funds we raise will support these people/teams to realise their sporting dreams of participating competitively and having the funding to do so.

If for any reason we don't reach our target, any funding received will still be used to support the people that we have become aware of, and we will publish our funding support on our website for public viewing.

The Impact

If we achieve the full amount, Game On will indeed be able to change the face of sports funding in South Africa for a huge number of young people!  It will make possible what is currently believed to be impossible.

Risks & Challenges

We are perfectly positioned in the sporting world to connect with the youth through our magazine and free Magazine App to share the stories, and the successes achieved through this campaign.  We are fortunate to not be affiliated to any sporting structures that can railroad the funding or instruct us as to how to distribute the funds.  It is these very structures and organisations that have created the funding issues currently being faced by deserving youngsters and we will not be dictated to by any of them.

Our challenge is to ensure that the funds are well-managed, and that we have  qualifying criteria in place to ensure that the funds are used for the purpose they are intended.  All beneficiaries (if they are minors their parents will be carefully vetted) will complete a financial means assessment and application process that will be reviewed by a carefully selected panel of independant entrepreneurs (with no vested interest in the magazine or any sporting structure in South Africa).  Once approved, funding will be internally managed and payments made to vendors on behalf of the person.  No funds will be released directly to that person to self-manage. 

For us to reach our goal, we ask you to share this with everyone and anyone who loves sport and would be willing to make a difference.  The tools to share are right here in Indiegogo.

story:
Have you ever started reading a long book or article about something you need or want to learn about? How man of these books did you ever finish?

Snackable Books has the solution. We provide easy learning by explaining complex business topics through "snackable books" that can be read in just a few minutes. No more boring hours of reading through paragraph after paragraph. Our books help understand any sort of topics you want to learn about with minimal text and comic illustrations related to the content. 

Please help us fund our idea so we can start producing these amazing books and e-books!
