English readers, please scroll down.Vous rencontrez des difficultés pour valider votre panier ? On vous guide pas à pas, ici!vous pouvez également nous écrire directement au 237@intellectcameroun.com;opepamjacques@yahoo.fr;  Tel :  +237 694737624Présentation du projetIntellect est une école virtuelle qui interconnecte les élèves et étudiants de divers établissements, dans le but de mutualiser les connaissances et apporter des solutions aux problèmes des uns et des autres afin de réduire l’échec scolaire.C’est un projet ambitieux et passionnant dans la mesure où il permettra à chaque collégien, étudiant, où qu’il soit, de bénéficier d’une assistance académique de qualité, d'une veille académique (les élèves s’informent de ce qui est fait ailleurs), ce qui réduira les inégalités entre ceux qui peuvent payer de bonnes études et ceux qui ne le peuvent pas.Plus concrètementIntellect est un ensemble de salles virtuelles où les élèves et étudiants sont regroupés par spécialités, niveaux et par régions. Un élève qui fait par exemple une Terminale  Scientifique, s’interconnecte avec tous ceux qui font la même classe. De manière journalière, les problèmes sont posés et résolus sous plusieurs formats (images, PDF, Vidéos, Audio et autres).Objectifs du projetLe projet vise tout d’abord à apporter une assistance académique à distance aux élèves des zones rurales et enclavées d’Afrique. Ensuite, à interconnecter les élèves des zones enclavées avec les établissements des grands centres urbains. Enfin, interconnecter tous ces établissements  à l’international. Il est question ici, dans un monde de plus en plus compétitif, de permettre une égalité de chance pour tous, une éducation équitable. Le coaching des élèves est important pour les préparer à un Monde en pleine mutation et compétitif.L’impactLe projet viendra réduire l’échec scolaire, rehausser le niveau scolaire des élèves et étudiants et permettre à une majorité de ces derniers de divers horizons d’être compétitifs.Selon le dernier classement 2017 des 500 meilleures Universités du Monde par l’Université jiotong de Shanghaï, l’Afrique n’a que trois universités représentées dans ce classement. Nous sommes  également  en arrière dans l'enseignement  secondaire  avec quelques exceptions. L’éducation, le savoir est l’arme de développement de toute nation. Nous pensons qu’il faut assurer une meilleure éducation à notre jeunesse afin d’éclore une multitude de talents et non la minorité comme c'est le cas en ce moment .De dizaines de millions de jeunes élèves et étudiants à travers le continent font face à de multiples problèmes d’encadrement académique, de coaching et d’orientation. Plusieurs jeunes Talentueux, du fait du manque d'encadrement, d’orientation et de moyens financiers, sombrent dans la débauche d'où l’arrêt brusque d’études de certains et la non insertion dans la société. Présentation du porteur de projetJe suis  jacques OPEPAM, entrepreneur et élève ingénieur en Génie Industriel, MASTER 2 (Université de Douala-Cameroun).J’ai effectué mon cycle primaire et secondaire dans l’arrondissement de SA'A,  à 70 km de Yaoundé, où j’ai parallèlement développé des activités en agriculture et vannerie alors que j’étais en classe de 5ième. story:
Support Grassroots Communities to be the Leading Light

The Global Leading Light Center

The Global Leading Light Initiative seeks to raise funds to begin the process of building its first Leading Light Center in Sibangweni, Nyandeni local district. The Leading Light Center will be an IT-based youth empowerment center which aims to provide youth and parents in Sibangweni with the beneficial social networks and information needed to access better quality education, the labor market and responsive parenting. Our ultimate goal is to transform disadvantaged youths and parents into “Leading Lights” with the ability to provide solutions to the critical problems faced by their communities. 

The Global Leading Light Center seeks to empower youths in Sibangweni and neighboring communities with basic computer skills and connectivity to beneficial networks to enhance academic excellence, youth leadership development, employability and connection to job opportunities, as well as information on parenting. 

Itemized Budget

$3350 Total needed to catalyze the start of the Global Leading Lights Center

$2500 (20 Laptops -$125/each) https://www.remachines.com/ Madison, WI

$200 (20 adapters - $10) Amazon

$500 (Wifi/12 months for Center) Vodacom Mthatha South Africa

$150 (Projector and Screen) Amazon

On Our Nonprofit Collaboration

To learn more about the Global Leading Light Initiatives please visit globalleadinglight.org and our partner organization Kindred World  at http://kindredmedia.org/

Watch a video interview between Teresa Graham Brett, vice president of Kindred World and founder of the Parent Liberation Alliance,  and Dieudonne Allo, founder of Global Leading Light Initiatives here: http://kindredmedia.org/2017/10/transgeneration... 

Watch a video from Dave Metler's (Kindred World's Board Member) trip to South Africa to visit the communities we work with, here: http://kindredmedia.org/2016/05/conscious-paren...

story:
"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world"

By Nelson Mandela

"Every Child has Right for Education"

Frank Swai and Rev. Joshua laiser are the founders of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting Pambazuka Naisinyai School came to the mind of Frank and Joshua after seeing the challenges facing Maasai communities in Tanzania. Rev. Joshua is a Maasai by tribe and he was born and raised in the Maasai communities so he knows much about the challenges facing his communities.He says "Education has been severe challenge in the Maasai communities as most of families don't know the importance of education for future life of their children. So we are working hard to educate parents and community in general so that they can know the importance of education. So the Pambazuka Naisinyai School is for Maasai children and nearby communities. Please join us and donate something to support this project!!

Our School Started under the tree

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

Students and their teacher having class session under the tree

 

Early Marriage and circumcision for the young Maasai girls.

Imagine a world where every child is educated and can contribute to the development process!!

So many times parents in Maasai  areas tend to give away their young girls for marriage in exchange for just a kilogram of sugar, a goat, a cow , some tea leaves and sometimes for salt. These young girls are then subjected to domestic violence, torture, early child birth and many times girls have died while giving birth because their bodies are never ready to experience child birth.

Many times the parents to these girls need to be empowered with information about the benefits of keeping their children in school until they complete their education. Once these girls have acquired the education, they can provide all the above mentioned items to their parents for the rest of their lives. All that parents need to to practice some bit of patience and sacrifice a little in order to enjoy the fruits of their children.

Circumcision for the women is prohibited but Maasai societies they still circumcise their young girls. We are working hard to educate them so that they can stop this.

Its time to reach out to the parents in the Maasai land settings and sensitize them if we want a better future for girls. A future where they can participate in leadership positions. A future where they can make informed choices and start up families the the men of their choice.

The time is now. Lets teach the Parents because they need this knowledge.

Maasai girls

Young Boys:  Young boys normally are send to keep cows and goats far away from home and come back evening everyday. Others they like to go to school but not allowed to go!!

Young Maasai Kids in the bush keeping cows

Education: Most of Maasai children don't go to school due to the environment they are living. Their parent don't understand the importance of their children to get better education. So we are trying our level best to educate these Maasai societies so that they can allow their children to go to school. Also there are scarcity of nearest school in their areas so we are working hard to build school near them to attract and convince their parent to allow them to attend school.

Our effort made us to start building Pambazuka Naisinyai School http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz  for which this school started under the tree but with our own effort we have managed to build some two classes and bought some desks so we need to work hard to make it happen!!

 Maasai children in front of their houses

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT

We decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL         http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz   . Already our school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils , grade two with 55 and grade three with 35  pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Student doing class work on the ground

 

 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

Our future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.

Under Construction please help a bit

What We Need 

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground; Seven more classes, more desks, computer room, Library, computers, Office for the staff, Kitchen, Good toilet, Reading books, tank for water storage and bin maize and beans storage, lunch for the teachers and students, salaries for teachers, Scholarship and to build fence around the school. The estimation costs is $150,000.  "Every bit will help"

 

Desks: We have managed to buy some desks for one class so class one will not sit on the ground again. Please support us so that we can buy more desks and build more classes!!

THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.

Men at work bringing  clean water at Pambazuka School, Please help

 

 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

What you get once you support us (The Perks!!)

T- Shirt (Will send your size and different color with different images)

 

Maasai Children Photo!!

Big 5 Photo!! ( We will send you one photo of Big 5)

Maasai Shuka ( There are of different types for men and women) will send one pair.

Hat with Kilimanjaro word or any other photo of wildlife in Tanzania

School website: www.pambazuka.sc.tz

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Pambazuka-Naisinyai-Sc...

Twitter:   https://twitter.com/PambazukaSchool

story:
We recently entered into a partnership with Formula One in Schools which involves our participation in the Formula One in Schools STEM Challenge. Our school is also the location of the head office for the Formula One in Schools (Thailand) coordinator and his team.

Formula One in Schools and the STEM Challenge are the Education arm of Formula One Motorsport. This provides students with hands-on experience and practical exposure to working within various industries and exposure to skills needed for the future world of work.

This is a global competition which involves around 20 million students worldwide at the school, regional, national and World Final levels. The World Finals, in which the best teams from around the world compete, take place each year in the week leading up to a Formula One Grand Prix. 

The international initiative is aimed at engaging and challenging school students, aged 13-19, as well as introducing them to the possibilities of careers in Science, Technology, Engineering, Marketing and Project Management. Teams of 3-6 members are commissioned to design, manufacture and race the fastest Formula One Car of the future. The final car design is propelled down a 20-metre track powered by compressed air cylinders. The average car will complete the race in just over one second, reaching speeds of 80 km/h.

Currently, we are in the final stages of designing our mini Formula One car. We require funds to purchase a new 3D printer to ensure our car is lightweight and fast.

 

Visit us at www.6g-racing.com

story:
I worked on this project as part of my aspiration to impart English and make it easily accessible to learn for people in my community, country and around the world.
Helping me in this noble cause, you are placing a contribution towards education, which is the best weapon to change our lives. With your contribution to this project, my books will be able to reach and help more people that need to improve their fate, enhance their potential and change their future for the better. If they are students, they will be able to study better, if they are professionals, they’ll get on the road to better work opportunities and a better life for themselves, their families and their generations to follow.

Your generous contribution means this project will help bridge the communication gap between nations around the world. Today, the world is a global village, and with your contribution to this book, you will have a great impact on adding more and more people to this ‘one-world community’.
The contribution you make will go towards funding one book for publishing as ‘English Communication for Everyday Life’ on Amazon. And the remaining funds will go towards the publication of two more books entitled ‘Foundation of Spoken English’ and ‘Basic English Communication’ to be released in Ethiopia.

In all, we will be publishing three books on learning the English language with your co-operation.

Since, I’m an English instructor for almost two decades and this is my life’s work, I’m really hopeful that all these three books will earn the recognition that they deserve, especially in the developing countries. This project is focused on conveying my lifelong experience and knowledge of the language to make it easily accessible for people living anywhere in the world. Access to English language means access to the world. Help me make it happen. Let’s join hands in spreading this work and helping people raise their standard of living around the world.

story:
Short Summary

DID YOU KNOW??

37% of children arrive at kindergarten without the skills necessary for lifetime learning. (Landry, S. H. (2005). Effective Early Childhood Programs: Turning Knowledge Into Action. Houston, TX: University of Texas, Health Science Center at Houston).

AND

1 in 4 children in America grow up without learning how to read. (WriteExpress Corporation. "Literacy Statistics." Begin to Read. Accessed April 16, 2014).

WOW!! I was shocked when I read these statistics!! As a journalist, I see the consequences of people who are unable to read and write proficiently everyday. As a mother, I am concerned about my children and my children's children and want them to have every possible opportunity to be successful in their lifetimes... and that means they need great reading and writing skills.

A lady who teaches the fourth grade at a Kansas school told me a few months ago that the schools have quit teaching English skills. This shocked me and at the same time, saddens me. Without basic English skills, our children are going struggle to complete tasks that require those basic skills.

  Hi!! My name is Candy Johansen. I’ve been in graduate school at Kansas State University for the last 4 semesters.  Before I started graduate school, as a undergraduate student at The University of Kansas, I wrote a series of 5 children’s books with Miss Molly (my pug) as the star of the books.

The reason I started writing the books came from Molly herself. Molly loves children and loves to interact with them. One day while watching her interact with a group of kids, I decided I wanted to write children’s learning books and let her be the star (in other words, let the children connect with her through the books).

Shortly after starting graduate school, I was talking with one of my professors about a thesis subject. I told him about the children’s books I had written and he was extremely interested. He prompted me to tell him more and I told him I was interested in creating more of these books. I told him I would like to travel to all 50 states and write a children’s travel book about each state. He encouraged me to use this idea for my graduate project… and then pursue it. That’s how the project came to be.

My goal is to make these books educational, but fun at the same time. I don’t want them to replicate an encyclopedia type book- I want kids to be engaged and interested- and want to read them. I plan to include some history of each state, famous people who were born, lived in or currently live in the state, landmarks, interesting places in that state, state foods, and fun things to do and see. The books will have space for children to include their own memorabilia when they visit the states themselves. The U.S. Department of Education found that generally the more students read for fun on their own time, the higher their reading scores.

I have a degree in photography, so I plan to take all the photos that we will put in the books. Nothing would make us happier than to have a child laugh as they learn and then be inspired to want to visit each state. Imagine the stories they will tell!!

Our aim is to promote literacy and instill a sense of adventure in our youth. I want to do my part in helping children develop good reading and writing skills.

If solid reading skills aren't formed during a child's early years, the odds of dropping out down the road increase significantly. Kids who aren't successfully reading at grade level by the third grade are four times less likely to finish high school.

We are using Molly as our mascot to keep things fun for the kids… and we know that kids relate well to dogs. As an added treat, we hope to meet other pug and dog enthusiasts during our travels. I have met so many wonderful pug and other dog owners through social media and we would love to be able to stop and say “hi” while traveling through your state.  We look forward to making many new friends in new places. And… if you want, you can even be a part of our adventure!

We DO need your help!  It’s going to take a lot of money to do this 50 states project… and to print all the books. As any author knows, writing a book is challenging and time consuming. There are 50 books in this series- one book for each state. Since I'll be writing and illustrating 50 books, I made the timeline for this project 3 years. Most of that time will be spent creating these children's books. Please help promote literacy by helping me create this series of books about each state that children can learn from and interact with.  There are rewards offered for making a donation to the campaign. I tried really hard to make the rewards appealing and to fit this project.

 

What We Need 

Our funding goal is $75,000.  This includes:

1) Travel accommodations/food. (I plan to keep this expense as low as possible by staying with friends and family as we travel through different states.

2) Road Trip (automotive expenses/ fuel). Molly and I plan to drive my car as we travel through all 50 states, except for Hawaii. We want to travel by car so we can stop, meet and talk to people on our journey.

3) Photography related equipment (filters, SD cards, etc.) I have professional equipment; however, there might be locations that require special gear. 

4) Publishing and rewards costs (includes publishing expenses, ISBN numbers (for 50 books), printing costs, and money to buy the rewards).

5) Misc. expenses (includes things that are unexpected, like vehicle breakdowns, unanticipated travel expenses, etc...)

$75,000 sounds like a lot of money (even to me), but when we break it down, it is definitely doable. We need only 15,000 people to donate $5.00 each or 7,500 people to donate $10.00 each to reach our goal. That doesn't sound near so bad, huh?

Unique Perks (What you get)

I tried hard to make the rewards fun. Here are some of our unique reward perks:

For $100 donation, you can sign Molly's state bandana. I made Molly a yellow bandana with all the states on it to wear on our trip. The photo of her wearing the bandana will be on the front or back cover of the books WITH YOUR SIGNATURE if you choose this reward.

$500 reward- For a $500 donation, you will get a MEET & GREET with Miss Molly. We will meet you in your state and take your photo with Molly. Molly loves people and she will love to meet you... IF you choose this reward.

$750 reward- For a $750 donation, you will get to SPEND THE DAY WITH MOLLY & I as we travel through your state. You can personally show us places we need to photograph for our books IF you choose this reward.

$5000 reward- For a $5000 donation, you will get THE WHOLE SET OF 50 BOOKS. WOW!! This reward would be great for a school, a daycare, etc...

These are just a few of the unique rewards. 

The Impact

With this project, our aim is to promote literacy, instill a sense of adventure in the kids that read these books and most of all, to entice them to read... and have fun reading about our great country and the places they could travel to.

 

 

Sample Book Cover and Pages 

These are not actual book pages and the book cover, but just samples of what the book pages and cover will look like. The books will be soft cover with perfect binding. Each book will have the title of the state on the cover.

Sample Book Cover:

Sample book page:

Sample book page:

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a huge project- a three-year project. There are a lot of things that can go wrong and we know this, but there are also a lot of things that can go right... and we expect this. We have talked to family and friends who live in different states across the U.S. and are prepared to reach out to them if we have troubles. We plan to divide these 50 states into several trips and will take one trip at a time, planned out so we know exactly where we are going. 

For the books, I have previously published children's books and know how to create book pages, templates, etc... for the books. My degree is in photography so I don't expect to have any trouble with the photos that I will take for the books. I don't anticipate too many problems in creating the books. I plan to create the book for a particular state after visiting that state. If you donate and request a certain state book, after I visit that state and create the book, I will send you the reward (the book). You won't have to wait 3 years for the books, unless you are getting the whole set.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are several ways you can help us. First, of course, is to choose a reward and donate. A second way you can help is by sharing this project on your social media sites with your friends and family and then asking them to share it too. A lot of hands makes light work... and a lot of people will help make this project come to life.

Updates

I plan to keep backers who have donated to this project updated weekly on our travel blog. I will also send a personal e-mail once a month to let you know where we have been, what books we have written or are currently working on, what our future travel plans are and when you can expect the rewards. If anything changes in our initial plan, I will update you about the change. I will post photos of our travels through different states so you can follow us on this journey.

Stretch Rewards

IF we make our funding goal of $75,000, our campaign will stay live on Indemand and we will offer stretch rewards for people who donate after our goal is met. The stretch rewards will be your choice of 1 state book and a donation from Candy and Molly to abandoned and mistreated pug organizations.

Our Team

Our team consists mostly of Molly and I. I do have other team members that help behind the scenes, but Molly and I will be the ones traveling and writing these books. We started this book writing adventure several years ago but this will be our biggest project yet. Molly just turned 7 years old and is in excellent health. She loves to travel and meet people and she is a pro when it comes to posing for photos. Here's a photo of me and Miss Molly this last December. We hope to see you on our journey!!

  Hi!! My name is Candy Johansen. I’ve been in graduate school at Kansas State University for the last 4 semesters.  Before I started graduate school, as a undergraduate student at The University of Kansas, I wrote a series of 5 children’s books with Miss Molly (my pug) as the star of the books.
The reason I started writing the books came from Molly herself. Molly loves children and loves to interact with them. One day while watching her interact with a group of kids, I decided I wanted to write children’s learning books and let her be the star (in other words, let the children connect with her through the books).
Shortly after starting graduate school, I was talking with one of my professors about a thesis subject. I told him about the children’s books I had written and he was extremely interested. He prompted me to tell him more and I told him I was interested in creating more of these books. I told him I would like to travel to all 50 states and write a children’s travel book about each state. He encouraged me to use this idea for my graduate project… and then pursue it. That’s how the project came to be.
My goal is to make these books educational, but fun at the same time. I don’t want them to replicate an encyclopedia type book- I want kids to be engaged and interested- and want to read them. I plan to include some history of each state, famous people who were born, lived in or currently live in the state, landmarks, interesting places in that state, state foods, and fun things to do and see. The books will have space for children to include their own memorabilia when they visit the states themselves. The U.S. Department of Education found that generally the more students read for fun on their own time, the higher their reading scores.
I have a degree in photography, so I plan to take all the photos that we will put in the books. Nothing would make us happier than to have a child laugh as they learn and then be inspired to want to visit each state. Imagine the stories they will tell!!
Our aim is to promote literacy and instill a sense of adventure in our youth. I want to do my part in helping children develop good reading and writing skills.
If solid reading skills aren't formed during a child's early years, the odds of dropping out down the road increase significantly. Kids who aren't successfully reading at grade level by the third grade are four times less likely to finish high school.
We are using Molly as our mascot to keep things fun for the kids… and we know that kids relate well to dogs. As an added treat, we hope to meet other pug and dog enthusiasts during our travels. I have met so many wonderful pug and other dog owners through social media and we would love to be able to stop and say “hi” while traveling through your state.  We look forward to making many new friends in new places. And… if you want, you can even be a part of our adventure!
We DO need your help!  It’s going to take a lot of money to do this 50 states project… and to print all the books. As any author knows, writing a book is challenging and time consuming. There are 50 books in this series- one book for each state. Since I'll be writing and illustrating 50 books, I made the timeline for this project 3 years. Most of that time will be spent creating these children's books. Please help promote literacy by helping me create this series of books about each state that children can learn from and interact with.  There are rewards offered for making a donation to the campaign. I tried really hard to make the rewards appealing and to fit this project.
 

What We Need 
Our funding goal is $75,000.  This includes:
1) Travel accommodations/food. (I plan to keep this expense as low as possible by staying with friends and family as we travel through different states.
2) Road Trip (automotive expenses/ fuel). Molly and I plan to drive my car as we travel through all 50 states, except for Hawaii. We want to travel by car so we can stop, meet and talk to people on our journey.
3) Photography related equipment (filters, SD cards, etc.) I have professional equipment; however, there might be locations that require special gear. 
4) Publishing and rewards costs (includes publishing expenses, ISBN numbers (for 50 books), printing costs, and money to buy the rewards).
5) Misc. expenses (includes things that are unexpected, like vehicle breakdowns, unanticipated travel expenses, etc...)
$75,000 sounds like a lot of money (even to me), but when we break it down, it is definitely doable. We need only 15,000 people to donate $5.00 each or 7,500 people to donate $10.00 each to reach our goal. That doesn't sound near so bad, huh?
Unique Perks (What you get)
I tried hard to make the rewards fun. Here are some of our unique reward perks:
For $100 donation, you can sign Molly's state bandana. I made Molly a yellow bandana with all the states on it to wear on our trip. The photo of her wearing the bandana will be on the front or back cover of the books WITH YOUR SIGNATURE if you choose this reward.

$500 reward- For a $500 donation, you will get a MEET & GREET with Miss Molly. We will meet you in your state and take your photo with Molly. Molly loves people and she will love to meet you... IF you choose this reward.
$750 reward- For a $750 donation, you will get to SPEND THE DAY WITH MOLLY & I as we travel through your state. You can personally show us places we need to photograph for our books IF you choose this reward.
$5000 reward- For a $5000 donation, you will get THE WHOLE SET OF 50 BOOKS. WOW!! This reward would be great for a school, a daycare, etc...
These are just a few of the unique rewards. 

The Impact
With this project, our aim is to promote literacy, instill a sense of adventure in the kids that read these books and most of all, to entice them to read... and have fun reading about our great country and the places they could travel to.
 
 
Sample Book Cover and Pages 
These are not actual book pages and the book cover, but just samples of what the book pages and cover will look like. The books will be soft cover with perfect binding. Each book will have the title of the state on the cover.
Sample Book Cover:

Sample book page:
Sample book page:

 
 

Risks & Challenges
This is a huge project- a three-year project. There are a lot of things that can go wrong and we know this, but there are also a lot of things that can go right... and we expect this. We have talked to family and friends who live in different states across the U.S. and are prepared to reach out to them if we have troubles. We plan to divide these 50 states into several trips and will take one trip at a time, planned out so we know exactly where we are going. 
For the books, I have previously published children's books and know how to create book pages, templates, etc... for the books. My degree is in photography so I don't expect to have any trouble with the photos that I will take for the books. I don't anticipate too many problems in creating the books. I plan to create the book for a particular state after visiting that state. If you donate and request a certain state book, after I visit that state and create the book, I will send you the reward (the book). You won't have to wait 3 years for the books, unless you are getting the whole set.

Other Ways You Can Help
There are several ways you can help us. First, of course, is to choose a reward and donate. A second way you can help is by sharing this project on your social media sites with your friends and family and then asking them to share it too. A lot of hands makes light work... and a lot of people will help make this project come to life.
Updates
I plan to keep backers who have donated to this project updated weekly on our travel blog. I will also send a personal e-mail once a month to let you know where we have been, what books we have written or are currently working on, what our future travel plans are and when you can expect the rewards. If anything changes in our initial plan, I will update you about the change. I will post photos of our travels through different states so you can follow us on this journey.
Stretch Rewards
IF we make our funding goal of $75,000, our campaign will stay live on Indemand and we will offer stretch rewards for people who donate after our goal is met. The stretch rewards will be your choice of 1 state book and a donation from Candy and Molly to abandoned and mistreated pug organizations.
Our Team
Our team consists mostly of Molly and I. I do have other team members that help behind the scenes, but Molly and I will be the ones traveling and writing these books. We started this book writing adventure several years ago but this will be our biggest project yet. Molly just turned 7 years old and is in excellent health. She loves to travel and meet people and she is a pro when it comes to posing for photos. Here's a photo of me and Miss Molly this last December. We hope to see you on our journey!!

story:
Short Summary

More about myself (Edward van der Merwe):

I am an Engineer by trade, currently completing my maters studies in Industrial Engineering at the University of Stellenbosch. My passion is trail running and spending time in the mountains. I am passionate about social change (especially children), and not just change for the sake of change, but rather sustainable change where individuals and communities experience lasting change. My desire is for people to become the individuals they are meant to be, to step out of the place of fear, to be obedient to the Word of God and the Holy Spirit and to develop and follow Godly desires in those places where they are called to.  

The Campaign

We will raise funds for the One Child, One Backpack initiative towards better education for the children of Semonkong, a little village in Lesotho. This forms part of the bigger mission of the Semonkong Hospital Trust (NGO). On the last weekend of October will we embark on an adventure called the Jonkershoek Transverse. This is a route summiting seven peaks in the Jonkershoek Mountains, near Stellenbosch; the route is just over 30-kilometres in distance with 3,000-metres of elevation gain. There is a rich history to the route, with the earliest attempt recorded in 1963, with the current record standing at 8h 35 min, just indicating the extreme terrain of the route.

The children of Semonkong are in many ways disadvantaged - one of the needs we identified in their lives is the lack of school material. Many schools have no paper or books for the children to write in, let alone a pencil or pen to write with.  The teachers have very limited resources to conduct their classes with, as this is a very rural environment.  Our hearts desire is to fill this gap and provide every child with the opportunity to learn and develop as much as possible in school. Some of the children walk long distances to school. As a team, we would like to raise enough funds to put together a small backpack with a water bottle, lunch box, pencil case, pencil & eraser, crayons and colour pencils.

What We Need & What You Get

You have the opportunity to become part of this vision 'One Child, One Backpack' by equipping every child with his/her own backpack filled with the above items. The price of the backpack, including all the items, will amount to $14 per backpack. We are ministering to approximately a 1000 children, including orphans, through our various efforts of our children's ministry.

The Backpack: 

The Backpack will contain a water bottle, lunch box, pencil case, pencil & eraser, crayons and colour pencils.

Fund raising goal:

  • $13000

The Impact

The Semonkong Hospital Trust is a faith-based, interdenominational, non-profit organisation. The Trust has been implementing a holistic sustainable community development programme since 2005. Our main aim is to erect one of the very first eco-friendly, financially self-sustainable hospitals in the world. The hospital will be built in Semonkong, a town in the central mountain-region of Lesotho. Lesotho is a tiny country in Southern Africa completely landlocked within South Africa. We support the community by sending mission teams on a regular basis to Semonkong. The next multi-disciplinary team will go to Semonkong from 25 November – 7 December and will consist of medical, agricultural, maintenance, children’s ministry, evangelism and bicycle teams.

The One Child One Backpack initiative forms part of the bigger project and will contribute as follow:

  • Give the children the essentials to learn in class.
  • Education is most crucial at an early stage of a child’s development process, and this will enable learning to take place.

Risks & Challenges

Only a quarter of the Jonkershoek Transverse route follows established paths that demands lots of navigational and mountaineering skills to complete. It also requires many scouting trips, not only to familiarise oneself with the route, which in sections is only marked by strategic cairns, but also with the various escape routes. There is no official route description, although most of the route can be deciphered from the individual descriptions offered in “Jonkershoek en sy berge”. It is definitely not for the faint-hearted and few people have done it more than once since the effort has been compared to that of an Ironman event. As always, there are those for whom the challenge is simply irresistible. - As listed on the website FEAT (Fascinating Expedition and Adventure Talks)

story:
How many people in the world don't get the chance to once in life experience the magic of the oceans. Some are lucky to visit a few aquariums, but many just got to see several pictures of the deep seas in a couple lessons during primary and high school. 

We have an ambitious but realistic goal: To make ocean exploration for everyone.  You probably can't afford expensive equipment for a real dive into the ocean, but it's high likely you can be connected to a good internet. 

Our team, Aalto Explorer, started from a university project, at Aalto University, envisions a remote vehicle and a network application – the so-called expedition platform – to be controlled by the community and be made available to any ocean-enthusiasts, casual explorers and life-long learners, sending them on exciting journeys of oceanic exploration on their own terms and at their own pace. 

A team of more than 15 people from multi-disciplines have worked on a voluntary basis for the last two years, to finally produce the third prototype with game-changing features. Dive in our story below for more. We are here, on Indiegogo to day to bring this further to life. We want to build more of the AE system to deploy around the world, so you can learn about our oceans, experience their wonder, right at where you are. 

 

     

    Aalto Explorer is a seamless underwater technology network that makes ocean exploration more accessible and affordable than ever - for you, your friends and family from wherever you are with a working internet connection.

    The system consists of 3 components working together in harmony:

    • Find-X, the Underwater Drone  
    • Floating Module, anchor, communication and power support to Find-X  
    • Aalto Explorer expedition platform, where you access and control the drone through the Internet.

     

    The community and/or experts can organize and book an expedition on one of the FIND-X units deployed around the world. 

     

     

    Take a Demo ride with us as a PASSENGER to get a hang of it: Click at the button below and fill in the Demo's code: PAS1234

     

    Aalto Explorer is not just a drone, it is a community of explorers from all around the world who can plan the expeditions and lead them through Aalto Explorer platform. You can join whether you are a researcher and would like to have a realtime data without leaving the lab. Or you can be the one in control, having thousands of people following your expedition. You can be learning new diving areas, searching for the shipwrecks or just exploring the ocean.
    There is a number of possible applications.


     ​

     

    Aalto Explorer at World Oceans Day, held at Oodi Central Library, Helsinki. 

    No longer is the need for purchasing costly underwater drones and submarines or taking an exorbitant diving trip. The deep sea is within your reach. Aalto Explorer is an underwater network that enables you to explore the ocean right on your device.

     

     

     

     

    FEATURES:

    • Operate at least 50m of  depth
    • Use thrusters for movement, allowing six degrees of freedom. Include one 360° Full HD or 4K livestream video camera with VR function.
    • One or two additional Full HD or 4K video cameras can be added if needed for navigation.
    • Underwater LED lights per each camera's lenses.
    • Sensors: IMU, compass, depth, pressure, temperature, PH, salinity, humidity (inside the ROV) and mic.
    • Vacuum air sealing.
    • The umbilical cord must be detachable.
    • The ROV must be reactive - through sensors- to its environment.
    • They must prevent or alert of any collision derived from a mistake from the Captain user.
    • Have a base that allows the ROV to rest on the ocean floor.
    • A space/grip to attach a hook to pull it back to the surface if the thrusters stop working.

     

     

    FEATURES:

    • Harvest solar energy on lithium batteries for the product operation (floating module and ROV).
    • Store and deploy the ROV while not in use.
    • Operate with a 4G or 5G modem with WiFi capabilities.
    • Waterproof container for all electrical components.
    • Mechanism to release and retract an anchor.
    • Design a mechanism that release and retract the ROV’s umbilical cord while it operates.
    • Integrate a GPS system to track the floating module's location.
    • 360° Full HD or 4K video camera streaming with VR function.
    • Perimetral bumpers to keep the structure safe.
    • Lights and reflectors to locate the module during the night.

     

    The Aalto Explorer Platform is an open ocean exploration community platform. You can find all the expeditions, get tickets to participate, interact with like-minded fellows and show off your marine knowledge. 

     

     

     

    REAL-TIME FOOTAGE OF THE OCEAN’S BIZARRE CREATURES, TREASURES, AND MORE

     

    THE SYSTEM IS UNDER YOUR CONTROL. LEAD THE JOURNEY WITH OTHER OCEAN LOVERS IN YOUR VIRTUAL CRUISE

     

     

    FIND - X has a sensitive microphone, allowing the best recordings of the undersea. Sensors are included to measure temperature, salinity, pH level, and water pressure. The rover has robotic grippers to collect marine samples.

    AFFORDABLE REAL-TIME OCEAN DATA FOR RESEARCHERS

     

     

     

     

    The vastness of the Earth’s oceans - only five percent of which is known.

    What does it mean for us?

     

     

    Oceans cover approximately 70% of our planet’s surface; yet, the majority of our oceanic knowledge lies in the shallower waters. 95% of our oceans remain unexplored, with up to 99% of the seadbeds still kept hidden from our probing curiosity and intellect.

    Unlocking of the mysteries of the deep-sea ecosystems may reveal new alternative sources of medicines, foods, energy and other products for our economic function and daily life.

    Data from deep-ocean exploration can assist earthquake and tsunami prediction and enrich our study of human’s impact on Earth’s environment and how these changes in turn affect us. Access to information from ocean excursions also improves ocean literacy and inspires young people to seek careers in fields such as natural sciences, technology, engineering, etc. relating to the ocean and to get closer to understanding this mysterious, serene yet pulsatingly fierce, wet body of our planet. Reasons to advance the exploration of deep waters are certainly aplenty.

    Just what is hindering humans from exploring the deep seas

     

     

    Harsh undersea conditions aside, explorers are faced with high costs and seriously underfunded (NASA’s annual budget is 1000 times that of NOAA’s ocean exploration in 2019).

    The past decade has seen many projects come into being and fade into oblivion. Ocean science hasn’t quite gained the commercial traction it needs or attracted the kind of money that have instead been poured into drone technologies and space probes. Many projects come to dead ends and their value is eventually only good for an academic paper or two. For instance, bio-inspired robots ranging from Robo-fish, tuna, octopus, turtle to even manta ray have all taken a spin around the water tank, for better and more efficient ocean exploration, only to breathe their last when their grants and funding are up. Such is the fate of the majority of experimental designs.

     

     

    We’re doing crowdfunding on Indiegogo to obtain enough fund to ensure this project will happen! But we don’t want to stop there. We have a lot more we want to add to Aalto Explorer to make the exploration experience even better, and and we need your help to do it!

    For every ticket contributed by backers in Indiegogo campaign for Aalto Explorer project, we will donate 1 passenger ticket to an education institution, to bring ocean experience and knowledge to people all around the world.

     


     

    Aalto Explorer originated from the classroom of the Aalto University Product Development Project (PdP) course back in 2017 as a student project sponsored by the company Aalto Industries. A multidisciplinary team of over 15 experts in the fields of engineering, design and business gathered for an ambitious vision: making everyone an ocean explorer, starting by sending a remotely-controlled underwater vehicle to the Baltic Sea in the summer.

    The team’s focused and intense work has paid off in the form of 2 prototypes, V1.0 and V2.0, and another, most up-to-date prototype V3.0.  AE team has made certain achievements with the first two prototypes and V 2.0 was selected for exhibition at the Dubai Design Week. Yet, V3.0 with its upgrades is a real game-changer. You can read more of the development process at our blog 

     

     

    The Sustainability component is strongly embedded in the design of our Aalto Explorer product-service system and manifests in the following manner:

    Through the product - We design our underwater drone to have a low environmental impact on marine ecosystems. In our latest version, the Find-X is free-floating instead of running tracks on the seafloor as in previous versions, thus having no effect on the seafloor. In addition, the underwater drone is fully powered by solar energy, which is self-sufficient and renewable.

     

     

    Through the service - our system is designed to be accessible to as many people as possible, maximizing product use both by unit and time and eliminating the need for high-volume production. Our Find-X can be enjoyed by thousands of people around the world around the clock, rather than docked for most of the time like privately owned underwater drones. This way we also reduce inequality - making underwater exploration available to the many instead of exclusive to the few who can afford it. 

     

    Visitors at our World Oceans Day

    Aalto Explorer also supports sustainable development goals that encourage sustainable use of the oceans, reduce inequalities, and improve education. We provide a complex solution and new tools for different persons and entities with different interests and needs. 

    It is challenging to come from the grassroots, thus we are calling for support empowerment from other organizations with a voice such as Helsinki Design Week, to create a positive impact on the people and planet on a larger scale. 

     

     

     

    Want to write about us, check out this link, or contact us for more detailed information:

     

    For every ticket contributed by backers in Indiegogo campaign for Aalto Explorer project, we will donate 1 passenger ticket to an education institution, to bring ocean experience and knowledge to people all around the world.

Sensors are included to measure temperature, salinity, pH level, and water pressure. The rover has robotic grippers to collect marine samples.AFFORDABLE REAL-TIME OCEAN DATA FOR RESEARCHERS    The vastness of the Earth’s oceans - only five percent of which is known. What does it mean for us?  Oceans cover approximately 70% of our planet’s surface; yet, the majority of our oceanic knowledge lies in the shallower waters. 95% of our oceans remain unexplored, with up to 99% of the seadbeds still kept hidden from our probing curiosity and intellect.Unlocking of the mysteries of the deep-sea ecosystems may reveal new alternative sources of medicines, foods, energy and other products for our economic function and daily life.Data from deep-ocean exploration can assist earthquake and tsunami prediction and enrich our study of human’s impact on Earth’s environment and how these changes in turn affect us. Access to information from ocean excursions also improves ocean literacy and inspires young people to seek careers in fields such as natural sciences, technology, engineering, etc. relating to the ocean and to get closer to understanding this mysterious, serene yet pulsatingly fierce, wet body of our planet. Reasons to advance the exploration of deep waters are certainly aplenty.Just what is hindering humans from exploring the deep seas  Harsh undersea conditions aside, explorers are faced with high costs and seriously underfunded (NASA’s annual budget is 1000 times that of NOAA’s ocean exploration in 2019).The past decade has seen many projects come into being and fade into oblivion. Ocean science hasn’t quite gained the commercial traction it needs or attracted the kind of money that have instead been poured into drone technologies and space probes. Many projects come to dead ends and their value is eventually only good for an academic paper or two. For instance, bio-inspired robots ranging from Robo-fish, tuna, octopus, turtle to even manta ray have all taken a spin around the water tank, for better and more efficient ocean exploration, only to breathe their last when their grants and funding are up. Such is the fate of the majority of experimental designs.  We’re doing crowdfunding on Indiegogo to obtain enough fund to ensure this project will happen! But we don’t want to stop there. We have a lot more we want to add to Aalto Explorer to make the exploration experience even better, and and we need your help to do it!For every ticket contributed by backers in Indiegogo campaign for Aalto Explorer project, we will donate 1 passenger ticket to an education institution, to bring ocean experience and knowledge to people all around the world.  Aalto Explorer originated from the classroom of the Aalto University Product Development Project (PdP) course back in 2017 as a student project sponsored by the company Aalto Industries. A multidisciplinary team of over 15 experts in the fields of engineering, design and business gathered for an ambitious vision: making everyone an ocean explorer, starting by sending a remotely-controlled underwater vehicle to the Baltic Sea in the summer.The team’s focused and intense work has paid off in the form of 2 prototypes, V1.0 and V2.0, and another, most up-to-date prototype V3.0.  AE team has made certain achievements with the first two prototypes and V 2.0 was selected for exhibition at the Dubai Design Week. Yet, V3.0 with its upgrades is a real game-changer. You can read more of the development process at our blog   The Sustainability component is strongly embedded in the design of our Aalto Explorer product-service system and manifests in the following manner:Through the product - We design our underwater drone to have a low environmental impact on marine ecosystems. In our latest version, the Find-X is free-floating instead of running tracks on the seafloor as in previous versions, thus having no effect on the seafloor. In addition, the underwater drone is fully powered by solar energy, which is self-sufficient and renewable.  Through the service - our system is designed to be accessible to as many people as possible, maximizing product use both by unit and time and eliminating the need for high-volume production. Our Find-X can be enjoyed by thousands of people around the world around the clock, rather than docked for most of the time like privately owned underwater drones. This way we also reduce inequality - making underwater exploration available to the many instead of exclusive to the few who can afford it.  Visitors at our World Oceans DayAalto Explorer also supports sustainable development goals that encourage sustainable use of the oceans, reduce inequalities, and improve education. We provide a complex solution and new tools for different persons and entities with different interests and needs. It is challenging to come from the grassroots, thus we are calling for support empowerment from other organizations with a voice such as Helsinki Design Week, to create a positive impact on the people and planet on a larger scale.    Want to write about us, check out this link, or contact us for more detailed information: For every ticket contributed by backers in Indiegogo campaign for Aalto Explorer project, we will donate 1 passenger ticket to an education institution, to bring ocean experience and knowledge to people all around the world.

story:
Aloades Ecosystem

Dear friends,

We are Dimitris and Evi, a couple of olive growers from Central Greece at the foot of Mount Ossa. For many years we had been living and working in the city, at desk jobs, away from anything that had to do with nature.

So, during the years of the crisis, we thought to turn to something that we have loved since we were kids, the cultivation of olive trees. We want to continue what we had as recourse when we were kids. A big part of our childhood memories comes from the cultivation of olive trees. The generation of our fathers may be gone in a few years but the generation of our children is already here. Therefore, we need to act as a bridge between what is leaving, what we are and what we will leave.

Staring out at the horizon of the slopes of Ossa with the forms of the Aloades, the mythical giants, whose legend we were scared of when we were kids, we are starting the revival of our estate. We take daily care of our trees, our old stone oil press, our stone-built courtyard, trying to do everything as it was done in the past. We produced our own olive oil from the sunny part of the estate, full of aromas and light. We planted new trees, we took care of the old wild olive trees and we paved the way so that our olive oil becomes known outside of Greece. We are now planning the complete revival of our farm and we are inviting every one of you so that we can create together our own traditional ecosystem.

We know how to cultivate the olive trees, how to weave baskets to pick the olives, to create pots to store our precious olive oil. We make soaps based on olive oil and wild herbs that grow in our farm. We have a vision to offer you a biodynamic, ecological, traditional ecosystem, full of outdoor activities, aromas of herbs, flavours of olive oil, traditional constructions in the shadow of the mythical giants Aloades.

We do believe in all people’s assistance in saving forgotten arts, traditional cultivation methods, cooking recipes by making our ecosystem a place of revival of all these. Our ecological ecosystem will be free of any chemical or plastic non-recyclable material and its main orientation will be the aid in the study of the olive trees in the fight against the climate change that has started to appear in the Mediterranean basin as well.

With your help, our ecosystem will offer to every visitor, with priority given to kids and young people, contact with nature, ecology, the Mediterranean diet, the cultivation of olive trees and all activities surrounding it. We are open to any proposal that would improve the activities and the actions of our ecosystem. We will immediately focus in working with ecosystems of corresponding orientation all around the world, with love for natural life, the mankind, the environment, forgotten cottage industries and the maintenance of a sustainable planet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Take part in our project by helping us deliver the message!

Many small actions can add up to a great change !

Learn more about our campaign through the following video:

story:
Our Story

Recently, high school students are applying to more and more colleges at a time. We believe that treating college applications as a number game is counterproductive. Admissions officers like applicants who understand and fit the campus culture. Shadowing a current college student through her typical day on campus offers valuable insight into fit and campus culture. Our founders have personally been asked by family members and friends to show them around campus. Now we want to expand this opportunity to more people, so that everyone, even those not as well-connected, can preview college life firsthand through our 1-on-1 immersive tours.

What We Need & What You Get

We are preparing to launch our official website in the summer of 2021.

  • 1/3 of the funding will go toward marketing, advertising, and community outreach
  • 1/3 of the funding will go toward our dedicated and hardworking interns as stipends
  • 1/3 of the funding will go toward covering our website construction cost, maintenance, and software applications 

To make our vision a reality, obtaining the necessary funding to scale is essential. As a contributor, you or your child will receive a FREE campus tour with no expiration date at any college and host of your choosing. 

The Impact

With admissions to elite colleges becoming more and more competitive, it is crucial to customize each school’s application and demonstrate interest and fit. IvyScope helps you find the right colleges through immersive tours, so you can focus your energy on fewer applications and personalize your essays to stand out from the crowd.

Risks & Challenges

Covid-19 has disrupted the entire campus visit market and IvyScope is working hard to implement personalized virtual tours at an affordable price as an option for high school students. 

Please Share!

We believe that our idea can revolutionize the entire campus tour experience and allow students to make informed college decisions. Please let us help by sharing this unique opportunity to others!

story:
Life Lessons Project – Lesson 2: Finding Your Passion & Purpose.

Most of us go through life in a fog or without any direction trying to make sense of it all by trial and error, following societal norms, or are given a path not of our choosing.  For most of us, Life chooses where we go instead of us choosing where we want, need, or should go.  This all stems from the confusion that comes from not knowing who we are or what motivates us.

Many settle for whatever that comes their way, rather than pursuing well thought out goals based on self-realization of they're choices, values, or needs. They end up feeling that life has no meaning, satisfaction, purpose. Which leads them to feel trapped, de-motivated, and without any drive to live up to their full potential.

We all eventually make this self discovery but for most this self discovery comes too late to have any meaningful impact in their life or legacy. The precious little time we all get is consumed by discovery instead of action, achievement, or in pursuit of our full development.

With your help, I aim to streamline and prioritize the discovery stage to assist the reader figure out, on their own terms who they are and who they want to be. Where they are and where they should be going. Proper assessment in this stage can have immense benefits to an individual's life giving lasting meaning and contentment as well as benefiting all of humanity.

My name is M.I. Seka and I’m an impassioned Motivational Life author. I have extensive experience in management, sales, finance, and motivation.  In my career and life I've studied extensively and passionately what & why some people attain great success, happiness, motivation, and contentment while others fizzle and never come close to reaching their full potential. The answer to this question is simple as it is complex, for everyone of us is unique with our own hopes and fears.

I've written several books that can be found on Amazon and misekabooks.com, that help readers find insight and motivation by enlightening them to what other successful people before them have come to know.

In these books, I assist readers in discovering their own inspiration and personal values without spelling it out for them.  I present information in a way that the reader, themselves can then extract the insight needed based on
their own needs, wants, and unique life perspective to achieve some sort of enlightenment, inspiration, motivation, and/or success.

The Project

I’m currently working on a book about discovering an individual's true passion and purpose in life.  Finding who they are, what motivates or excites them, and what courses of action they should take to further their talents and development.  This book will be written in a way to help extract the map that is already within everyone, known by every cell of their being, and to bring that map into their consciousness.

Clarifying personal values, internal needs, wants, desires, skills, and abilities are a critical first step toward understanding an individual's own definition of success and or failure and finding a more meaningful and fulfilling life. 

The combination of these are highly individual, therefore cannot be painted with one brush or taught, they must be drawn out.  Clarifying who you are makes you resilient like a storm-lashed tree with deep roots during a heavy storm which we call life.

Knowledge without motivation/action is useless, which is why my writing style advocates motivation, inspiration, and above all, action to help the readers reach their highest potential with the ultimate goal using your gifts in helping their fellow beings, environment, and future generations.

Risks & Challenges

Although the subject matter/book is extremely important to produce to aid current and future peoples gain an insight into who they are, what motivates them, and how to use that insight/talent to help them and the world around them.  I'm finding it very difficult given my current schedule and responsibility to complete this book in a timely manner, as I’m working full time 6 days a week. I find myself stretched to my limits and am unable to give this project the attention and urgency it requires.

Due to financial and time limitations, I'm asking you to help me raise $75,000 to aid me in my quest.  I’m willing to put my career and life on hold to ensure a quality manuscript, meaning I would like to commit full time to produce this very important manuscript that can be of immense help to people, current and future all over the world. This is a fraction of what I need but will be investing a lot of my own resources as well.

If I am successful in reaching the funding goal, I plan on finishing this project by the end of 2016. Given my experience with past manuscripts I've written, I don't foresee any significant obstacles to completing this book in a timely manner. I've been very careful to budget the right amount of time and resources at every step of the production process from research, writing, pre-launch marketing, editing, rewriting, editing, completion, production, post launch sales and marketing.

How will the money by used

The funds will be used for the research, production, as well as marketing of the book. 

Producing a quality non-fiction manuscript is not cheap. Vast amount of resources needs to be invested in research, design, publishing, and most importantly marketing. Each step requires costly professional expertise and a talented team to bring the information to life and to the public.

Research will be the most time consuming. Writing comes easily to me as I'm very motivated, inspired, and very passionate about this subject matter as well as this project. Writing will also consume a majority of my time as editing and re-writing are painstaking and costly.

By far the biggest cost will be marketing. I intend to get this book into the hands of as many people as possible, even if I have to give it away.

Making money is not the goal of this project. Enlightening humanity is! Pushing humanity into a direction that will benefit us all is! With me it has never been about the money but about the mark I leave.

This book would make a great guide for middle or high schools students or just about anyone confused on who they are, where they are, and where they want to go in life. As such this will be marketed towards these demographics.

Reward Tiers

There are several reward tiers detailed below to entice crowd funders like you to help push human kind forward in a direction that will benefit us all. Your gift will bring us that much closer to helping people all over the world reach their highest potential and using that passion, power, and purpose to help all of humanity.

$100 Donation = A Personal Thank You and a Free E-Book copy of the Book.

$500 Donation = A Personal Thank You, a Free E-Book & Print copy of the Book.

$1,000 Donation = A Personal Thank You, a Free E-Book & a signed Print copy of the Book, and a Mention in the attribution section.

$5,000 Donation = A Personal Thank You, a Free E-Book & a signed Print copy of the Book, a Mention in the attribution section & Chapter Dedication.

$10,000 Donation = A Personal Thank You, a Free E-Book & a signed Print copy of the Book, a Mention in the attribution section, a Chapter Dedication & an advertising page in the E-Book version.
